title: Step Toward Cuba
description: The United States has taken an overdue first step toward restoring normal economic relations with Cuba. Although the measures announced yesterday lift restrictions only on trade with Havana that is carried on through third countries, they are important of themselves and they ought to help prepare the climate for restoration of direct economic and commercial links between this country and the Castro regime.

Nixon's White House documents and tapes must be guided by a recognition that the materials at issue are not the ordinary records of a former President. These include evidence of the improper and often illegal actions that forced Mr. Nixon to resign in order to avoid impeachment.

description: In the Municipal Building, where 5,000 people work days and, in the city's current fiscal turmoil, the Budget Bureau's lights burn late, a special security force has been in operation for four months. title: FORD CALLS PLAN ON ENERGY VAGUE
description: VAIL, Colo., Aug. 22President Ford certainly has not made the decision to ask Congress to create a quasipublic corporation empowered to underwrite up to $100billion of investments in energy projects, the White House declared today.

title: Police and Fire Service in San Francisco Is Normal After Strike
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 22Police and fire protection, as well as political bickering, returned to normal here today after the sudden end last night of the threedayold strike of emergency services.

title: SCOTTS LOSE MOVE TO KILL SUBPOENA
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Aug. 22 (UPI)A judge cleared the way today for a Federal grand jury to question two witnesses the Government hopes will help them to find Patricia Hearst.

title: Soviet Welcomes Easing Of U.S. Ban on Cuba Trade
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 22 (Reuters) The Soviet Union welcomed today the easing of United States restrictions on trade with Cuba and urged that the trade embargo be fully lifted.

title: Portuguese From Angola Face Bleak Homecoming
description: GONDOMAR, Portugal, Aug. 21It's a bitter homecoming for the Portuguese refugees from Angola: There is no room for them, no work and not much hope.

title: Contract Award
description: A $210million contract has been awarded by the General Services Administration to the International Business Machines Corporation. The contract covers renewals of rental agreements for computer equipment previously installed at Government facilities as well as the purchase certain equipment previously rented.

title: Lisbon's Leftist Premier Reported Refusing to Quit
description: LISBON, Aug. 22Premier Vasco Gonalves was reported today to have stiffened his resolve to fight to keep his post against the pressure of a majority of the political and military forces in Portugal.

title: Drier Lack Perils Paper Output
description: For want of a machine part, tissue paper may be lost.

title: Peronist Guerrillas Set Off Blast And Damage Argentine Frigate
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 22Leftwing Peronist guerrillas set off explosive charges today beneath the water line of an Argentine Navy missile frigate that was under construction and damaged her.

title: TWO CONGRESSMEN SEEK TO AID CITY
description: Gestures aimed at helping New York City through its cur rent fiscal tribulations are being made by some of the politicians who represent the city in Washington.

title: Court Delays Imposing Ban On Tariff for Imported Oil
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22 (UPI) The United States Court of Appeals has given the Administration more time to appeal its decision that a tariff on imported oil is illegal.

title: Fagel Victor in Final
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L.I., Aug. 22Ricky Fagel of Miami won the Port Washington satellite tennis tournament today by defeating Fernando Gentil of 13razil, 61 60, at the Port Washington Tennis Academy.

title: BANGLADESH COUP: A DAY OF KILLINGS
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, Aug. 22 Authoritative sources said today that the young officers who led the coup against Sheik Mujibur Rahman killed him and more than 20 members of his family and political associates, then lost out during a showdown with the new leader and went back to their barracks.

title: Rabin Reassures Israelis on Sinai Accord
description: salem regained its calm. After sunset, a large group of demonstrators held a quiet prayer meeting in front of the Premier's downtown residence Mr. Rabin's televised remarks, in the form of an interview, shed little light on the tenor of the more than four hours of discussions between Mr. Kissinger's party and the Israeli negotiating team. The Premier's aides were equally guarded.

title: Back to Bach
description: Once in a very great while, the fundamental credo licensed broadcastingthe airwaves belong to the publicproves true in practice, Thanks to a devoted band of classical music listeners, WNCNFM will return to the radio dial on Monday with Bach instead of rock.

title: SEPARATISTS KILL 2 IN CORSICAN CLASH
description: BASTIA, Corsica, Aug. 22 (Reuters)Fifty armed Corsican separatists, who took over a wine depot near here yesterday, seized six hostages early today and killed two policemen in a gun battle before surrendering.

title: Ecologists and Economists Divided on Energy Parks
description: ARARAT, Pa.Benjamin Spielman, who retired here from the Bronx, N.Y., a couple of years ago, leaned back in his wellused lawn chair, gazed out at the Pocono Mountain landscape around his cozy little house, and tried to recall how he felt when he first heard about it.

title: Miss Wade, Mrs. Court Gain at Net
description: HARRISON, N.Y., Aug. 22 Emitting catlike screeches as her shots went out of bounds or into the net, the usually tranquil Virginia Wade won a strenuous battle with Pam Teeguarden today in the quarterfinals of the MediQuik Women's Tennis Classic.

title: Books of The Times
description: Whatever its limitations as modern scholarly inquiry probes deeper into esoteric fields, the discipline of the traditional scientific method has proved invaluable restraint upon the excessive enthusiasm of true believers. Some of today's most original and serious thinking depends upon a willingness to suspend or at least make loose with basic canons of scientific proceduredemands for exact measurement, for instance, or public verification and demonstrable repeatability of experiments. Those investigators who ask for this greater license make strong arguments for needing it, but they should be the first to realize how vulnerable they then become to the gullibility of their more eager students and, perhaps, themselves.

title: .A.A. Accepts Steep Turn SST Will Need at Kennedy
description: The Federal Aviation Administration, after tests in France, has approved as safe a steep banking turn that the Concorde supersonic jet would need to take at Kennedy International Airport to meet noise limits.

title: STOCKS ADVANCE IN QUIET TRADING
description: Prices moved higher in quiet trading yesterday on the New York Stock Exchange as bargain hunters, buying blue chip issues, continued to prop the list in the wake of a sharp twoday decline earlier in the week.

title: Virus Mixing Cited As Possible Cause Of Flu Epidemics
description: VANCOUVER, B. C., Aug. 22  Recent laboratory experiments have lent support to the theory that global epidemics of influenza occur after an entirely new flu virus is created by the natural recombining of fragments of virus strains from human beings, other mammals and birds.

title: U.S. Bars 5 From Ireland Seeking to Attend Parley
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22 (Reuters)  The United States has refused entry to five Irish delegates to a weeklong conference on Irish affairs to be held next week in Amherst, Mass., State Department officials reported today.

title: Seaver Earns 18th Victory As Mets Defeat Giants, 64
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 22Even though he was given a fiverun lead before he went to the mound, Tom Seaver needed Bob Apodaca's help tonight to post his 18th victory of the season, a 64 decision for the New York Mets over the San Francisco Giants.

title: Grim Namibian Portent
description: The assassination of the chief minister of Ovamboland points up once again the perils of drift and delay finding a political solution for Namibia (SouthWest Africa) acceptable to its 850,000 inhabitants. Indications are that Chief Philemon Elifas was slain by Ovambo adamantly opposed to his support for South Africa's plan of fragmenting the mineralrich but sparsely populated territory into nominally selfgoverning tribal homelands.

title: Sports Today
description: Drag Racing, at National Speedway, Center Moriches, LI., 8 P.M.

title: Steelers Rout Colts, 31 to 10
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 22 (AP) Terry Bradshaw tossed three touchdown passes, including bombs of 49 and 54 yards to Lynn Swann, and led the Pittsburgh Steelers to a 3110 victory over the Baltimore Colts tonight in a National Football League exhibition game.

title: In Memnriam
description: BUSLIKAdolph. Cherished memories of our dearly beloved father, grandfather, greatgrandfather on Ms birthday. JACOBSONJack. In memory of My father who departed on Aug. 23. 1964 IRWIN KLEINMANWilliam,. In loving memory, TULA.

title: American League
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES New York 5, California 2. Baltimore 8, Texas 5.

title: RABIN REASSURES ISRAELIS ON PACT
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 22Premier Yitzhak Rabin, hours after Secretary of State Kissinger left for Egypt, assured the anxious Israeli public tonight that the impending interim agreement with Egypt would commit both nations not to resort to force.

title: The NurseMidwife: Now MiddleIncome women Seek Her Out
description: Middleincome women are turning in growing numbers to an experimental private midwifery, service at Roosevelt Hospital because they say they are dissatisfied with the insensitivity of male obstetricians and high doctor's fees and because they believe the nursemidwives will give them a higher quality of care.

title: P.S,C, AIDE URGES PHONERATE RISE
description: A Public Service Commission examiner recommended yesterday a $280million increase in revenues to the New York Telephone Company that would make long conversations and oalls between 9 A.M. and 9 P.M. on weekdays more costly..

title: McCarthy Aide Says Audit Is Not Authorized by Law
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22Eugene J. McCarthy's Presidential campaign chairman protested today the Federal. Election Commission's reported plan to audit his campaign financial records, arguing that an audit was not proper snce Mr. McCarthy is an independent and ineligible for Federal election funds.

title: Coast Mass Transit Hailed Despite Woes
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 22The free shuttle bus that carries students from the hilly University of California campus at Berkeley to the Bay Area Rapid Transit line has been neatly dubbed. Humphrey GoBart.

title: Ecologists and Economists Divided on Energy Parks
description: ARARAT, Pa. 11Benjamin Spielman, who retired here from the Bronx, N.Y., a couple of years ago, leaned back in his wellused lawn chair, gazed out at the Pocono Mountain landscape around his cozy little house, and tried to recall how he felt when he first heard about it.

title: SWISS BANK ACTS TO SPUR ECONOMY
description: In an effort to lift Switzerland out of its recession, the Swiss National Bank announced yesterday a cut of onehalf of one percentage point in the country's key lending rate.

title: Moscow Fears Bangladesh May Look to Peking
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 22  The Kremlin, in its first substantial reaction to last week's coup in Bangladesh, hinted today that it was concerned that the overthrow of Sheik Mujibur Rahman might swing her away from the Soviet Union and toward China.

title: Syria and Jordan Join in a PoliticalMilitary Pact;
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Aug. 22 (Reuters)Syria and Jordan announced today that they had formed a supreme command to direct political and military action against Israel.

title: A 23% FARE RISE FOR E.I.R.R. SEEN
description: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority has decided on fare increases on the Lone Ilsland Rail Road, averaging 231 per cent, effective Sept. 1.

title: Morton Will Start Game Against Jets
description: Between trying to figure out Joe Namath's status for tomorrow's game against the Jets, the Giants got an eyeful of another worldly figure yesterday, Miss Universe.

title: New State Guidelines Are Issued On the Handling of Young Deer
description: Admitting to faulty policies and poor judgment in its removal of two pet deer who later died, the Department of Environmental Conservation yesterday issued new guidelines for its handling of young deer in the care of private citizens.

title: POLICE YIELD A BIT ON KENNEDY INQUIRY
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 22 (UPI) Officials backed down a bit yesterday in their resolve to keep police files on the Robert F. Kennedy assassination sealed, agreeing to answer written questions about the 1968 shooting and the ensuing police investigation.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: The Madison Gas and Elec?? Company said yesterday it had filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission in connection with a proposed public offering of 600,000 common shares. The offering will be managed by underwriters headed by White, Weld & Co., Inc., and Robert M. Baird & Co., Inc.

title: Judges Stay Indianapolis Busing Order
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 22 (UPI)A Federal appeals court order today stayed an order requiring the public schools of Indianapolis and eight suburban systems to bus pupils to desegregate schools at the start of the coming school year.

title: RABIN REASSURES ISRAELIS ON PACT
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 22Premier Yitzhak Rabin, hours after Secretary of State Kissinger left for Egypt, assured the anxious Israeli public tonight that the impending interim agreement with Egypt would commit both nations not to resort to force.

title: Hunter Wins 17th, Ends Slump by Yankees, 52
description: Thursday night it was shoe polish. Last night, pine tar. Who knows, Manager Billy Martin may yet turn to resin bags and chalk dust to shake up the enemy and get the Yankees winning.

title: Dollar Ends Mixed In Trading Abroad; Inflation Rise Cited
description: BRUSSELS, Aug. 22 (UPI)The dollar, undercut early to. day by reports of doubledigit inflation in the United States closed the week on a mixed note.

title: When Pirates Are at Home, Even Reds Can Be Beaten
description: The Pittsburgh Pirates, who had lost 11 of 13 games before returning home earlier this week, continued their successful stand in  Three Rivers Stadium last night.

title: Mothers Win Abortion Plea
description: CONCORD, N.H., Aug. 22 (AP)State welfare officials were ordered today by a federal judge to pay for the abortions of two welfare mothers. United States District Court Judge Hugh H. Bownes issued temporary injunctions after a hearing on complaints brought by a 17yearold Manchester woman and a 20yearold Dover resident, each the mother of one child.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: A DAY FOR DANCING

description: HEINZ It. BIEL, individually ??? formerly partnership of Peyton H. Knight, John R. McDonnell, Robert P. Mahuske, William G. Falzon, Peter Mcgee, Joseph A. Rerangela, estate of Andrew Williams and Herrz H. Biel, formerly doing business as Frnduet, Deetian & Co., 160 East 38 St., N.Y.Liabilities, $686,71110; assets, $40,058.

title: SUCREST BARRING PRICE GUARANTEE
description: The Sucrest Corporation, major sugar refiner, is advising customers that it is unable to guarantee selling prices of refined sugar because of volatile world prices for raw sugar, the company said yesterday, according to Reuters. An announcement added that, effective immediately, the company's selling price for refined sugar would be based on the price at the time of shipment.

title: Detroit's School Dilemma
description: A Federal judge's refusal to order the busing of great numbers of Detroit's public school pupils, though sharply criticized by civil rights leaders, seems to us much more deserving of the description, very reasonable, which was applied to it by Cornelius Golightly, Detroit's school board president, who is himself black.

title: KENT STATE CASE IS INJURY'S HANDS
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 22A Federal jury of six men and six women began deliberations today in the $46million civil damage suit that grew out of the Kent State University campus shootings that killed four students and wounded nine others five years ago. The jurors returned to their hotel after failing to reach a verdict after five hours and were to resume deliberations tomorrow.

title: A Peace Corps for Henry
description: JERUSALEMHenry Kissinger's return to this famous ancient city marked his second anniversary since designation as Secretary of State and the Israeli Government's gift is agreement to what it calls a United States peace corps established in the Sinai passes and evacuation a those strategic barriers in exchange. This will allow a new interim stage in the slow march to settlement of the Middle East war.

title: Frisco Follies
description: When the nation's mayors were holding their gloomy annual conference in Boston last month, none was more emphatic than San Francisco's Mayor Joseph L. Alioto in urging his colleagues to save their cities from disaster by being tough in police and fire strikes. His prescriptions included mandatory dismissal for all strikers public safety jobs. In those emergency categories, you simply cannot fool around with a strike, he said.

title: SHOP TALK
description: Crafts books still pour from the presses by the carload, a testament to the assumption that legions of people will continue to use their leisure to make things.

title: Bridge:
description: The great majority of experts in top tournament play now use the negative double, meaning that a double of an overcall is for takeout and not, as one would expect; for penalties. But there is wide disagreement about the level at which such action should be abandoned.

title: Canada Shifts From Oil Seller to Buyer
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 22The security of oil riches is fading fast for. Canada, with potentially severe effects in the United States as well.

title: For Cities, No Single Problem or Solution
description: WASHINGTONThere is a danger that the current, and justifiable, preoccupation with New York City finances by observers of the urban scene will cause them to overgeneralize. New York's fiscal ills have been chronicled in depth and classified in full. But New York's problems are not those of every city. For urbanpolicymakers, the cardinal fact about United States cities is that they are different:

title: Ima Hogg a Heart Victim
description: LONDON, Aug. 22 (AP) Ima Hogg, prominent Texas: philanthropist, died here Tuesday from natural causes not related to a fall she suffered a [week earlier, a United States Embassy spokesman said today. An autopsy report showed that Miss Hogg, who was 93 years old, died of a heart attack due to atheroma, an arterial disease.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Premier Vasco Gongalves of Portugal reportedly stiffened his resolve to fight to keep his post against, the pressure of majority of the country's political and military forces. The move to force him out ran into further snags as two factions of the armed forces that had agreed last Tuesday on a common platform to replace him suddenly developed disagreements of an undisclosed nature. [Page 1, Columns 67.]

title: People in Sports
description: In a statement issued early yesterday, members of the Minnesota Vikings demanded the resignation of Ed Garvey, the executive director of the National Football League Players Association. Ed White, the Vikings player representative, made the announcement.

title: U. S. Blocks Union of Copper Range With Amax
description: Four days before the shareholders of the Copper Range Company were to meet to consider a merger with Amax, Inc., the Department of Justice informed the companies yesterday that it opposed the merger.

title: A Surge in U.S. Aid Expected to Speed Work at W aterPollutionControl Sites
description: TRENTON, Aug. 22State officials expect the pace of construction on local and regional projects for waterpollution control to pick up over the next two years because ora mounting release of Federal funds and increased state efforts to get the projects out to bid.

title: Andrew E. Svenson, 65, a Writer Bobbseys andliardys, Dies
description: Andrew E. Svenson, a bestselling prolific writer whose name was largely unknown to the public, died of cancer at St. Barnabas Medical Center in Livingston, N.J., on Thursday evening. Ha was 65 years old and lived in West Caldwell, N.J.

title: Encephalitis Victim Dies
description: MOLINE, Ill., Aug. 22 (UPI) A second death suspected of haying been caused by sleeping sickness spread by mosquitoes was reported today by the authorities at Lutheran hospital here. Lester Bauhmler, 83 years old, of Silvis. Ill., died yesterday of of suspected encephalitis. The Rock Island Public Health Department warned residents to take precautions against mosquitoes.

title: Asian Bloc Seeks Extension Of Efforts on Offshore Oil
description: TOKYO, Aug. 22 (AP)Seven Asian nations agreed today, to extend their offshort oil and mineral survey efforts into deeper waters in the hopes of finding additional resources.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22 (AP)Within 24 hours of the United States announcement of a liberalized Cuban trade policy, more than 30 American companies made telephone inquiries to the State Department seeking additional information. Nonetheless, officials expressed doubt that the new policy would have a substantial impact on Cuban trading patterns.

title: Reflections of an Octogenarian
description: Like every American of my age, I was born into a heritage of freedom so great and so deeply rooted that we took it for granted like the air we breathed or the circulation of our blood.

title: Crowded Port Area on Timor Reported Under Mortar Fire
description: LISBON, Aug. 22 (Reuters)Mortar fire today struck the port area of Dili, Portuguese Timor, where more than 1,000 Portuguese refugees are crowded waiting to escape from the island's civil war, the state radio said here today.

title: U.S., French Trotters Rated Main Foes
description: WESTBURY, Aug. 22 Del Miller drove Tarport Hap to a 6length victory last night at Saratoga Raceway, played golf at Alexandria Bay, N.Y., today and will drive Delmonica Hanover tomorrow night in the $200,000 Roosevelt International Trot at Roosevelt Raceway.

title: DR. JAMES A. HARRISON
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 22 (AP) Dr. James A. Harrison, retired professor of biology at Temple University, died yesterday at the age of 72.

title: L.I. FAIR AND FOWL ATTRACT THRONGS
description: BAYPORT, L.I., Aug. 22Bob and Valerie Petrosini of Roslyn Heights, and their 19monthold daughter Donna had never been to an oldfashioned country fair before, and today they got their opportunity.

title: Long Beach Swimmers Set World Relay Mark
description: KANSAS CITY, Kans., Aug. 22 (AP)The Long Beach, Calif., Swim Club broke the world record in the men's 800meter freestyle relay tonight in 7 minutes 30.54 seconds.

title: U.S. Women's Four Advances in Rowing
description: NOTTINGHAM, England, Aug. 22The second round of the world rowing championships ended today with the American women creating the biggest stir of the regatta. Lightly regarded before the competition began yesterday, the American women have been finishing ahead of the perennially powerful Eastern European teams in race after race.

title: Prince Sihanouk Leaves Pyongyang for Peking
description: PEKING, Aug. 22 (Agence FrancePresse)  Prince Norodom Sihanouk of Cambodia left Pyongyang, North Korea, today with Khieu Samphan, Deputy Premier of Cambodia, on a special train for Peking.

title: SAM M' GEE, 81, DEAD; GRAND OLE OPRY STAR
description: NASHVILLE, Aug. 22(AP) Sam McGee, the oldest memi ber of the Grand Ole Opry, died yesterday of injuries suffered when he was run over by a tractor on his 400acre Williamson County farm. He was 81 years old.

title: Optimistic Kissinger and Sadat Meet
description: ALEXANDRIA, Egypt, Aug. 22Secretary of State Kissinger flew here today for talks with President Anwar elSadat of Egypt on resolving differences between Israel and Egypt.

title: Air Traffic Control Is Automated
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22For traffic control at an air terminal, the Lockheed Electronics Company has built a system that automatically keeps track of as many as 256 aircraft simultaneously, displaying their identity and altitudes on screens before the controllers. Patent 3,900,846 was granted this week to Burt Heacock, chief scientist; Richard Lipnick, chief engineer for air traffic control, and fwo other staff members at the company's plant in Plainfield, N. J.

title: K.A.C. SAYS STATE MUST SUPERVISE CITY'S BORROWING
description: Governor Carey and Mayor Beame were told by the Municipal Assistance Corporation yesterday that some form of state supervision of the city's borrowing and management functions must be established if the city is to avert a default.

title: Geiberger Lifts Lead To 2 Strokes at 134
description: FORT WORTH, Aug. 22Tall, skinny Al Geiberger extended his lead to two strokes today in the golf tournament he almost did not enter, the Tournament Players Championship.

title: F.B.I. Studies Criminal Intent of Drug Doses at V.A. Hospital
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Aug. 22The acting medical chief of staff of the Veterans Hospital here said today that tests had shown that a number of patients at the hospital were given doses of Pavulon, a muscle relaxant that can cause paralysis or death.

title: Virus Mixing Cited As Possible Cause Of Flu Epidemics
description: VANCOUVER, B.C., Aug. 22 Recent laboratory experiments have lent support to the theory that global epidemics of influenza occur after an entirely new flu virus is created by the natural recombining of fragments of virus strains from human beings, other mammals and birds.

title: Bonn Pilot Lost in Crash
description: BONN, Aug. 22 (AP) A search was on today for one pilot and another was rescued after two West German Starfighter jets collided off the North Sea coast, the Defense Ministry reported. The crash brought to 175 the number of such Americandesigned jets lost by the West German armed forces since they began using the plane in 1965.

title: Ashe Defeats Fillol
description: CHESTNUT HILL, MASS. Aug, 22 Arthur Ashe overcame the aggressive challenges of Jaime Fillol of Chile tonight and won 64, 62, in the third round of the United States pro tennis championship.

title: PORTUGAL SEEKING MORE REFUGEE AID
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 22United Nations officials announced today that Portugal had asked increased support from the world body for the evacuation, of refugees from Angola.

title: Boy, 11, Tells Panel of Adoption Efforts
description: An 11yearold boy told yesterday at a Congressional hearing how he had been shuttled from institutions to foster homes and back to his mother. who he said beat him, and of going before eight different judges in a twoyear perod in an unsuccessful efford to be freed for adoption.

title: CONVENTION VOTE VEXES DEMOCRATS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22Behind the publicized uncertainty about New York or Los Angeles as a Democratic National Convention site next summer lies the deepdown perplexity of a. 20member committee that must make the final choice next Wednesday.

title: RICHARD SOLLENBERGER
description: Richard T. Sollenberger, professor emeritus of phychology and education at Mount Holyoke College, died Thursday evening in South Hadley, Mass. He was 68 years old.

title: New Housing Here in 75 May Drop to Postwar Low
description: The pace of housing construction in the city is plunging this year to what is likely to be its lowest level since World War ??? with state economists projecting that a total of only 4400 apartments and singlefamily houses will be authorized for construction here in 1975.

title: Elizabeth Lee Wiley, Douglas Broome Wed
description: Elizabeth Lee Wiley, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William Howard Wiley, was married yesterday afternoon to Douglas Horton Broome, son of Mr. and Mrs. Boyd Douglas Broome. Both families are of Hilton Head Island, S. C., where the Rev. David Schiller performed the ceremony in the Roman Catholic Church of the Holy Family.

description: A Public Service Commission examiner recommended yesterday a $280million increase in revenues to the New York Telephone Company that would make long conversations and calls between 9 A.M. and 9 P.M, on weekdays more costly.

title: C. T. CAMPBELL, 90, RIVER FLEET LEADER
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 22Charles Talbot Campbell, an operator of river fleets, died here today at his home. He was 90 years old.

title: A Dark Horse Is Gaining By Labors in M ississippi
description: JACKSON, Miss., Aug. 21A working man's candidate with similarities to Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama is propelling himself toward the Democratic nominatoin for Governor of Mississippi by working one day a week at a bluecollar job.

title: Economists Call Politics A Factor in the Price Rise
description: Economic analysts, who have been surprised almost as much as the Administration by the resurgence of doubledigit inflation, said yesterday that they attributed the return of sharply rising prices to politics and psychology, rather than to fundamental economic factors.

description: LISBON, Aug. 22Premier Vasco Gongalves was reported today to have stiffened his resolve to fight to keep his post, against the pressure of a majority of the political and military forces in Portugal.

title: Magic of Game With Giants Could Be Elixir for Namath
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Aug. 22Joe Namath heightened the drama for the JetsGiants clash by declaring today, Hell, yes, when asked if there was a chance he would play on Sunday.

title: VW Deal in Israel Kept Despite Threat of Arab Ban
description: WOLFSBURG, West Germany, Aug, 22 (Reuters)Volkswagen will not withdraw a concession granted by its Audi subsidiary to an Israeli concern, despite reports of a possible Arab boycott of the giant car company, informed car industry sources said today.

title: Economists Call Politics A Factor in the Price Rise
description: Economic analysts, who have been surprised almost as much as the Administration by the resurgence of doubledigit inflation, said yesterday that they attributed the return of sharply rising prices to politics and psychology, rather than to fundamental economic factors.

title: BENJAMIN ROSS
description: Benjamin Ross, president of the J. L. Fisher Corporation and subsidiaries, a syndicate operating millinery and wig departments in department stores, died Thursday at the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center. IHe lived in Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Baer Trespassing Trial Due Wednesday
description: CLARKSBORO, Aug. 22After several delays, Assemblyman Byron M. Baer, Bergen County Democrat, is scheduled to go on trial next Wednesday: in the former schoolhouse of this rural community on charges of trespassing on the Rosario Sorbello & Sons farm.

title: Unveilings
description: LEVITINHerman. The unveiling for Her. man Leyitin will be held on Sunday, Aug. 24. et 10 A.M. at Cedar Park Cemetery, Paramus. N.J.

title: Canada Trade Surplus
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 22 (Reuters) Statistics Canada said today Canada's seasonally adjusted trade balance on a balanceofpayments basis moved to a surplus of $111million in July from a deficit of $213million in June.

title: India Tries Again to Reform Farming
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 22A frontpage cartoon in The Times of India this week shows a rich, fat village moneylender going over his books as one of his debtors, an impoverished farmer, squats on the floor before him.

title: AMEX STOCKS RISE, REVERSING TREND
description: Stocks gained yesterday on the American Stock Exchange and in the OvertheCounter market, reversing the trend of the previous four sessions.

title: Corning Glass. Changes To Cut 500 Jobs in State
description: CORNING, N.Y., Aug. 22 (UPI) The Corning Glass Works announced today a sweeping organizational restructuring that would mean the loss of 500 jobs in upstate New York, consolidation of eight departments and management changes in 13 divisions of the company worldwide.

title: Boys and Girls High Delays Fall Opening As Strike Continues
description: The fall opening of the new Boys and Girls High School. in Brooklyn will be delayed until Nov. 1 because of the summerlong strike of steam fitters, school officials said yesterday.

title: Forest Service's Tlearcutting Barred in a West Virginia Area
description: RICHMOND, Aug. 22 (UPI)A Federal appeals court says an 1897 law prohibits the United States Forest Service practice of clearcutting timber in a West Virginia national forest, but the Federal agency said today that further legal action would probably be required to stop the practice in other national forests.

title: SILENT ILLNESSES FOUND IN BABIES
description: HARBOR SPRINGS, Mich., Aug. 22Subtle infections of newborn babies, producing no overt symptoms but persisting for months or years, are emerging as an important public health problem, a medical scientist reported today to a conference sponsored by the National FoundationMarch of Dimes.

title: Joan Little Tells Press She Will Fight Racism
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Aug. 22 (AP)Joan Little. acquitted Aug. 15 in the slaying of a white jailer, said at a news conference today that she used to think mainly of partying but now pledged herself to fighting racism.

title: Osceola L. Freear to Wed Today
description: Osceola Louise Freear and Evan Welling Thomas 3d, secondyear students at the University of Virginia Law School, will be married this evening in San Marino, Calif. The Rev. Richard Thyme, a Presbyterian minister, will perform the ceremony in the San Marino Community Church.

title: SENATORS DELAY NIXON DATA CALI
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22The Senate Select Committee on Intelligence extended today for two days the deadline on its subpoenas for tape recordings and documents from President Nixon's files to permit a Federal appeals court panel to rule on procedural matters, a committee spokesman said.

title: Market Place
description: Growth stocks were hit fairly hard this week on the New York Stock Exchange as they continued to underperform the rest of the market.

title: Court Reinstates Suit by LILCO, Charging. Fixing of Oil Prices
description: An antitrust allegation that accused major oil companies of a pricefixing conspiracy was reinstated here yesterday by the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit.

title: VietnamAustralian Ties
description: HONG KONG, Aug. 22 (Reuters)  South Vietnam and Australia have decided to establish diplomatic relations, the North Vietnam news agency reported today. Quoting a joint communiqu signed by representatives of the two Governments in Hanoi, the agency, monitored here, said the decision took effect Aug. 8.

title: Bethlehem Asks Cut In Steel Job Costs; Warns of Shutdowns
description: BETHLEHEM, Pa. Aug. 22 (UPI)  The Bethlehem Steel Corporation said today it would shut down all its fabricated steel construction plants if employment costs were not reduced.

title: Dacca Minister Describes Goals of the New Regime
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Aug. 22 The new Foreign Minister of Bangladesh today depicted his country and its new President as desperately striving for stability while trying to feed and clothe some 80 million people for whom daytoday existence is a constant struggle.

title: Refugees to Be Moved
description: EGLIN AIR FORCE BASE, Fla., Aug. 22 (AP)  About 250 to 300 unsponsored Vietnamese refugees will be airlifted from Eglin Air Force Base to Fort Chaffee, Ark., beginning. Monday, an Air Force officer said today. The refugee camp here will shut down most operations on Sept. 1.

title: Betty Sanders, a Guitarist And Folk Singer, 53, Dead
description: Betty Sanders, a guitarist and folk singer who gave many performances here, died of cancer Thursday evening in the Moffitt Hospital of the University of California Medical School in San Francisco. She was 53 years old.

title: Buses Fail to Lure Suburbanites From Cars
description: Joanne Clardutlo is an urban planner's dream. Every working day, the young woman takes the bus between tier home in Westbury, L. I., and her job in an insurance company in nearby Garden City.

title: U.S. Companies Hard Hit By Malaysia Oil Problems
description: KUALA LUMPUR, MalaysiaPetronas, the youngest of the world's government oil companies, is suffering growing pains that are crippling the development of Malaysia's potentially rich offshore oil reserves.

title: Marian Storm, Journalist, Author and Naturalist, 83
description: Marian Storm, an author, journalist and naturalist, died Wednesday in the Mexican American Hospital in Guadalajara, Mexico, where she lived. Her age was 83.

title: TOP CITY OFFICIALS DENOUNCE BANKS
description: Statements by major banks Thursday that they would be unable to raise the cash the city needs next month because of investor resistance to purchasing Municipal Assistance Corporation bonds brought foith a fresh torrent of denunciation of the bankers yesterday by some of the city's top elected officials.

title: Seized Cuban Fishing Boat Freed by U.S. Authorities
description: BOSTON, Aug. 22 (UPI)A Cuban fishing vessel seized Sunday by the Coast Guard for alleged violations of the Coastal Fisheries Act, was released today by the United States Attorney's Office.

title: Timber Lands Focus of Conservation Fight
description: CASHMERE, Wash.Louise Kelley, the wife of a logger, bristled with anger. They want to wipe out our jobs, our town, our livelihood, she said. It almost scares you to death.

title: Vijay Amritraj Tops Connorsin 3 Sets
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N.J., Aug. 22Topseeded Jimmy Connors, who needed a sevenminute respite during his previous match here last Wednesday because of stomach cramps, today needed a safety pin in order to continue play in the $50,000 Tennis Week Open.

title: SHORT INTEREST AT 7MONTH LOW
description: The New York Stock Exchange has reported that short interest decreased to 22,801, 887 shares on Aug. 15 from 25,385,181 shares on July 15. It was the lowest since January 15, when short interest was 20,813,260 shares.

title: Experts Press for Space Colony Now
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW Calif. Aug. 22A sununer study group of 28 engineers psysicists design experts, economists and social scientists recommended today that the United States begin a program to build colonies in space.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: United Press International

title: Lancelot Hogben Dead; Popularizer of Science
description: Lancelot Hogben, a British scholar who became a best(selling author by applying the light touch of a popular novelist to books on science, mathematics and otherwise weighty subjects, died yesterday in Wrexham, Wales. He was 79 years old.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: New Jersey doctors and dentists lost the first round of an attempt to bar a 10 per cent cut in Medicaid fees when a judge in New Brunswick refused to halt the reduction. Superior Court Judge Baruch Seidman refused to issue an emergency injunction against the fee reduction. and said it would be easier for the doctors and dentists to bean the loss of $5.4million in fees rather than the state.

title: Soybean Futures Prices Rise by 1c to 4c a Bushel
description: A small gain was registered for soybean futures prices but grains were mixed at the close of trading yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: 11b ARE RESCUED IN FERRY CRASH
description: BURLINGTON, Vt., Aug. 22A flotilla of private yachts, two. Coast Guard boats, and a ferry rescued 115 passengers from the ferry Valcour last night, after she crashed into Ferris Rock in Lake Champlain.

title: On Art: Japonisme Stirring Cleveland
description: At the very beginning of Japonisme, the exhibition that has drawn large and conspicuously attentive crowds to the Cleveland Museum of Art, there is a painting by Renoir that brings most visitors to a halt. It is dated 1871 and is quite unlike most people's idea of Renoir.. The amiable hedonist of the female nudes is not in evidence. In his place is a man who is making an inventory of the objects he likes best. The painting is not so much built up as added to, and makes it clear that, at that moment in Renoir's career there were two sides to his creative personality a European side and Japanese side.

title: Seized Marijuana Burned
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22 (AP) The United States Custom Service said today that it had burned a 43ton cache of marijuana seized in the Bahamas Aug. 16. A customs spokesman said the more than 86,000 pounds of marijuana was the largest single seizure in histozy and was valued on the illegal market at $23.8million.

title: POLICE CHARGE 3 IN FATAL KNIFING
description: Three young men, including two brothers with histories of drug addiction and with minor criminal. records, were charged yesterday with the murder of a 22year old tourist from Virginia on the Upper West Side early Wednesday morning.

title: Notes on People
description: Reflecting a longstanding controversy at Consumers Union over priorities, Ralph Nader is resigning from the board of directors. Mr. Nader, citing a division of philosophy on the board, criticized it for devoting too little energy and resources to consumer advocacy and to organizing for action to correct major consumer injustices.

title: Banker, 32 to Head College
description: HARRISBURG. Aug. 22 (AP) Gov. Milton Shapp today appointed a 32yearold bank executive as president of Indiana University of Pennsylvania. The new president, Dr. Robert C. Wilburn, is currently vice president and director of the Financial Planning Group at the Chase Manhattan Bank in New York.

title: Jolson Song Contest Here Draws a Million Smiles:
description: There was a wave of mugging  purely theatrical on West 54th Street at lunchtime yesterday and the only victim might have been Al Jolson.

title: Events Today
description: LA CARATULA and LAS ACEITUNAS by Lone de Rueda and LOS HABLADORES and EL VIEJO CELOSO by MiUISCI de Cervantes, one.act comedies performed in Spanish by Gilberto Zaidivar's Spanish Theater Rerertory Company, directed by Francisco Morin, choreography pyulio Torres, Lincoln Center Plaza, 2:30.

title: 3 Hurt a: Collision Hurls an Ambulance Into Store in Queens
description: A volunteer ambulance rushing to answer a call collided with a passenger car in Ridgewood, Queens: around midnight yesterday, sending the ambulance careening into a nearby store, which burst into flames, destroying the ambulance and severely damaging the store.

title: TWO JANITORS FOIL BANK HOLD UP HERE
description: Two cleaning men may have foiled a robbery attempt in the executive office building of the Chemical Bank at 20 Pine Street yesterday afternoon when they stumbled upon three masked gunmen who handcuffed them, forced them into a closet and rendered them helpless with chloroform, the police reported.

title: Antiques judaica From 19 Centuries
description: Ceremonial objectsdevised for the religiousoriented rituals of everyday living may indeed say more about a people than the elaborate wares that priests use in leading communal worship.

title: Concert: Trout Quintet
description: The. problem of premature applause is one that experienced musicians learn to cope with, and their various techniques for preventing it or shutting it off quickly might be worth some foundation grantee's study. But there are spots in the musical literature where the composer himself writes such a resounding cadence that an audience is virtually baited into thinking the piece is Aver. Musicians cringe as these moments come near.

title: IRA B.JORALEMON,91, MINING CONSULTANT
description: Ira B. Joralemon, a mining consultant who helped develop many of the richest metal mines in this country, Canada and Mexico, died Sunday at his home in Berkeley, Calif. He lwas 91 years old.

title: GOING OUT GUIDE
description: SALUTE Chinatown holds its Bicentennial celebration tomorrow through Sept. 1 with a festive program featuring music, dance, opera, films and demonstrations in cooking and martial arts and other activities. Before the opening ceremony at 11 A.M. at the Chinese Community Center, 62 Mott Street, with a welcome from M. B. Lee, president of the Chinese Consolidated Benevolent Association, young residents will sprint through the sector in a minimarathon starting at sao A.M. A daily movie festival will begin at 10 A.M. in the Pagoda Theater on East Broadway.

title: Vientiane Airport Reported Closed to Civil Aviation
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Aug. 22 (Agence FrancePresse)  The international airport in the Laotian capital, Vientiane, was closed to civil aviation today, diplomatic sources said here.

title: French Left is in Sharp Dispute Over Issues in Portugal's Crisis
description: PARIS, Aug. 22  French Communists and Socialists have been engaged in fierce controversy over the issues raised by the Portuguese crisis.

title: Willard F. Rockwell Would Welcome Investment
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 22 (AP) The Gulf Oil Corporation said today that it had broken off talks concerning joint ventures, including a possible merger, with the Rockwell International Corporation. A merger would have produced the nation's fifthlargest industrial company.

title: Open Interest.
description: (In bushels, 000 omitted) Thurs.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: SwedishAmerican Lines sold its 26,678ton liner Kungsholm to Flagship Cruises, which said it would take over the luxury ship's scheduled cruises. A spokesman for SwedishAmerican said the line's remaining liner, the Gripsholm, would return to Sweden shortly to be sold, thus ending the line's interest in the cruise business.

title: Czech Jews, a Vaniship Group
description: PRAGUE, Aug.10The Jews of Prague believe that Judaism. which for seven centuries was a powerful factor in the intellectual, artistic and architectural flowering of this city, will be dead in Czechoslovakia within 20 years. But it will leave an almost indelible legacy behind.

title: Steve Cady
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Aug. 22An hour before post time the word was all over the race track.

title: Canada Shifts From Oil Seller to Buyer
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 22The security of oil riches is fading fast for Canada, with potentially severe effects in the United States as well.

title: FELIX CAVALIERE AT THE BOTTOM LINE
description: Felix Cavaliere, a decade ago, was the singer with the Young Rascals, the darlings of New York rockers who, as time and trends took their toll, became merely the Rascals. He appeared at the Bottom Line club on Thursday with a brandnew and bigger band.

title: TOP THAI POLICEMEN OFFER RESIGNATIONS
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Aug. 22 (UPI) Two top Thai police chiefs submitted their resignations today because of the ransacking of the home of Premier Kukrit Piamoj by policeled demonstrators.

title: 'Barra Sues Over Limits In Football
description: TUSCALOOSA, Ala., Aug. 22 (AP)The University of Alabama filed a lawsuit against the National Collegiate Athletic Association today, challenging the legality of rules recently adopted that limit the size of football squads.

title: Boston In Spraying Drive
description: BOSTON, Aug. 22 (AP)The State Public Health Department says that it will begin tomorrow to spray parts of 15 southeastern Massachusetts communities from the air in an effort to prevent any more cases of equine encephalitis. The insecticide used is Malathion. The department said that it had relatively low toxicity and was generally harmless to humans in the volume in which it would be applied.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Premier Vasco Gongalves of Portugal reportedly stiffened his resolve to fight to keep his post against the pressure of majority of the country's political and military forces. The move to force him out ran into further snags as two factions of the armed forces that had agreed last Tuesday on a common platform to replace him suddenly developed disagreements of an undisclosed nature. [Page 1; Columns 67.]

title: M.A.C. SAYS STATE MUST SUPERVISE CITY'S BORROWING
description: Governor Carey and Mayor Beanie were told by the hiunicipal Assistance Corporation yesterday that some form of state supervision of the city's borrowing and management fun Lions must be established if the city is to avert a default..

title: Mexico's Deficit in Trade Stirs Devaluation Debate
description: MEXICO CITY, Aug. 22A sharp deterioration of Mexico's balanceofpayments situation has provoiked an unusual open debate over the pros and cons of devaluing the Mexican peso against the dollar.

title: Death, Sex, Love & Despair
description: Is Howard Hughes dead? Should the President's wife be surprised if she discovers her daughter is having an affair? Will Elizabeth Taylor and Richard Burton remarry? Did Rock Star Gregg Allman's broken toe result from psychic despair caused by his separation from TV star Cher, formerly Bono?

title: P.S.A.L. Budget Cut 40%
description: Football, which generates more interest than any other sport in New York high schools, has been saved, but indoor track, several minor varsity sports, all junior varsity teams and several girls programs were eliminated yesterday when the Board of Education announced its sports budget for the 197576 school year.

title: Bingham Drawings Kept In Missouri by Sales Pact
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 22A collection of 112 drawings by George Caleb Bingham will be purchased for $1.8milion in a statewide fund drive and remain in Missouri, where the artist made his vivid rendering of 19thcentury life along the Mississippi river.

title: STATE'S FARE RISEDRAWS CHALLENGE
description: HACKENSACK, Aug. 22The executive director of the Bergen County Board of Transportation, in a view shared by other major commuter counties, today challenged increases in railroad and bus fares proposed by the New Jersey Department of Transportation as inequitable and unnecessary.

title: Bible Found in Attic Confirmed as Gutenberg After Examination by 4 Experts in Germany
description: IMMENHAUSEN, West Germany, Aug. 22  A leatherbound volume found here 17 years ago in a littered attic filled with chests and cobwebs was identified today as the first half of a twovolume Bible printed by Johann Gutenberg, the inventor of movable type.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: The Ring Tells All
description: It's black, it's amber, its bright blue, it's violet. It's this month's throwaway chic, a $45 whimsey that has had hundreds of conspicuous consumers storming the jewelry counter at Bonwit Teller.

title: ESTIMATE BOARD AND BEANIE MEET
description: Mayor Beame and members of the Board of Estimate met for almost two hours yesterday in their first joint meeting since the board met without the Mayor last Tuesday to discuss what one member described at the time as the Mayor's drift during the city's fiscal crisis.

title: Olympics Attitude, Motivation
description: The United States track and field team will have to do more than just show up in Montreal if it expects to do well. The days when the United States team could anticipate earning the lion's share of gold medals in track and field just on raw ability are gone. There are outstanding international athletes in nearly every event; and they're coming along faster every year as technical training ideas are successfully utilized throughout the world.

title: When the Red Tide Strikes.
description: And Moses  struck the water of the Nile  and all the water was changed into blood. The fish died and the, river stank, and the Egyptians could not drink water from the Nile Exodus 7:20,21

title: Cultural Calendar Is Busy
description: HACKENSACK  After a highly successful summer season of free outdoor concerts, the North Jersey Cultural Council is preparing a busy autumn program. All told, four pop and folk groups and the Eric Bass Puppet Theater gave a total of 57 performances in 13 Bergen and Passaic County communities this summer.

title: T. R. s Summer Place
description: BACK in the first decade of the century, before airconditioning, President Theodore Roosevelt had an understandable inclination to forsake Washington, D.C.; and head for more comfortable climes. But the. Federal Government, even then, could hardly shut down for a whole summer. So each year, when the heat waves came to the capital, T.R. packed up the Governmentstaff, advisers and all, with the press tagging afterand moved to his own spacious home at Cove Neck the North Shore of Long Island.

title: CONSPIRACY TO THE LEFT OF US!
description: As time passes history flattens, as if photographed with a telescopic lens. Unrelated events seem to merge. A network of connection extending from the Texas School Book Depository in 1963 the Watergate in 1972 gains plausibility daily; persons and agencies appear and reappear, as the two crimes were of the same order, committed by the same hands and whitewashed by the same confederates  John Connally, riding in the 1961 Lincoln convertible with John F. Kennedy, signaled to the window above (Connally was later indicted for bribery after switching party affiliation from Democrat to Republican), brought down the gunfire, and was eventually found innocent by a commission including Chief Justice Warren, who was appointed to the Supreme Court by President Eisenhower on the recommendation of thenVice President Nixon, thus paving the way for Nixon's victory over the Warren forces in California, his subsequent winning of the Presidency prior Watergate, and his eventual appointment of Gerald Ford to the Presidency. Ford, then Representative from Michigan, was a member of the Warren Commission.

title: Women's Crime Is Issue At Penologists Parley
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky. Aug. 23 (UPI)Two researchers say the link between women's liberation and the increasing number of crimes committed by women is a myth.

title: ART VIEW
description: Great artists are a source of moral energy. If the Dutch make a fuss about Rembrandt and the Germans make a fuss about Diirer, it Is not simply because their centenaries are good for the tourist industry. It is because people need them, and hold fast to them, and like to get as much of then, as they can.

title: Unhappy people on the run
description: The people in Andre Dubus's universe are truly on separate flights. In his stories, the women drink a lot; the men run. On the morning his wife and children leave him for good, a man weeps, then puts on jockstrap and gym shorts his blood quickening with challenge and hope and runs. Running is the only act in his life that gives him what he pays for. It is as simple as that. Most of the people in this married but their marriages seem to be built upon some faroff moment of madness, some distant mistake. In the novella We Don't Live Here Anymore, several young wives at a party emerge from the kitchen smiling. They have just discovered they have something in common all their marriages were shotgun.

title: And why is he so popular?
description: I am going to starve the schools financially until I get some educational reforms, said the Governor of California, Edmund G. Brown Jr.

title: On the fine edge of things
description: We look still to the French for the fine edge on things. How should we dress or live or eat without checking our impulses against their creative lead? Even ardent antiEuropeans must admit that without France, life is bland. In addition, there is no denying that the possibilities of the novel have been extended by the shakingup provided by the ???

title: Why So Much Dance in Utah, Of All Places?
description: SALT LAKE CITY, UTAH

title: Epilogue A Glance Back at Some Major Stories
description: A problem that has been troubling the State of Tennessee since 1925, teaching students about the creation of the universe, apparently has not yet been resolved. A 1973 law requiring textbooks to provide equal space to Biblical theories on the creation has recently been ruled unconstitutional by both a Federal judge and the Tennessee Supreme Court. The decisions were issued less than two months after the 50th anniversary of the Scopes trial in Dayton, Tenn., in which John Thomas Scopes, a high school teacher, was convicted of violating a 1925 law against teaching theories of evolution. In 1927, the Tennesseo Supreme Court upheld the 1925 law, but struck down Mr. Scopes conviction technicality.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: State Supreme Court Justice William R. Murray issued a stay order preventing. State Agriculture Commissioner John S. Dyson from collecting a $100,000 fine from Dairylea Inc., until the milk cooperative's appeal is decided by the Appellate Division. Mr. Dyson, in ordering the fine, had charged that Dairylea improperly sold milk products in nine counties where it was not licensed to make sales.

title: Maazel and Cleveland Orchestra Record the First Complete Porgy and Bess in Stereo
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 23Lorin Maazel, director of the Cleveland Orchestra, listened to the playback of the previous recording session and looked around the control room, crowded with singers, technicians and electronic equipment.

title: Vilas Sets Back Laver; Borg and Ashe Advance
description: BROOKLINE, Mass., Aug. 23 (AP)Topseeded Guillermo Vilas of Argentina crushed Rod Laver, 63, 64, and Bjorn Borg of Sweden, the defender, defeated Raul Ramirez of Mexico, 46, 63, 60, today in quarterfinal matches of the $100,000 United States professional tennis championship.

title: Court Rulings May Lead To Higher Rents in City
description: Three recent rulings by the State Supreme Court promise to produce higher rents in rentcontrolled and rentstabilized apartments in the city.

title: Chugging Through Shakespeare Country on an OldStyle Canal Boat
description: T OT to worry, said the boatyard manager with charcateristic English calm when 15yearold Michael volunteered to steer our rented 10ton canal cruiser. It isn't that difficult to handle a 45??? boat once you get the hang of It. Vacationers on Britain's waterways can, of course, take the easy Way out by booking passage aboard a luxury hotel boat on which a professional crew does all the work and prepares all the meals. But my husband end I, his parents and his brother, Michael, had decided to crew for ourselves. We would chart our own course 4nd set our own schedule aboard traditional narrow canal boat during our week on the StratfordonAvon Canal and the River Avon. Our starting point was Wootton Wawen (pronounced Wootin Wawin), north of Stratford, and we would cruise down the canal to Stratford, from there along the Avon to Evesham, then retrace our route, a journey of 81 miles in all.

title: CHESS
description: What has happened to Soviet chess supremacy?

title: Social Announcements
description: Jeffrey and Barbara Allister happily announce the birth of their daughter, Lauren Michele, on August 15, 1975.

title: A Year to Go
description: A year before the Presidential election campaign goes into high gear, the political outlook is exceptionally obscure. Having acquired office by unprecedented means, President Ford has done well to lift the shadows of scandal from the Republican party and reorient an Administration so overwhelmingly reelected only three years ago, then so grievously stricken. But his hold upon his party is more tenuous than would normally be true of an incumbent President.

title: Headliners
description: An American helicopter pilot who lives in Munich, Barry Meeker, may face criminal charges for bringing three East Germans out of Czechoslovakia to West Germany last week. A Bavarian Justice Ministry spokesman said it is a criminal offense to cross the border illegally, and also to make rescue flights for professional organizations that specialize in smuggling refugees across the border for pay. Mr. Meeker said a friend had paid him $4,000 for the mission, but le denied that he worked for one of the commercial groups that charge as much as $20,000. Mr. Meeker's action drew a protest from Czechoslovakia against such gross infringements of its border. The pilot, who was wounded, apparently by Czechoslovak border guards, comes from Hartford, Conn. He once was stationed at an American air base in West Germany.

title: Aesthetic CuriosityThe Root of Invention
description: Necessity is not the mother of inventiononly of improvement. A man desperately in search of a weapon or food is in no mood for discovery; he can only exploit what is already known to exist. Innovation and discovery require aestheticallymotivated curiosity; they do not arise under the pressure of need, although of course once new properties of matter or new mechanisms become known they are available for use.

title: Sports Today
description: Drag racing, at National Speedway, Center Moriches; L.I., P.M.

title: Catherine Higgs Milton Is Wed To Thomas McBride in Capital
description: Catherine Higgs Milton and Thomas F. McBride were married last evening at the bride's home in Washington by the Rev. Tom Luke Turosian of the Community of Christ in a Protestant ceremony.

title: Portuguese Predicts a Full Civil War for Angola
description: LISBON, Aug. 23The Portuguese Minister of Economy in Angola's transition government warned today that if a political solution was not reached within the next 10 days, there could be general civil war in the West African territory.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Few Fish at Nomans Land
description: NOMANS LAND, Mass.Imbued with that marvelous optimism that often finds me yearning for my own salad days when I was both young and green in judgment, our skipper, Steve Broderick, seemed to have no doubt that we would catch bluefish, and even, perhaps, striped bass.

title: Typhoon in Japan Kills 22; 16,000 May Be Homeless
description: TOKYO, Sunday, Aug. 24 (Reuters)A typhoon has left at least 22 people dead and six others missing, in northern and western Japan, the police said today.

title: Late TV Listings
description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: Iris Murdoch's new novel and old themes
description: This is Iris Murdoch's 17th novelalmost oneayear since Under the Netand it raises the old bewildering questions about her status as a writer. Anything she sets her hand to seems distinctive you could not possibly confuse her with any other novelist. But take all the separate volumes, set them alongside each other, and they do not look strikingly individual. Tricks, characters, whole turns of the plot may be carried over from one book to the next. One begins to worry about this magical dispositicin of elements.

title: N.J. Nine Captures Title, 43
description: WILLIAMSPORT, Pa., Aug. 23Lakewood Township of Ocean County, N. J., won the United States championship of the Little League today by beating a Tampa, Fla., allstar team, 43, thus satisfying the desires of the board of directors of Little League Inc. The board got its first championship team from the United States in five years.

title: Hazel Hunter Is Wed Hli
description: Hazel Hunter, daughter Mr. and Mrs. Albert Hunt of New York, was rnarril here yesterday afternoon C. Levonne Laughinghouse New York, son of Char Laughinghouse of Englewool N. S., and the late Mr. Laugninghouse.

title: Ocean's Roar Is Music to His Ears
description: NORTH BEACH HAVENThe summer basketball season is still in full swing at the local playground, but Robert Pollock had to stop playing several weeks ago. He dropped out fdr professional reasons; he is giving a piano recital next Saturday at the Long Beach Island Foundation of the Arts and Sciences, and he did not want to take the chance of injuring his fingers.

title: VirginiaM.Cheney
description: Mr. and Mrs. William G. Cheney of Greenwich, Conn., ave made known the enagement of their daughter, irginia Mitchell Cheney, to ichael Balaban of Camridge, Mass., son of Mrs. ermon Balaban of Philadelhia and the late Mr. Balaban. he weddine is niannm ept. 13 in Wellesley, Mass. Miss Cheney, whose father a special representative ith the Westinghouse Elecic Corporation here, is a aduate of the Dana Hall school, Colby Junior College Id Wheaton College in Norn, Mass. She was presented 1969 at the ester tillion and the Westch New York nior League Ball.

title: RECORDINGS VIEW
description: Wbile the legions of northern critics continue ?a acclaim Robert Altman's Nashville, the reaction down South, from the city of the same name, is split between polite praise for the film's structure and thumbsdown for its music. The acting is good, the story is good, and the presentation is excellent , states The Nashville Banner, but the music stinks!

title: Deborah Curren Bride of John T. Aquino
description: Deborah Therese Curren, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert R. Curren of West Hempstead, L. I., was married yesterday afternoon to John Thomas Aquino, son of Mrs. Sylvester Aquino of Washington and the late Mr. Aquino. The ceremony was performed at St. Thomas the Apostle Roman Catholic Church in West Hempstead, by the Msgr. Richard Walsh.

title: Pathet Lao Announce Vientiane TakeOver
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Aug. 23 The Communistled Pathet. Lao took over Laos today, marking the last chapter in the rise to power of Communistled movements in Indochina.

title: Bangladesh Arrests Six Former Leaders
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 23 (Reuters)  The Bangladesh radio announced the arrest of former Prime Minister Mansoor All and Vice President Syed Nazrul Islam under the country's new martiallaw regulations.

title: Susan Mencke Bride Of Paul A. Hanson
description: Susan Eleanor Menefee, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Bernhard Mencke, was married yesterday to Paul Arthur Hanson, son of Mr. and Mrs. James Warren Hanson. Both families are of Summit, N.J., where the ceremony was performed at St. Teresa's Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. John P. Egan, who was assisted by the Rev. Rick L. Bair, a Lutheran minister.

title: Glomar Explorer Shows Up After 2 Days of Mystery
description: AVALON, Calif., Aug. 23 (UPI)The Glomar Explorer made a surprise appearance this morning, anchoring off the west end of Catalina Island after two days of mystery over her whereabouts.

title: SPOTLIGHT
description: The Massachusetts Institute of Technology has cast itself in the role of midwife for new'hightechnology ventures in an effort to speed the movement of new ideas and processes from the laboratory to the market place.

title: Music Haydn Seasons
description: Haydn was 69 when he completed The Seasons. Its composition had caused him anxiety and anguish, or so he complained. He was worried about the shifts in style that were foreshadowing 19thcentury Romanticism. Yet what he accomplished was a work of youthful vigor, suffused with a profound love and enjoyment of life, a work at once startlingly original and stylistically unified. In its economy of means and constant invention it nearly parallels another dazzling creation of old age, the Falstaff that Verdi finished when he was 8O.

title: In Memoriam
description: In Memoriam

title: Disaster Area in Florida
description: VAIL, Colo., Aug. 23 (AP)President Ford declared north Florida a major disaster area yesterday as a result of heavy Taing and flooding in late July that caused extensive property and agricultural damage.

title: Show Title Won By Sunny Umber
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Aug. 23 Mrs. Nina Supino, who has ridden jumpers of every shape and size during the past 10 years, scored one of the outstanding performances of her career today at the final session of the twoday Fairfield County Hunt Club horse show.

title: FILM VIEW
description: A un aprendo Goya scrawled under one of his late drawings. I still learn. To make comparisons very far across the arts is ludicrous. But Ralph Bakshi, struggling to make animated cartoons speak tragically, has entered his equivalent of Goya's black period, still learning.

title: Washington Is Not Likely to Blink at the Prospect of Default
description: WASHINGTON  Like all important debtors throughout history, New York City possesses an unusual weapon the threat of bankruptcy, or default. or insolvency. This weapon, has not literally been brandished in the city's efforts to obtain help from Washington to get it through its financial crisis. But it has been in the background, even though New York's debt is not owed to the Federal Government, because a failure by such a major debtor might cause broader financial repercussions.

title: Nonmuseum Art Shown at Hofstra

title: Indonesia, With Her Vast Natural Wealth, Debates Problems of Equitable Development
description: JAKARTA, IndonesiaA debate on the progress and problems of development is under way among the intellectuals in and out of government in this vast nation of islands the fifth in the world in population.

description: Dorothy Meyers Gaensslen, daughter of Col. Frank L. Meyers, U.S.A., retired, and Mrs. Meyers of Miami, was married there last evening to Dr. Wayne F. Cascio, son of Mr. and Mrs. Frank B. Cascio of Simsbury, Conn. The Rev. Ernest Simon performed the nondenominational ceremony in the Chapel by the Sea, Bal Harbour.

title: Letters
description: I certainly agree with Al Martens (Macho about pocketbooks, July 27). After I was mugged a couple of weeks ago, it occurred to me that pocketbooks are a good advertisement to potential muggers. Unless they are ready to be forceful or violent, muggers prefer to pursesnatch rather than pocietpick. As Al Marlens said, it's much easier. But Mr. Marlens does not touch on one very important point that is, the fact that clothing manufacturers do not build many utilitarian factors into women's clothes. Men's suits are specifically made with concealed and convenient pockets, while women's pockets are usually just for decoration. Mr. Marlens says that women obviously prefer pocketbooks to lumpish pockets. But why do their pockets have to be lumpy when men's are not? If clothing manufacturers and designers really set their minds to it, I think they could come up with an answer. If givan the alternative of wellmade clothes, styled to facilitate the carrying of necessities, many women would throw their pocketbooks away, or use.

title: AILEY COMPANY IN FINALE TODAY
description: The end of the summer dance season will come with the last two performances of the Alvin Ailey City Center Dance Theater today at the New York State Theater. The company took a chance on its first summer season last year and returned to have its judgment confirmed this year. It has enjoyed good attendance and displayed a sense of solid programing, offering that spedial mixture of style and soul that has made it so attractive.

title: The beauty of hard times
description: Did Richard Barrie, the executive vice president of Faberge, Inc., realize there was a recession on last May when he signed Margaux Hemingway to a recordshattering $1million contract to advertise the company's new line of fragrances?

description: This is the fall for making sound fashion investments. The message from designers is refinement, sophistication and quality, and the result is timeless clothes.

title: Jaws and Bug  The Only Difference is the Hype
description: Jaws fever is turning into an epidemic. In its first two months of release in the United States and Canada, Jaws has already grossed $90million, surpassing the boxoffice records of The Sting and The Exorcist, and by the end of the year it could best The Godfather as the topgrossing film in movie history. The phenomenal success of Jaws is astonishing, because the movieadapted from Peter Benchley's bestselling novel about a killer shark, and directed by Steven Spielbergis nothing more than a creaky, oldfashioned monster picture, reminiscent of Creature From the Black Lagoon, The Beast From 20,000 Fathoms, and whole rash of gradeB movies about giant ants, tarantulas, and rats on the warpath.

title: 3 Businesses, in Black, Close
description: MONTCLAIR  Few companies go out of business while making a profit. But in the last three years, Montclair State College has started up, and then closed down, three successful commercial ventures.

title: Dwarf Evergreens Are Gems
description: In landscape planting, like to think small! Small, modestsized plots can easily be transformed into unique, most attractive, displays by using the dwarf, slowgrowing evergreens. These distinctive gems of the garden, each with a character all its own, look best when planted together or used as accent plants in a rockery.

title: Puerto Ricans Plan Festival on. Sept. 12
description: HOLMDEL  The Garden State Arts Center will be the site Sept. 12 of the first Puerto Rican Heritage Festival.

title: Goodman Goes On
description: Although the Swing. Era which made Benny Goodman famous ended in the early forties, Benny Goodman still goes on. He gave up leading a band in the early fifties. During the past 25 years, he has put bands together from'time to time, or, more frequently, has appeared with a combo. But he found an increasing reluctance on the part of boolung agencies to bother with his groups.

description: Howard J. Kraus or Bay side, Queens, sat on the terrace of the Manhasset Bay Yacht Club and watched the cluster of small sailboats maneuver across the bay. He hadn't missed a race week in 42 years and he wasn't about to start now, even though he had been beachedpromoted up and out of the race committee boat with the title Chairman Emeritus of the Regatta Committee.

description: LEWBEACH, N. Y.There is a postmaster near here who says that the Catskills are becoming the cult capital of the East. Not the Far East, rhP Eastern United States.

description: In New York City's circular trap, the possibility of default critically affects the city's ability to borrow money, which increases the possibility of default, which. The cycle and its implications are so compelling that New York's normal political relationships, just as its way of doing business, are starting to fall apart.

description: The bicentennial of the establishment of an official American postal service is being observed with a setenant block of four commemoratives depicting the past and the present of the nations mail.

title: Susan Laster to Marry in Autum
description: Mr. and Mrs. Richard L ter of Chappaqua, N.Y., ha announced the engagem of their daughter, Sus Jeanette Laster, to Frank David Rubenstein, son of and Mrs. Albert Rubenste of Stamford, Conn.

title: In Cold Print: When Writers Buy In
description: A few years ago when the Macrae family decided they would have to sell Dutton now to avoid estate taxes later, John Macrae Jr. and the late Hal Schariatt, Dutton's chairman of the board and editorinchief, respectively, set up a venture capital corporation, whose joint purpose was to raise money to buy a controlling share of Dutton and also to give employes and writers a chance to get in on the action. The ebullient Scharlatt's idea was that writers should share in the profits of publishers. Macrae's idea was that, in addition, writers should be exposed to the woes of publishers. It would present the house, he said at the time, as one which depends on writers, and they would realize that a lot of the stories one hears are not as they appear to be.

title: Lamoyne A. Jones Is Dead at 64; Press Aide to W illkie and Dewey
description: Lamoyne A. Jones, a public relations executive and former newspaperman, who was press secretary to Wendell L. Willkie, the Republican candidate for President in 1940, died yesterday in New York Hospital. He was 64 years old, and lived at 30 East 37th Street.

title: Four Killed in Mexico Blast
description: TIJUANA, Mexico, Aug. 23 (AP)  At least four persons were killed when a downtown apartment house and commercial building was ripped by an explosion early today, Tijuana police officials said. They said the cause of the explosion was under investigation.

Which car  a TransAm Corvette, a Porsche Carrera a BMW an old CanAm monsterwill get there first is anyone's guess.

title: RULING IS SOUGHT ON ELECTION FUND
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 23The Federal Election Commission has been asked to erect some signposts in a legal noman'sland the right of corporations to raise political campaign funds and distribute them to Savored candidates and parties.

title: Art Education at Rutgers
description: NEW BRUNSWICKThe Rutgers University Art Gallery is planning to offer the adult and school communities of Middlesex County an arteducation program that is described as a first.

title: You had to like burdens to love Carson McCullers
description: We no longer maintain that life consists in actions only or in works. It consists in personality, Virginia Woolf wrote in her essay, The New Biography. And most good biographers in the first half of this century grasped this. Lytton Strachey even squeezed four stout figures into his slender Eminent Victorians. Biographies shrank to less than half their 18th and 19thcentury counterparts, because the biographer had learned to synthesize. One illumination was worth a hundred facts.

title: FollowUp on The News
description: In what Sanitation Commissioner Robert T. Groh called the best organized wildcat strike I've ever seen, New York's 10,000man sanitation force walked off the job last July 1 and 2 to protest threatened layoffs.

title: WOMAN, 80, IS SLAIN IN HER HOTEL ROOM
description: An 80yearold woman was found strangled yesterday after. noon in the midtown hotel where she had been living on welfare, and the police said the disarray of her room indi cated hat she might have been slain by a robber.

description: Virginia Chipurnoi is a tall. handsome, easygoing woman who lives in both the city and the country. She has been married 17 years, and she and her husband, Laurence, have two daughtersAlex, 12, and Sarah, 16and an assortment of horses, dogs and cats.

title: IN THE AVANTGARDE
description: Jazz singer Linda Sharrock says she has always liked clothes, especially shoes. When I was about 7 or 8 years old, I had a pair of copperycolored patentleather shoes that I was supposed to wear only on Sundays. I loved those shoes so much I used to hide them in my book bag and take them to school. I wore them every day.

title: This Week in Sports
description: With their own hopes for contention in the American League's Eastern Division largely squandered, the Yankees will attempt to influence the, western Division race this week at Shea Stadium. On Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday, they will entertain the Oakland A's, the World Series victors the last three years, and once again atop their division. On Friday and Saturday, the opposition will be furnished by the Kansas City Royals, the only team left with a Chance to dethrone the A's. All games will begin at 8:05 P.M.

title: Gladyce Rudin Wed to David Begelman
description: Gladyce Largever Rudin of Beverly Hills, Calif., was married there yesterday afternoon to David Begelman, president of Columbia Pictures. Judge Joseph A. Wapner of the Superior Court of Los Angeles performed the ceremony at the bride's home.
