description: Blacktop driveways and walks are popular in many areas because people like the richlooking appearance this paving material givesbut it does require more maintenance than concrete.

It appeared to newsmen that both men were clearly satisfied with the way the final stage of the negotiations was going. We are contining to make progress, Mr. Kissinger said. Difficulties continue to be removed. And we have encountered no unexpected obstacles. [Page 1, Column 1.1

title: Ideas Trends Education, Planetology, Law
description: A Viking has left the earth for a 500millionmile voyage to Mars. Its trip will.take nearly a year and when the unmanned spacecraft arrives the real exploration will begin. It is scheduled to set down a threelegged lander next July to conduct a series of scientific investigations. One of them is to conduct an initial search for evidence of Martian life, living or fossil.

The military triumvirate selected two weeks ago to run the country has broken apart. Under great pressure President Francisco da Costa Gomes has ordered that the proCommunist Premier, Vasco Gongalves, must go, and quickly.

title: San Francisco Remains Solvent
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 23San Francisco is not New York not yet.

description: MADRID, (UPI)Generalissimo Francisco Franco and his Government approved a broad antiterrorist law yesterday to fight political street violence that has killed more than 20 persons in Spain this year.

title: Ellison (Tarzan) Brown, 61, Marathon Runner, Is Dead
description: Ellison (Tarzan) Brown of Charleston, R.I., a Narragansett Indian, who won the Boston A. A. marathon races in 1936 and 1939, died yesterday, after having been struck by a van in Westerly, R. I. He was 61 years fold.

description: PEMBERTONFor the first time in its, sixyear history, Burlington County College will limit its fulltime enrollment this fall to a maximum of 2,000 students.

description: LISBON, Aug. 23 (Reuters) The Governor of the Portuguese territory of Timor failed in an attempt to negotiate truce last night between battling independence movements.

description: The executive board of the Queens Bicentennial Committee has authorized an additional 20 projects as part of the borough's celebration of the nation's 200th anniverary.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Editor: John Malone's nitpicking article, Let Us Not Praise Nashville's Failures (Aug. 10), must not go unchallenged. If Robert Altman's attempt at verisimilitude in his handling of sound is sometimes disturbing, his masterful handling of 24 characterizations in a twoandonehalf hour movie is unparalleled. That he was able to achieve such credible characterizations with a minimal use of audible dialogue is all the more to his credit. And if Mr. Malone missed the motivation of the seemingly nice young drifter who turns killer, he had better go back and see the picture again. Having come to Nashville with obvious intent to kill the demagogue whose canned inanities were polluting the air, he was driven into a mad rage by what he saw around himthe cruelty, the vulgarity, the hypocrisy  until he needed only one more push to send him off balance. The contrast between his own unhappy homelife and the glorification of family in Ronee Blakley's My Idaho Home was more than he could stand still for and since the politician very wisely remained in his limousine, the young man turned his wrath upon the two principal figures who stood before him on the stage.

title: Ford's SelfImage Pragmatic, Efficient, Conservative
description: VAIL, Colo., Aug. 23 Searching for a great American majority, President Ford has begun to develop the themes on which he will try to entice millions of political independents to support him and the Republican minority in the 197.6 elections.

title: Rise in Aid From Oil Nations Reported
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 23 The World Bank reported today that aid from oilproducing countries to the lessdeveloped nations had increased significantly but warned that the future of such aid was uncertain.

title: Sports Editor's Mailbox: Where Are the Postcards?
description: To the Sports Editor: I am an 11yearold girl and my younger brother is just crazy about the Yankees.

description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 23 Reuters)  Foreign tourist Tavel to the United States inreased sharply both in June and for the first six months of the year, according to the Commerce Department.

title: Cannonball Moon Chris
description: Jimmy London was the professional wrestling champion of this wide, bewildered world in the days of the Great Depression, Prohibition, Repeal and the New Deal. News of his death in California the other day, brought back a vivid image of his thickly muscled figure and Sports olive oil face with of gently sorrowing brawn eyes. Face and figure The Times were as familiar to Americans 40 years ago as the Blue Eagle of the National Recovery Act.

title: U.S. Open Tennis Tourney Some Observations From the Top
description: Tennis if my job. Oh, don't get me wrong. I love playing the game and I wouldn't trade my profession with anyone else in the world. But now, with the World Championship Tennis tour, World Team Tennis, the Association of Tennis Professionals events and the major national championships, a pro can play the game 365 days a year. There is at least one tournament every week and some weeks as many as four.

title: . Chaos Ahead.
description: New York has reached that grim point without yet, arriving on firm ground. Thus, Governor Carey suggests that immediate introduction of thoroughly candid accounting procedures would show the city still $800 million short in this year's budget, with another $2 billion in deficits unmet from previous years. Although Mayor Beame disputes these projections, few others familiar with the citv's finances do.

title: A certified American in a highly English mode
description: Paul Theroux is an exceptionally good and prolific writer who ought to be better known than he is. I should like to think that there is a swelling cult of Thermix readers, ready to proclaim themselves in surprising numbers, and that his latest book, The Great Railway Bazaar, will provide the occasion. Though it is a travel book and not a novel it incorporates many of the qualities of Theroux's fiction it is funny, sardonic. Wonderfully sensuous and evocative in its descriptions, casually horrifying in its impact. It concerns itself, too, with the preoccupations of his previous workand here we may find a clue to the relative lack of attention.

title: Diana LeMaire Married To Stephen H. Squibb Jr.
description: Diana Knight LeMaire, daughter of Mrs. Farish A. Jenkins of Lost Tree Village, Fla., formerly of Rye, N. Y., and the late Edward LeMaire, was married yesterday afternoon to Stephen Harris Squibb Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Squibb of Simsbury, Conn., and Saunderstown, R. L.

title: Innovntinng in Treatment of Cancer Reported at Several Centers
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 23A, 117yearold Boston youth has both of his arms and a large measure of hope today because of recent gains scientists have made in fighting a deadly form of cancer.

title: CAMERA VIEW

The colors may be of any qualityhot and heavy, soft and misty, clear and lucid, or dark and mysterious. Anything goes for the photographer who learns how to work with his equipment and materials.

L.I., and Mrs. William Stackpole of Princeton, N.J., was married in Princeton yesterday afternoon to Gary Vaughn Meili, son of Mr. and Mrs. George Louis Meili of Lawrenceville, N.J. The Rev. Roger Uittenbogaard performed the Presbyterian ceremony in the garden at the Stackpole home.

title: The Emperor's fall clothes

description: TRENTON  Women's organizations in New Jersey are preparing to renew a campaign designed to end alleged sex discrimination in insurance coverage and in publicemoloye nension systems.

title: TakeOver Ends Strife in Laos That Outsiders Had Intensified

Discuss something, anyway, and since they start their migration soon afterward the routes and the weather would be logical topics.

title: FACING UP TO FALL
description: Those neutral grays and camels, those dark lodens and plums, those darkest blacks of the new fall clothes are chasing the natural looking face from the fashion scene. Those sometimes hardtowear, if not downright unflattering, shades should drive many women to the makeup pots for help. But not just any pink rouge or red lipstick will do, say the cosmetic companies. There's a whole new palette to complement both the colors and the sophisticated mood of fall 1975.

title: Justice in Athens
description: Col. George Papadopoulos, once the leader of the military junta that ruled Greece, has been found guilty of high treason and insurrection following legal processes denied to thousands of tortured victims of his regime. He enjoyed an open trial, in which he defended himself and was permitted counsel of his own choosing.

title: Integration Ruling Appealed By Dallas School System
description: DALLAS, Aug. 23 (UPI)Attorneys for the public school system have filed a petition with the Supreme Court appealing an integration ruling ordered into effect by the middle of the current school year.

title: COMMUTERS IN RIO ENRAGED BY DELAY
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Aug. 23 (Reuters)Thousands of Rio de Janeiro commuters, enraged by continual delays, have been turning the inadequate suburban railway network into battlefield, wrecking trains and ransacking stations.

title: Huntington Wins Stay On Funds For Addicts
description: HUNTINGTON  The state Drug Abuse Control Comthission will continue to fund a counseling program administered by the Town of Huntington despite a recent court ruling that upheld the commission's right to terminate funding because town officials had refused to keep sensitive information about individual participants.

title: Joan Lind Gains Final in Rowing
description: NOTTINGHAM, England, Aug. 23The United States continued its winning ways today in the semifinal rounds of the men's lightweight and women's competition in the world rowing championships.

description: BERLIN, Aug. 23A forecast that West Berlin's population will shrink by 400,000, or almost a fifth, in the next 15 years has caused alarm among politicians industrialists and labor leaders here.

title: Four women: Individuality of taste and a strong fashion sense
description: used to take cabs in New York and carry a black hatbox full of the tricks of the trade for a model in the nineteenfifties. Now retired to the suburbs, she drives a station wagon and wields a paint brush. Fulltime wife and mother, parttime painter, she likes jeans for daytime, long skirts in the evening. (See Page 24)

title: state Democrats Pushing Tickets for Presidential Forum FundRaising Affair
description: In an effort to erase party debts, state Democratic officials are putting pressure on county leaders to sell tickets to a fund raising affair on Oct. 4 that will feature eight of the contenders for the Democratic nomination for the Presidency.

title: Nastase, Hewitt in Net Final
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., Aug. 23Me Nacrase and Bob Hewitt, old masters on clay, spoiled the chances of an allAmritraj final by scoring semifinal victories today in the $50,000 Tennis Week open tournament at the Orange Lawn Tennis Club Nastase gave another superb performance in a 63, 63 triumph aver Anand, the elder Amritraj, who was outclassed in the 55minute match.

title: Finders Are Keepers At the Seashore
description: A leisurely walK along a beach, riverbank or lake shore in search of shells is enjoyable exercise which the entire family can enjoyand it is an ideal way to build up an attractive and valued collection of shells at little or no expense. Neatly labeled and displayed, a wellorganized collection of shells is always a source of pride and pleasure. Shells can be displayed in glass cases, mounted on metal stands that are sold for the purpose, or merely grouped to form an attractive setting on a coffee table. Combined with other accessories such as candles, flowers or driftwood, they can also be used to form decorative centerpieces or table settings. The beauty of a colorful shell can rival that of any manmade piece of sculpture or bricabrac.

title: Geiberger Leads Stockton by 3 Strokes
description: FORT WORTH, Aug. 23There was the time David Stockton took his chum Allen Geiberger dove hunting in California. Geiberger was doing well until Stockton stepped on a tarantula and yelled in fright. From then on Geiberger blanked out on doves because he did nothing but look at the groundfor tarantulas.

title: APPLE FARMERS SHORT OF PICKERS
description: ACCORD, N.Y.  The stream of migrant workers from the South coming north to pick the apple crop of New York State seems to be drying up, according to some farmlabor specialists in Ulster County.

title: I.R.S. Inquiry Hints Illegalities In Tax Data Links With C. 1. A.
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 23The Internal Revenue Service is conducting an intensive internal investigation to determine if the law was violated when the Central Intelligence Agency was secretly given information from individual tax returns, a spokesman said today.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: The Dow Jones industrial average closed Friday with a gain of 13.07 points for the day at 804.76. The Dow's net change for the whole week was a loss of 20.88. During the week'the average had fallen to 791.69, its lowest close since midApril.

title: STAGE VIEW
description: I hope we are not going to be foolish about the matter of previews. There have been several recent flaps about when, if ever, reviewers are to be admitted to shows already playing to audiences, and in some cases both managements and editors have been getting testy. There's been a brief brouhaha over whether or not any critical coverage was to be given Liza Minnelli when she so generously stepped into Chicago to replace, temporarily. an ailing Gwen Verdon. And mutterings acre still being heard, well beyond Shubert Alley where A Chorus Line has now taken up flourishing residence, about the announcement that its official opening night, still to come, isn't to come until a full nine weeks after its uptown debut.

title: Shows in 3 States On Long Weekend
description: Just a few years ago there was quite a stir among the fancy with the introduction of threeshow weekend circuits. With. Labor Day coming up, we now will see a said one wag, and we won't go to work. Exhibitors have a News Toursnow WeeKend. Soon there'll of be a show every Dogs day in the week, choice  New Jersey, Maine or North Carolinaand there will be metropolitan fanciers at all three.

title: Card of Thanks
description: FATT (FAIT)Jerome. The family of the late Jerome Fall (Fait) appreciate the kind expressions of sypmathy extended to us by our many friends.

title: Plan Would Save Housihg
description: Community groups in the Brighton Beach area of Brooklyn are working to establish a nonprofit development corporation to preserve the existing housing stock by encouraging rehabilitation and improved maintenance.

title: RIIODESMN TALKS: OUTLOOK IS GLUM
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Aug. 23Prime Minister Ian D. Smith, facing new constitutional talks with African nationalist leaders in two days, said today that his Government had no policy to hand our country over to any black majority government, and as far as I am concerned, we never will have.

title: The Conventional Wisdom May Not Apply
description: According to conventional scientific wisdom, the chance of life evolving on a planet is narrowly restricted by the planet's distance from its parent star. If it is too close, water boils; if it is too far away, water freezes. In either case, life cannot get started.

title: Housing Aid Sought in Williamsburg
description: A study sponsored by a housingimprovement organization in the Williamsburg section of Brooklyn has urged the establishment of a major program to facilitate moderate rehabilitation of deteriorated apartment buildings across the city.

title: Fernandez Scores 10Round Decision
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 23 (AP)Vilomar Fernandez of New York landed repeatedly with a right cross to score two knockdowns and upset previously unbeaten Ray Lunny of Redwood City, Calif., by a unanimous decision in a 10round, nationally televised fight at the Cow Palace last night.

title: The Nation
description: ATLANTAAlthough the city remains one of the more promising in the United States, a debate is growing in Atlanta about how, in coming years, it can avoid the sort of urban ills that have afflicted places like Newark, New York, Detroit and St. Louis.

title: Book Ends
description: Winner Formulas for business success come and go but it seems that sipward strivers are always on the lookout for a new book telling them how to snatch the brass ring. Success books can range from weighty tomes, like Peter Drucker's Management, to the short and punchy, like Robert Townsend's Up the Organization, to the Machievellian like Michael Korda's Power! The common thread is self improvement for the businessman and, while these books don't always boil it down to a simple formula, the object is, openly or ly understanding one's fellow rodents in the rat race.

title: FUND SOUGHT TO AID INDOCHINA REFUGEES
description: GENEVA, Aug. 23The international community will be asked to contribute to a $12.4million program to help keep alive in Thailand nearly 5r,000 refugees who have fled the Communist takeovers in neighboring Laos, South Vietnam and Cambodia.

title: New Chinese Style Of Fracture Repair Is 1,200 Years Old
description: TIENTSIN, China, Aug. 23 (Reuters)  Chinese doctors have developed a method of setting broken bones based on a technique used in the Tang Dynasty, about 1,200 years ago.

title: Far. From Seventh Avenue, a Fashion Filled Life
description: WESTHAMPTON, L.I.After working 20 years on Seventh Avenue, Frank Adams found he hated getting up in the morning. The gloom and doom in the garment district were getting to him, so he decided to get out. He opened a men's clothing shop here, and it prospered. That was three years ago.

title: For Now, a Stopgap
description: ROMETradition's are changing in Italian politica. For the first time in years, Amintore Fanfani is no longer at the head of the Christian Democratic party, and the party itself is barely holding on to its position as Italy's dominant political force.

title: Lightning Injures Nearly 100
description: LESLIE, Mich., Aug. 23 (AP) Several bolts of lightning smashed through the Wheel Inn campground near here today, injuring nearly 100 persons. The police said about 30 victimes were treated and released at hospitals in nearby Jackson and Lansing.

title: RIVAL SIDES MEET IN LISBON CRISIS1
description: LISBON, Aug. 23President Francisco da Costa Gomes, summoned Premier Vasco Goncalves and the leaders of the military forces opposing him) to an emergency meeting at hiss office today in an apparent effort to stave off bloody conflict between the two sides.

title: Joseph. Durso
description: Billy Martin, the 20th manager of the New York Yankees, peered over brown shell spectacles, puffed on a Danish briar pipe and asked a burning question: What was the first state to secede from the Union? He waited out a few seconds of silence while Catfish Hunter and Bobby Bonds walked past his office in Shea Stadium, then answered his own question south Carolina. And what was the last state to secede? he asked next. He paused again patiently, like any scholar dealing with the uninitiated, then completed a historian's double play with a smile of satisfaction North Carolina.

title: L.I. Artists Aid Guild Hall
description: EAST HAMPTONNinety leading American artists who live in Long Island's East End have donated paintings and sculptures for an auction at the Sotheby ParkeBernet Galleries in Manhattan on Sept. IS for the benefit of Guild Hall.

title: Late TV Listings
description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: Paul G. Wood Marries Veronica Nolan
description: Veronica Marie Nolan, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James A. Nolan of Queens Village, Queens. was married yesterday to Paul Gerard Wood, son of Mr. and Mrs. John F. Wood, of Freeport, L. I. The Rev. Thomas Phelan performed the ceremony in the Roman Catholic Church of St. John the Evangelist with the Rev. Patrick Tonry and the Rev. Harry Boyle as concelebrants of the nuptial.

title: SlowStart Contest
description: The Republican leadership is a small club of welllined, familiar faces compared to the unpredictable scramblihg of hasbeens and newcomers, of wellknown and unknown figures, seeking the Democratic nomination. The prize is worth the scramble. Public opinion polls show that Senator Edward M. Kennedy would defeat President Ford and that other prospective Democratic candidates, though trailing their President, are their enough to, make the 1976 election a closely fought contest. Moreover, a recent survey indicates that, by a margin of 42 per cent to 34 per cent, the public expects the Democrats to win the Presidency next year.

title: CITY YOUTHS CALL. CAMP FOOD GOOD
description: FISHKILL, N.Y.A long line of Tshirt clad youngsters filters into the camp dining hall. Impatient and hungry after a morning round of archery and swimming, they noisily scamper around the tables and grab favorite seats with their friends.

title: Late Bear Scores Top Cards by 14 13
description: CHAMPAIGN, Ill., Aug. 23 (AP)Clifton Taylor scored twice in the fourth quarter today and the Chicago Bears scored a lastminute, 1413 victory over the St. Louis Cardinals in a National Football League exhibition.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: As your editorial of Aug. 10 correctly points out, serious problems exist in the general revenuesharing program. Over the past two summers, the Southern Governmental Monitoring Project of the Southern Regional Council has assigned seventy investigative intents to various communities in the eleven Southern states for the purpose of assessing the operation and effects of revenue sharing.

title: Students Build a Marine Lab
description: SMITHTOWN  A young marine scientist is awaiting the day when he will enter a cement mixer to take an inventory of the marine creatures that hopefully will be attracted to a manmade reef soon to be constructed in Smithtown Bay on the Long Island Sound.

title: Marine Recruits Will Face A Higher School Standard
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 23 (Reuters)The, Corps will require the 75 per cent of all new recruits be high school graduates to cut down on disciplinary problems, according to the Marine Commandant tleneral Lnuis Wilcon.

title: Notes Cleaning House For the Bicentennial
description: COULD America get rid of its proliferating mountains of roadside debris in time for its 200th birthday if every tourist were provided with a litter bag for the trash that is now casually discarded along the wayside? It certainly could, says the U.S. Department of the Interior agency entrusted with the job of sprucing up the country for next year's Bicentennial celebration. To prove its point, the agency, which operates the Johnny Horizon 76 cleanup program, has distributed soma 20 million litter bags to date, and is still handing them out to visitors at various national parks and historic sites.

title: BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Her face, her name and her title were all that appeared on 10,000 outdoor billboards across the country. Shirley Cothran, the reigning Miss America, was selling neither toothpaste, nor automobiles nor any other product. So why 10,000 billboards?

title: Confessions of a rack watcher
description: Every fall reason the same old questions surface is fashion finished? Are the new looks really new? Should we care about the latest Gucci bags when we can hardly afford to fill our grocery bags? Yet daily newspapers still give space to the Paris collections, and TV talk shows still invite designers to rehash the same old hemline hype.

title: Dining Out in Jersey
description: ****The Manor, 111 Prospect Avenue, West Orange. (201) 7312360.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: QN. ELIZABETH 2 (Cunard). Left Cherbourg Aug. 19; due 9 A.M. at W. 55th St.

title: Watergate Donors Still Riding High
description: One might expect them to be the pariahs of the business world. Tarnished by public exposure as illegal campaign contributors during the Wa(tergate scandal, surely they must have slunk away in disgrace to an ignominious retirementshunned by former friends and an embarrassment to old business associates. At least a few of them must have paid debilitating fines or be serving long sentences in Federal.

title: Black Film Stars Tennis Match Is Rated a Smash Hit in Harlem
description: Playground basketball, long considered New York's top city game, was shoved into the back =ours yesterday when five black film stars staged an exhibition tennis match in Harlem before a crowd of cheering teenagers.

title: Garage Sales Mushrooming
description: HILLSDALEGarage sales have created a new class of  specialists people who will price items for homeowners, advise them on the best selling techniques to use and even conduct the sales for them.

title: Jon K. Porter Weds Miss Gettemy
description: Jessica J. Gettemy, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. James N. Gettemy of Farmington, Conn., and East Orleans, Mass., was married to Jon K. Porter yesterday at noon in the Church of the Holy Spirit in Orleans by the Rev. Wells B. Grogan, minister of the First Congregational Church in Cambridge, Mass. A reception was given at Eascape, on Nauset Heights in East Orleans, the summer home of the bride's uarents.

title: 4Yank Homers Top Angels,124, Mets Lose to Giants, 21, in 9th
description: For all the pain and frustration the Yankees have suffered this season, they really have no one to blame but themselves. Therefore, the excruciating embarrassment they heaped upon the California Angels yesterday could not be excused as the behavior of a team justified in gaining some sort of vengeance.

title: Miss Savage Bride Of Henry Roberts
description: The North Branch (NJ.) Reformed Church was the setting yesterday evening for the marriage of Catherine E. Savage, daughter of Mr. and Mrs H. James Savage of Lebanon, N.J., to Henry P. Roberts, son of A. Sydney Roberts of Wakefield, R.I., and. Palm Beach, Fla., and the late Mary Ellen Plant Roberts.

title: The PostBerkeley PostAgnew PostNixon Blues
description: A few months ago I went back to Berkeley look for myself. Somewhere between 1967 and 1976 I'd left a large piece of myself somewhere. thought I might find it at Berkeley, for it was because of Berkeley that I went to work for Spiro Agnew and Richard Nixon. It's all over there now. Berkeley is as offbeat and funky as ever. But the hate has evaporated. And in a remarkable way, Richard Nixon has succeeded in accomplishing precisely what he was elected to accomplishhe has calmed the nation.

title: Home Maintenance To Aid the Aged
description: CARLE PLACEA home maintenance and winterization program will be added to existing services for the elderly in Nassau County, a Spokesman for the Department of Senior Citizen Affairs has announced.

title: Editors Choice
description: CLAKA REEVE, by Leonie Hargrave. (Knopf, $8.95.) A proper Victorian young lady enmeshed in some gothic ??? wefldone Fictional mime of period and genre.

title: A Tale of Two Cities.
description: On opposite sides of the nation last week, two America's greatest cities were in crisis. In San Francisco, the police and firemen went on strike for higher wages, a dispute lasting three days and settled only when the Mayor invoked emergency authority to override the city legislature and impose a settlement.

title: U.S. Takes Over Wetland Preserve
description: An 1,800acre preserve of wetlands in the Carmans River Basin recently came under management by the United States Fish and Wildlife Service, bringing the number of Long Island refuges to seven.

description: JERUSALEM, Sunday, Aug. 24  Secretary of State Kissinger and Foreign Minister Yigal Allon of Israel said shortly after midnight that the latest exchanges between Egypt and Israel had moved the two sides nearer to a conclusion of a new Sinai agreement.

title: Golfers Battle the Heat
description: FORT WORTH, Aug. 23The Tournament Players Championship has been held this week in weather so hot that several players have been forced to adopt unusual headgear for protection against the sun.

title: $1MILLION DAMAGES ASKEDFORM'GOVERN
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 23 (AP)A lawsuit once thrown out of Federal court is alive in state court now and offers Senator George McGovern, Democrat of South Dakota, the possibility of collecting nearly $1.1million in damages for campaign contributions made to President Nixon.

title: Notes and Tapes Were Delivered With Bronlman Ransom Money
description: In addition to taking $2.3million in ransom money from Edgar M. Bronfman when he paid them off to release his kidnapped son, Samuel Bronfman 2d, the abductors compelled the father to return ransom notes and tapes to them.

description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 23Information Minister V. C. Shukla firmly denied today rumors that Prime Minister Indira Gandhi's 28yearold son Sanjay had become prominent in policy making.

title: Paper Back Talk

What kind of writing do you do? the editor asked curiousIv.

description: REINJeanette. A stong will be unveiling In loving memory of our beloved Jeanette Rem on Sunday, Aug. 31. 11 A.M., at Wellwood Cemetery, Ping Lawn, L.I.

description: Staff aides of the State Public Service Commission have proposed cuts totaling $275million in a $456million electricrate increase being sought by Consolidated Edison, a commission lawyer said last night.

title: Letters to the Editor.
description: To the Editor: the vacancy problems attacking older office buildings, loft buildings and industrial buildings present New York City with an unprecedented opportunity [Moveouts Weaken. Prewar Buildings, Aug. 3]. These buildings in many instances should be recycled into residential usage. What I have in mind is a series of Sohos. Certainly many areas of Park Avenue South, the West 30's, 40's and 50's are ripe for such residential recycling.

title: Pact Reached at G.M. Plant
description: LORDSTOWN, Ohio, Aug. 23 (UPI)Some 9,000 employes of General Motors Corporation facilities at the Lordstown complex were ordered to return to work Monday and Tuesday pending ratification of a tentative agreement in a fiveweek strike ati the Fisher Body plant here. Local 1714 of the United Auto Workers reached agreement with the company last night and set, a ratification meeting for 11 A.M. tomorrow at the Mahoning County Country Club. Details of the agreement were withheld pending the union's vote.

description: RUTHERFORD The state's Department of Transportation has ruled out the possibility of reserving one lane of Route 3 as an express road for New Yorkbound buses and car pools during rush hours.

title: Massachusetts Raises Fees
description: BOSTON, Aug. 23 (AP)Tuition for Massachusetts residents at state colleges will be increased from the current $300 to $500 a year during the next 18 months, by vote of trustees of the colleges. Tuition for outofstate students will be doubled to $1,200 a year.

I., home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Burges Green of Providence and Rockport, Mass. The ceremony was performed by Judge Anthony Giannini of the Rhode Island Superior court.

description: MINEOLAAn alcoholism counseling program that will include weekly therapy sessions is under way for Nassau County employes.

title: If You Go.
description: To Spetsai, you can Choose among many modes of transportation. The island is 53 nautical miles from Piraeus and is serviced at least three times a day by steamer (eight hours with stops) and twice a day by hydrofoil (1% hours). Fares range between $4 and $10 depending on which type of boat you choose and which class of service. Boats between Kosta and Spetsai depart almost continuously during daylight hours. Porto Kheli, five kilometers north, also has a boat service. The trip from Kosta takes 20 minutes and costs $1, from Porto Kheli 45 minutes and $2.50. By car it is closer to 100 than 80 miles from Athens to Kosta, but the roads are good all the way, twothirds of the journey by superhighway. Allow three hours driving time. From Patras allow four.

title: SOVIET IS RETICENT ON GRAIN HARVEST
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 24Though It is more than half gathered, the Soviet harvest has received muted notices in the official press, underscoring Moscow's concern over the outcome.

title: Lions Down Chiefs, 2724, With 3 Late Touchdowns
description: PONTIAC, Mich., Aug. 23 A 35yard touchdown pass from Greg Landry to Charlie Sanders in the final quarter was the key play as the Detroit Lions defeated the Kansas City Chiefs, 2724, today in the new PonMet Stadium. The play came with five minutes to play as the Lions won their first preseason game by overcoming a 173 Kansas City lead.

title: Zucchini King of Summer Squashes
description: EAST HAMPTONWhen the amateur gardener drops zucchini seeds into the soil, he usually gets more than he bargains fora Zucchini tend to grow faster than they can be harvested and left unpicked can double in size almost overnight. After several weeks, they grow to the size of baseball bats, too big for even the neighbors to accept.

title: Schoolyard Basketball: A Primer Of Styles And Wiles
description: New York is playground athletics. Right up there with the garment district and winos on the Bowery is the instituand of schoolyard basketball. It's essential, like bananas in Central America.

title: Susan Jean Irving Is Betrothed To Joseph Rieser Jr., a Lawyer
description: Frederick Irving, United States Ambassador to Iceland, and Mrs. Irving of Providence, R. I., and Washington, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Susan Jean Irving, to Joseph A. Rieser Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Rieser of Beaver, Pa. A wedding next March is planned.

title: New Democrats and ??? Realities
description: The 75 freshmen Democrats in the House of Representatives began the year with high hopes that, with their help, Congress would seize the initiative from the President. Eight months later, when Congress went into its August recess, many of them left feeling deeply frustrated. Neither feeling was totally warranted. Both grew out of perhaps unrealistic expectations about the ability of Congress to govern on its own.

title: SCIENTISTS STUDY PORPOISES SONAR
description: SEATTLE, Aug. 23 (UPI) Fats in the foreheads of porpoises enable them to focus sound waves in the ocean, according to two chemistry professors at Seattle University, Dr. Usha Varanasi and Dr. Donald C. Malins, in a project funded by the Office of Naval Research.

title: New & Novel
description: B.H.Friedman's novel embroiders upon the difficulties of being a Boswell. Assigned to do a magazine series on a legendary, harddrinking, globetrotting photojournalist, a writer named C. E. Wilton becomes ar intimate of his subject and writes two books about him. Jeff MacMaster, whom Wilton depicts to Almost a Lite (tins is a book within a book), is a largerthanLife photographer who feels that his best work is behind him. When Almost a Life appears after the photographer's death, it displeases his widow, who was also a journalist and terminal spouse.

title: Miss Quinby Married to Jeffrey Eberle
description: The Milton (Mass.) Academy Chapel was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Marguerite T. Quinby, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. William C. Quinby of Milton, to Jeffrey L. Eberle. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. William D, Eberle of Washington and Small Point, Me.

title: New Elizabeth Publisher
description: SIOUX CITY Iowa, Aug. 23 (UPI) John McGaugh, 49 years old, publisher of The Sioux City Journal for the last four years, has been named publisher of The Elizabeth, (N.J.) Daily Journal. The announcement was made by Duane Hagadone, president of Hagadone Newspapers, which owns both papers. Mr. Hagadone said Dean A. Krenz, 45, publisher of the New Jersey paper, would replace Mr. McGaugh at Sioux City.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: CAMBRIDGE JUNCTION, Mich., Aug. 23 (AP)David Pearson, who has won five of the last six Grand National stock car races at Michigan International Speedway, took the pole position today for tomorrow's 400mile event. Pearson averaged 159:798 miles an hour in the Wood Brothers Mercury at the twomile oval he.calls his favorite. Buddy Baker, in a Ford, earned the other front row spot. A. J. Foyt in a Chevrolet and Richard Petty, in a Dodge, are on the next row. Behind them are Bobby Allison in. Matador and Coo Coo Marlin in a Chevrolet. A short Memorial service wil lbe held before the race to pay respects Tiny Lund and Mark Donohue, drivers who died as a sult of racing accidents last weekend. The speedway owned by Roger Penske, Donohue's dose friend and asso. ciate.

title: job Outlook For Youths Is Pictured As Dismal
description: TRENTONThe state had a record number of high school graduates this yearnearly 112,000and 62 per cent of them plan to enter college or to go on to other advanced studies next month. However, of those graduates planning to end their schooling and seek permanent employment, only a little more than a third, the lowest percentage since 1964, had assurances of a job.

title: Of Things To Come
description: Robert Silverberg is the John Updike of science fiction. He has been writing for a long time, he has written a great many books, his writing is of uniformly high quality, he is still quite young for someone of his accomplishments and, despite all those accompliehments, he has never earned the reoutafion he deserves. Even among his admirers there is a widespread suspicion that anyone who writes with such facility must somehow be insubstantiaL In a typical Silverberg fiction, as in a typical Updike, the reader misses any sense of struggle, of the creator shaping a recalcitrant medium to his chosen design by an almost superhuman act of will. To put it bluntly, we distrust the artist who makes it look easy.

title: Price Rises Seen From Grain Boycott
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 23Organized labor's announced boycott of Sovietbound wheat shipments could drive domestic food prices higher, the opposite of what labor leaders say they intend, according to grain dealers, farm leaders and Government economists.

title: Jesuit, an ExNixon Aide, Marries
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 23 (AP)  Dr. John J. McLaughlin, the Jesuit priest who was a White House adviser to Richard M. Nixon, was married today in a civil ceremony to a woman who helped run his unsuccessful Senate campaign in 1970.

title: Colonial Meals for the Contemporary
description: NEW HAMPTONIf your kitchen has a salamander, a calabash and a Turk's head, you can become a gourmet hearthside cook, according to Dorothea Connolly.

description: VAIL, Colo., Aug. 23 (UN)President Ford has received lengthy cablegram from Secretary of State Kissinger on the status of the Middle East negotiations, the White House Press Secretary, Ron Nessen, said today.

title: The Chicken Book
description: Some words contain a builtin snicker that defies seriousness. Herring. Midget. Prune. Chicken. Mere is something intrinsically absurd about the bird.

description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 23 (AP) Democratic committee chairmen in the House still stray from the majority position of their party colleagues, but less often than they did in the past, according to Americans for Democratic Action.

description: This, means that at a tax rate of $8.17 for every $100 of assessed value, the city, which is hardpressed for revenue, will receive $20.9million less in property taxes this year than it would have collected if the original assessments had been retained.

description: ATLANTIC HIGHLANDSThe second annual Sandfire Ocean Race from Sandy Hook to Fire Island. Inlet will be held next Sunday. The event is cosponsored by the South Bay Cruising Club and Atlantic Highlands Yacht Club.

title: The Tennis Industry's Big Bound Upward
description: NORTH CONWAY, N. H.Tennis is now Big Business. There was a time, not too long ago, when it was regarded as just a social sport, the privilege of the monied class. Now, it has become a billion dollar industry with an expansion potential still impressive, the experts say.

title: Sunday Observer
description: In Love and Death, Woody Allen gets the girl again. It is becoming, a bad habit of his. Woody Allen should never get the girl. It is bad enough to go to the movies and have to watch Robert Redford get the girl. Or Paul Newman. Even Jack Palance. A man can take that One accepts the American reality, realizes that the getting of the girl is inevitable if blessed with Redford's masculine beauty, Newman's insouciance, Palance's magnificent cheekbones. The getting of the girl is their cinematic due.

title: ABSTENTION URGED IN ARMS RESEARCH
description: VANCOUVER, B. C. Aug. 22 The recently retired Orreetor of the disarmament division in the United Nations Secretariat urged scientists today to abstain from further research on weapons.

title: Garage Apartments Among Suburbia's Hottest Items
description: Ann Miller's threeroom apartment has wide oak floorboards, a 12foothigh beamed ceiling and a view of woods from every side. The wind, the rain and racoons in the garbage account for most of the noise she hears. There isn't another apartment for miles. Inside and out, the flavor of the place seems more that of New Hampshire or Vermont than that of Connecticut.

title: Mary L. Cellucci Is Married on L. I.
description: Mary Louise Cellucci, a summa cum laude graduate of Skidmore College, was married yesterday afternoon to Edward Cantey Woodbridge, who is in the money market portfolio and bond trading division of the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company here. The Rev. Charles Newberg performed the ceremony at St. John's of Lattingtown Episcopal Church in Locust Valley, LI, assisted by the Rev. Martin Healy, a Roman Catholic priest.

title: NATHAN SUSSNER
description: Nathan Sussner, retired vice president of Allied Textile Printers of Paterson, Ni., died Friday in Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 79 years old and lived at 2 Fifth Avenue.

title: Eating Out of Poets Hands
description: Dear Simca. You ask what's brewing, baking, and bubbling in the poets kitchens these days. By luck, a charming and informative book, John Keats's Porridge (edited by Victoria McCabe, University of Iowa Press, paper, $2.95), recently fell into my hands and has given me a chance to pokeany nose in the noes stocknotc and to sample their favorite recipes. was a gingerly business, believe me. One poet groused at me, It's bad enough you skewer our poems, do you have to meddle with our eating and drinking habits? You're always carping. Taking my life in one hand and a tall glass of Jack Daniels (by far the poets most popular elixir for contemplation and inspiration) in the other, I venture a few tentative conclusions.

title: Free Banquets Lure Elderly
description: HIGHLAND PARK  The Guide Michelin probably would not give it even one star, for haute cuisine it's not, but the simple, hearty fare that is served at the Reformed Church of Highland Park five mornings a week is hard to beat.

description: MINEOLAThe first sally into providing minibus service in lightly traveled residential areas. Nassau County got off to a rousing start recently.

description: When Winnie Newman, writer, used to take her children to the theater, she remembered that there usually was a hero and only one woman in a cast of perhaps six.

description: ziruce, nauhof Mr. and Mrs. Robegrt ruce of Fort Lauderdale, was married at noon rday to Pierre Trenee lin, son of Mr. and Mrs. Michelin of Paris and grandson of the late Michelin cofounder of ichelin Tire Company.

title: Greater love hath no man than to lay down his wife for his country
description: TumTum, the nickname given to the fat Prince of Wales, later King Edward VII, by the Marlborough House set sums up the whole man. He was a sexual glutton as well as a gourmand, and his inner life was limited to his visceral experience. Condemned by his mother, Queen Victoria, to a boyhood prolonged into late middle age, Edward, or Bettie as she called him, couldn't even be said to have been Copax imperil nisi imperasset. (He would have been capable of ruling, provided he hadn't ruled.) Even without the harsh Germanic education he suffered and resisted under the Prince Consort's orders, Bertie would never have become a philosopherking; not even a soldierking in the manner of Frederick the Great, since he couldn't enunciate clearly the words of command. Bertie was made for pleasure, and as a seeker of pleasure he pursued a comfortable and successful career.

title: What They Are Saying
description: Billy Herman, at his induction into the Hall of Fame Baseball always was a struggle for me. I was a utility infielder on my high school team and now I'm joining the greatest baseball team in the world.

title: INTEGRATION, YES; BUSING, NO
description: Proponents of courtordered school busing could in no circumstances have found pleasure in the report last spring of a study indicating that busing is reinforcing segregation in our big cities. But their distress was aggravated by the fact that the study came from a renowned champion of integration, Dr. James S. Coleman, a sociologist whose ambitions 1966 report on the beneficial effects of school integration had done valuable service for the probusing forces.

title: Washington Farm Policy Makes Few Friends in Iowa
description: BONDURANT, IowaHoward Elson watched for a couple of dry, blazing months this summer as drought took a steady toll of his corn crop. By the time showers came in midAugust, onefourth of the vain was beyond help.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: The time has come for the United States to sdecide whether it really wants a domestic steel industry. If we do, then it is time quit wailing whenever a steel company tries to raise prices. If American steel companies cannot regain competitive profit levels and return on capital, then this nation will be at the mercy of foreigners for steel.

title: SHE'S FOUND HER MEDIUM
description: Benita Eisler is a woman who gave up a meditative, scholarly career for a public, demanding and energetic life without losing anything of herself in the bargain. Midway in her thirties when she grew tired of being a literary translator, sitting alone in the library with only a French dictionary and a copy of Sartre, she did a 180degree turn and sailed into the hectic, highpressured and glamorous world of television.

title: Spa Closes on Record Note
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Aug. 23America's oldest race track wound up the busiest meeting in its 113year history today with a crowd of 26,654 watching a favorite and a long shot win their divisions of the split 71st Hopeful Stakes.

title: Between the harpoon and the whale
description: Hurled like a firecracker, a 250pound harpoon from a Russian ship landed amid a pod of sperm whales off the coast of California last June 27, a Friday. The liarpoon, with its grenade head, gouged through 20 inches of blubber on the back of one of the whales and detonated. In itself the event was not unusual. Thousands of whales are killed this way every year for their oil and meat. But this time the harpoon sailed over the heads of two men in a rubber speedboat who were trying to save the whales from slaughter. For the first time in the history of whaling, human beings had put their lives on the line for whales.

title: State Is Pushing Bicentennial Projects
description: TRENTON  Despite me budget crisis, which has forced widespread cutbacks in state spending, New Jersey's plans for celebrating the nation's Bicentennial next year have not been crimped badly. Officials reported last week that most of the projects are near completion or well under way.

title: Japan's Whaling Fleets Have Catch Quotas Cut
description: TOKYO, Aug. 23(Reuters)Japanese whaling fleets in the Southern Hemisphere have had their catch quotas slashed under a provisional international agreement reached here, the fishery agency announced today.

title: BANGKOK IS CALM AFTER FLAREUPS
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Aug. 23 Life in Bangkok has returned to normal after two days of violence, including the sacking of the Premier's home by dissident policemen and an armed attack by technical students on Thammasat University, in the heart of the city.

title: When Rome ruled the world and Indians owned America
description: Begin with a point in past history. Add fiction. By  blending the two a skilled storyteller can put the reader in the middle of a faraway time and make the surroundings come alive. The past, dramatized in this way, becomes closer, more vivid than history books make it for the most of us. But creating fictional people who cast convincing shadows on historic times, or unfolding a background that is more than a textbookish backdrop is not an easy task. It requires a particularly disciplined imagination.

title: A Bicentennial Musical Splits Connecticut Town
description: WALLINGFORD, Conn., Aug. 23.A 19yearold college stu I dent has caused a disturbance here this summer by writing a musical comedy for the local Bicentennial Commission about a controversial Perfectionist commune that existed 100 years ago.

title: ProCelebrity Tennis is a Hit

title: MUSIC VIEW
description: The matter hasn't been brought up for some time, but this weekend, as we stand hesitating between the summer and fall music seasons like Orpheus on the brink of the underworld, why not think about the invisible opera orchestra? As it happens, the New York City Opera season that opens on Wednesday night offers two productions in which the pit is covered with black gauze and the musicians become unseen phantoms of the opera.

title: Suffolk Seeks Zone For Foreign Trade
description: ALBANYIn an ettort to create jobs and foster economic development in the area, Suffolk County officials are seeking authorization from the Federal Government to create a foreign trade zone at the former air force base at Westhampton.

title: If You Go
description: canal or river cruising In Britain, you have a wide choice of rental firms. One hundred and fifty of them rent selfcatering boats. Rental charges vary according to the number of berths per boat and the time of year. Most boats are available from April through October and range from fourberth to eightberth. In the spring or fall you can rent fourberth craft for as little as $150; in July and August the same boat would cost up to $320. Bedding, dishes and cutlery are all supplied. Many boats are are booked well in advance.

title: SIHANOUK PLANS A SPEECH AT U.N.
description: PEKING, Aug. 23 (Agence France Presse)Prince Norodorn Sihanouk of Cambodia will go to New York this year to deliver a speech to the United Nations General Assembly, the Prince's office here announced today.

title: Nancy Jay Schieffelin Bride of Carl Brauer
description: Nancy Jay Schieffelin, whose ancestors include John Jay, first Chief Justice of the United States Supreme Court, and Commodore Cornelius Vanderbilt, was marTied yesterday to Carl M. Grauer, an assistant professor of history at the University of Virginia. Justice of the peace Daniel R. Coquillette performed the ceremony at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Powell of Cambridge. Mass., brotherinlaw and sister of the bride.

title: Burn Specialist Gets Post At the New York Hospital
description: Dr. G. Thomas Shires, a nationally recognized leader in the field of surgery, renowned for his work in the treatment of burns and trauma, has been appointed surgeoninchief of the New York Hospital and professor and chairman of the Department of Surgery, Cornell University Medical School.

title: The Mental Blockade
description: HAVANA, Aug. 22  There is a more relaxed attitude in Cuba these days toward the United States, but that's about all. The economic blockade is lifting, but after fifteen years of Cuban Communism, the mental blockade remains.

title: Cost of Day's Hospital Stay Up 204 Per Cent Since 1960
description: LINCOLN, Neb. (UPI)The cost of a day's stay in a hospital has risen 204 per cent since 1960 and physicians fees went up 74 per cent during the same period.

title: Cabarets Are Staging a Comeback, 01 Chum
description: When, in a popular film of 1973, Liza Minnelli declared life is a cabaret, ol chum, she was of course referring to Berlin in the 1930's. From the look of things around the city these nights, however, she might just as well have been hymning contemporary Manhattan. Over the past two years or so, cabarets, or small nightclubs, have been springing up all over New York. Shuttered are the raunchy rock emporiums of the 1960'sFillmore East, the Electric Circus and so forth; making a comeback is the small, chic boite, the smoky holeinthewall, the intime jazz spot, and even the sort of decadent den where Cabaret's leering master of ceremonies might feel at home. Fear City or not, people are taking to the streets again after dark. Indeed, night life here hasn't been so active since the 1950's, when lowtab, hightalent clubs like The Bon Soir, The Village Vanguard, The Upstairs at the Downstairs and The Blue Angel flourished.

title: GRANTS CALLED 71ARD TO APPLY FOR
description: WASHINGTON, Aug 23 (UPI) General Accounting Offlee has accused the. Federal Go'vernment of making it difficult, and costly for state and Irk&. governments to apply for the more than $52billion in grants dispensed by Washinginn each year.

title: Spirit Still Moves Jets And Giants
description: NEW HAVEN, Aug. 23For sheer drama, the Jets and Giants have done it all in their brief football rivalry. Or have they?

title: Injections in 15 V.A. Patients in Michigan Called. Deliberate
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Aug. 23 An official of the Veterans Administration Hospital here said today that medical investigators had concluded that someone deliberately injected a paralyzing drug into at least 15 patients at the hospital, killing at least two of them.

title: 30,000 Aliens Seized in July
description: SAN PEDRO, Calif., Aug. 23 (UPI)  Immigration officials arrested almost 30,000 illegal aliens in California last month and 60,000 in the 10state Western region. They also announced that they had seized more than $1million in drugs and narcotics in July, including more than 10,000 pounds of marijuana and 6,000 pills.

title: Reds Score 8 in Fifth and Defeat Pirates
description: PITTSBURGH. Aug. 23 (AP)The Cincinnati Reds scored eight runs in the fifth inning, then four in the eighth, when Johnny Bench hit a threerun homer, and defeated the Pittsburgh Pirates, 127. today.

title: New Hampshire Concerts Gain
description: WALPOLE, N. H.When John Gibbons tunes his harpsichord just before a performance, he invariably draws a crowdcurious members of the audience who stroll up to poke their heads under the upraised top and pepper him with, questions like the perennial, Did you build it yourself?

title: Clara Walmsley Is Wed To John R. H. Blum Jr
description: The marriage of Clara Pollard Walmsley to John Robert Halsey Blum Jr. took place yesterday afternoon in Northeast Harbor, Me., where the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Robert Miller Walmsley of New Orleans, have a summer home. The bridegroom is the son of Mr. Blum of Riverside, Conn., and the late Suzanne Delatour Blum. The Rev. Douglas MacLean Morrill performed the ceremony in St. Mary'sbytheSea Episcopal Church.

title: More Shark Attacks on Men
description: SAN DIEGO, Aug. 23 (AP)A maneating shark is much more likely to go after a man than a woman, says a Navy scientist. In a study of recorded attacks, there were nine male victims to every female victim, Dr. Scott Johnson, a biophysicist at the Naval Undersea Center in San Diego, said yesterday.

title: Greeks Doom Junta Chief, But Leniency Is Indicated
description: ATHENS, Aug. 23Former President George Papadopoulos and two officers who helped him engineer the 1967 military coup were sentenced today to death by firing squad for insurrection and treason. But within hours of the court verdict the Government indicated that it might commute the sentences, touching off a political furor.

title: Shape of Things, to Come
description: JERUSALEMLike everybody else in the Middle East, Israelis disagree sharply about the shape of things to come. Among those Tasked to speculate about the condition of this region twenty years hence were Premier Yitzhak Rabin, Defense Minister Shimon Peres and General Ariel Sharon, who commanded the African invasion and encirclement of the Egyptian army that wound up the stalemated Mideast war of October, 1973.

title: British Labor Confronts a Labor Party Prime Minister
description: LONDONAugust in Britain is a 31day tea break, a time of suspension and renewal, when the Government closes shop and whole sections of the, population seem to disappear to the Shores and into the countryside.

title: BRIDGE
description: Explanations of conventional bids must always be made to the opponents on request, and the explanations are, of course, provided by the partner of the player who made the bid. Some entertaining possibilities arise when the conventional bid is misinterpreted by the bidder's partner.

description: Sarah Clarke Blair, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Lyon Blair of Little Silver, N.J., was married yesterday afternoon to Oliver Cary Smith, son of Mary Hoffmann Smith of La Jolla, Calif., and the late Millard Watts Smith of Indian Wells, Calif.

description: WILKESBARRE, Pa., Aug. 23With the revelation of a second suspicious bigtriple. harness race at Pocono Downs, state investigators are seeking to link the latest incident to similar fix at tempts that took place at thoroughbred tracks in Pennsylvania and New Jersey.

description: These are ghost stories  tales of boogers, witches and haints'told by the people of the Appalachian Mountains in Northeast Georgia. They are best read aloud at night in the wilderness, near a slowly dying fire.

description: TOKYO, Aug. 23 (AP)China's Deputy Premier, Teng Hsiaoping, today held talks in Peking with a visiting United States Congressional delegation, the official Hsinhua press agency reported.

description: WYANDANCH  The theater was naked, except for the glare of a few uncovered lightbulbs, and it still smelled of wet concrete. The reverberations created by the band and the orchestra were too strong. And the din from the young audience was overwhelming. But the sound was not as bad as had been expected. The accoustical engineer had not even begun to work and besides, what better way to finish one season than with a preview of the future?

title: Bahrain Announces Arrests
description: BAHRAIN, Aug. 23 (AP)Authorities have arrestedanunspecified number of persons who posed a rea danger to the security and stability of this Persian Gulf emirate, the Interior Ministry said today. Some of those arrested have been linked with sabotage organizations recenly uncovered in neighboring countries, the announcement said. Officials refused to provide details.

description: A 16yearold Bronx youth was arrested yesterday as the second suspect in the slaying of two Bronx supermarket employes who were shot in the head July 21 after turning over $4,500 in receipts from the store's safe to two robbers.

description: TRURO, Mass., Aug. 23Hundreds of people flouted the law here today by flaunting their naked bodies and reclaimed a traditional Cape Cod nude bathing beach.

description: HARRISON, N. Y., Aug. 23 Virginia Wade, the fiery British player who says clay courts bore me to death, will face the infinitely patient Chris Evert in tomorrow's final of the MediQuik Women's Tennis Classic. The winner will receive $14,000, the loser $7.000.

title: Ideas&Trends/continued
description: WASHINGTON  About a year and a half ago, Congress established the National Center on Child Abuse and Neglect. This month the center finally got its first director, a New York City lawyer who is a specialist in the problems of children. and 13 others in 10 regional offices being set up around the country.

title: Lions Open New Stadium In Pontiac Before 62,094 Fans
description: PONTIAC, Mich.; Aug. 23The Detroit Lions and 62,094 of their followers moved into a new apartment today, the Pontiac Metropolitan Stadium. Like typical tenants they found much to praise and some features to nitpick about.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: GROSS NATIONAL PRODUCT rose 6.7 per cent in the second quarter to $1.44trillion. After adjustment for inflation, the G.N.P. at an annual rate rose 1.6 per cent in the second quarter, following a decline of 11.4 per cent in the first quarter.  The Consumer Price Index rose 1.2 per cent in July to 162.3 (the 1967 level equal 100) or at an annual rate of 14.4 per cent. July's increase was the largest in 10 months and well above the June increase of 0.8 per cent. Agriculture Secretary Earl L. Butz said food prices would increase 9 per cent in 1975 with 1.5 per cent of this attributable to sale of grain to the Soviet Union.

title: Alioto Vetoes Board's Bid to Block Raises
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 23 (AP)  Mayor Joseph Alioto vetoed a move today by the San Francisco Board of Supervisors to amend the city charter to strip policemen and firemen of their special raises after the strike.

title: Meditation Routine Spreading in U.S.
description: DENVER, Aug. 22Often, the secretary to Harold L. Davison, a 37yearold lawyer and municipal judge in Denver's suburb of Aurora, will get an order from her boss late in the day: No calls. Im meditating.

title: Anywhere one looks the slippery slope is covered with oil
description: Since Lyndon Johnson announced. seven years ago, that he would not run for office again, convulsions in the international system have radically affected our perceptions of the landscape we inhabit. With the election of Richard Nixon, in that year of assassinations at home, an unpopular war abroad, the invasion of Czechoslovakia by the Red Army, it might have been expected that the cold war would intensify. Instead, the bipolar world, which had characterized the postwar era, had come to an end as the direction of United States foreign policy passed into the hands of two men committed to the pursuit of power politics largely divorced from ideological considerations. In short, the cold war gave way to the fivepower world of America, Russia, Japan, China and Western Europe that in some respects resembled the balance of power in Europe during the 19th century. The opening to China and the policy of dtente with Russia seemed in, keeping with the notion that balanceofpower politics worked.

title: U.S. Jump Team Riders Named
description: Four of the five members of the PanAmerican Games jumpirrg squad have been named by Whitney Stone, chairman of the Equestrian Games Committee of the United States Horse Olympic CommitShow tee. The four are News Buddy Brown of South Salem.

title: The Isle Of the Magus
description: THUS spake John Fowles in his mesmerizing novel, The Magus, and as a devout mesmeree it was inevitable that along about my fourth reading of the book I would start wonderinglike Fowles's supercilious protagonist Nicholas Urfewhether the island of that name was real, symbolic or simply an illusion conjured up by a sorcerer in novelist's clothing. Phraxos was beautiful. There was no other adjective; it was not just pretty, picturesque, charmingit was simply and effortlessly beautiful. It took my breath away when I first saw it  and it still takes my breath away when I shut my eyes now and remember it.

title: Planners, in Search of Urban Space, Look Up
description: Architects, planners, and city officials are looking with new interest at the roof as a valuable open space in a crowded urban environment.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: R AMADAINT, the ninth month of the Islamic lunar year, is a time of prayer and fasting in the Arab states, Iran, Indonesia and other Moslem countries. These countries also happen to be major oil producers and beneficiaries of billion of dollars in wealth extracted from the rest of the world. Increasingly the oil states are playing a pivotal role in world finance and economic development.

title: INVESTING
description: The banker's image is one of grayflannel conservatism, and bank shares have traditionally been regarded in much the same way. Investors in bank stocks often seek high yields, steady growth and security, although lately they have seen their shareholdings plummet in a direct reaction to New York City's fiscal crisis.

title: Ann Senft Bride of Joseph Fitzpatrick
description: Ann Robinson Senft and Joseph Lorenz Fitzpatrick were married yesterday afternoon by the Rev. Dean Frey, pastor of the Lincoln Street Methodist Church, at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Craig T. Senft Of Ridgewood, N.J. Mr. Senft, president of Litton Educational Publishing, Inc., and group executive of the Litton Publishing Group, is vice chairman of the Government Advisory Commission on Bboks and Libraries of the The bridegroom is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Fitzpatrick of Shamoken, Pa. Mr. Fitzpatrick's father is a Pennsylvania State Hearing Examiner. The bridegroom is regional manager of the Eastern Home Care and Oxygen Company in Mount Carmel, Pa.

title: lets Will Rely, on Defense Against Giants
description: NEW HAVEN, Aug. 23The Jets know all about Craig Morton.

description: A federally financed program to find ways to help victims of crime in the city is being terminated amid criticism that it has squandered Federal money and thereby jeopardized other programs financed from Washington and Albany.

description: QN. ELIZABETH 2 (Cunard). Lett Chrrbourg Aug. 19; due 9 A.M. at W. 55th St.

description: What happens to cover girls when their faces no longer smile out from the magazine racks? Does that early sharp focus on their looks tarnish everything that follows?

title: There is a Failure of Leadership
description: JOHANNESBURG  It is not unfair to say that one main reason the problems of Rhodesia sometimes seem insoluble is that they are being handled by men who may constitute the real Rhodesian problem leaders, both black and white, who have not been up to the task.

title: Four Killed in Plane Crash
description: DUCHESNE, Utah, Aug. 23 (AP)A light plane with four men on board plummeted to earth as the brother of the pilot and a group of Boy Scouts watched in the Uinta Mountains. All four passengers died. The victims, all Utah residents, were identified as Gene Wilson. 41 years old, of Springville George A. Lux, 25, of Lehi Joseph F. Hoover, 26, of Orem. and David Brent Bird, 35, of Salt Lake City.

title: Faithful Savor Rural Life
description: ZAREPHATH The annual National Camp Meeting and Convention of the Pillar of Fire Church ends here tomorrow, and for those who attended the sessions it means forsaking a rural settlement for the bustle and realities of everyday life.

title: Letters Taking Tea To Heart in England
description: To the Editor: Edmund Morris's delightful tribute to teatime, Britons Take Tea To Heart (Travel Section, Aug. 3), was truly a feast. May I add only the reminder that a bought tea need not be as expensive as the list of Mr. Morris's favorite places perhaps suggests.

title: Laver Stars in Business, Too
description: NORTH CONWAY, N.H.Beognizing that his days of winning big money in tennis tournaments are practically over, Rod Laver, the 37yearold Australian star, is busily building another careeras a businessman.

title: TV VIEW
description: Dick Cavett is a vexation. Engaging, intelligent, anxious to please, he seems tto have been caught in a revolving door; or, more accurately, to have been threshed by television, to have been beaten as if with a flail. His seeds are scattered.

description: WEST LONG BRANCHA program designed to alert the elderly to services and activities available to them in Monmouth County will be held at Monmouth College on Oct. 21.

description: Two men who reportedly visited a fashionable East Side restaurant and bar for several nights to size up business for a shakedown attempt were arrested as they were beating up the owner, the police said yesterday.

description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 23Like thousands of merchants across the country, Tom Cole is faced these days with soaring rates of theft and robbery. So, to increase his jewelry store's security here, Mr. Cole did the only logical thing.
