description: (OTB payoffs subject to 5% State tax)

title: Mummy Autopsy Seeks Cluesto Ancients' Health
description: DETROITUnder hot floodlights and before a closedcircuit television camera. Bill Peck gently lifted a loose end of the mummy's fragile linen bandage and began to unwrap the preserved corpse.

title: Advertising
description: For the first time since 1968, the RCA Corporation plans a nationwide advertising campaign for black and White television sets.

title: Thai King Donates Land
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Aug. 30 (AP)King Phumiphol Aduldet, in an effort to help millions of landless farmers, has donated his 20,000 acres of farmland in three central provinces to the Government for use in land reform, Premier Kukrit Pramoj announced this week.

title: Nonaligned Bloc Defining Stand on Israel
description: LIMA, Peru, Aug. 27Efforts to define developing countries' attitudes toward Israel were begun here today by a special committee at the conference of the socalled nonaligned bloc.

title: F.D.A. Orders New Label On Drugs Used in Spasticity
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 (AP)The Food and Drug Administration said today it had ordered new warning labels on a drug linked to six deaths from liver disease.

title: Proxmire Scores U.S. Funding Of Study of Marijuana and Sex
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 (Reuters)  Senator William Proxmire said today it was shocking that the Federal Government was financing a study of whether college men get sexually aroused watching pornographic movies while smoking marijuna.

title: Historians Collide on a Slippery Subject: Revolution
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 27Scholarship on revolutions and revolutions in scholarship have produced sharp controversy here at the International Congress of the Historical Sciences.

title: Today's Entries at Belmont
description: Horses listed in order of post positions Letter designates OTB listing

title: Proposal to Put City on an Allowance Diluted in Weekend Negotiations Here
description: The plan that would have put the city on a financial allowance, doled out by a board of trustees, was diluted during a series of private weekend negotiations involving Governor Carey, Mayor Beanie and various state, city, political and, financial figures.

title: The Governor Waffles
description: We aren't weakening the credit of the state; we are strengthening the credit of the city, Governor Carey boasted Tuesday evening as he and Mayor Beame announced a new plan for state financial aid and oversight to help stave off municipal default. But officers of the city's three largest banks insist that they had already informed state officials earlier that day that they could not guarantee state repayment of the M.A.C. bonds.

title: Savannah Utility Omission
description: The Savannah Electric and Power Company said yesterday it was omitting the quarterly 10cent dividend that would have been payable in October. It was the first omission announced by an investorowned utility since a similar announcement in the spring of 1974 by the Consolidated Edison Company of New York, the nation's largest investorowned electric utility.

title: Look Up and Live. (The Ozone Is Still Tiere.)
description: It has been over a year since two University of California scientists proposed the theory of ozone depletion by fluorocarbon. Since then, there have been significant developments:

title: Albus Takes Long Island P.G.A. Title
description: INWOOD, Aug. 27Jim Albus of LaTourette, Staten Island, captured the 39th Long Island Professional Golfers' Association championship today at the Inwood Country. Club. In the 18hole final over the par72 6,680yard course, the 35yearold Albus, a former Metropolitan open titleholder, defeated Roger Ginsburg of Muttontown, 3 and 2. Albus won $1,100 and Ginsberg $800. Albus took the lead with an eagle 3 at the 520yard third hole after dropping a wedge shot from a bunker. He scored winning birdies at the fifth, eighth, 11th and 16th holes.

title: SMITH REBUFFED ON RHODESIA TALK
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Aug. 27 (AP)All 16 black members of Rhodesia's whitedominated Parliament announced today that they consider the African National Council the true voice of the African people in the country.

title: Miss Little Appears on the Coast And Thanks the Black Panthers
description: I had no political awareness at all before this happened, Joan Little said of her recent trial for murder. I was just like any average 21yearold girl. All I wanted to do was go out and party.

title: Bridge:
description: The best performance by a player from the New York area in the recent Summer Nationals in Miami Beach was by Jim Linhart of Englewood Cliffs, N.J., who towers over his rivals from a height of 6 feet 8 inches. He won the first major title, the mixed teams, and then returned to New York to do a week's work.

title: U.S. ASSURES KOREA IT WILL HONOR PACT
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 27The United States assured South Korea today that it would honor its defense treaty with South Korea and would help deter any new attack from the North against the South

title: Constitution Week Set
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 (UPI)Saying, Let us always remember that freedom does not come free, President Ford today proclaimed the week beginning Sept. 17 as Constitution Week. He also designated Sept. 17 as Citizenship Day and called on government officials and civic leaders, to conduct ceremonies.

title: BANKERS EXPLAIN FISCAL PLAN VIEW
description: The primary reason for yesterday's rejection by the New York banks of the role proposed for them in Governor Carey's fiscal plan for New York City appeared to be a requirement that the banks buy $1billion worth of Municipal Assistance Corporation bonds a year from now if the public market for such bonds was in disarray.

title: Venezuela Oil Takeover
description: Nationalization of Venezuela's mammoth oil industry may or may not produce the benefits for the country envisioned by its proponents, but the tide of nationalism sweeping Latin America made it inevitable. Given that fact of hemispheric politics, the Caracas Government was prudent in fashioning legislation that permits a continuing role, by contract, for the foreign (mostly American) oil companies operating in Venezuela.

title: A Spy During World War II, Now She Seeks Out Fine Wines
description: WASHINGTONShe is, by her own description, a wine spyon the lookout for good wines at good prices on behalf of the customers of a Washington grocery store. When on the trail of a promising purchase she is likely to confide: I have sent out my spies.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: An offering of 750,000 common shares of the Puget Sound Power and Light Company, at $23.625 a share, was made yesterday by underwriters headed by Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc. and Dean Witter & Co.

title: Officials Still Disagree on City's Deficit
description: Even as efforts continued to put together a shortrange plan to prevent default by the city next month, there was still disagreement on the size of the deficit in the current year's budget.

title: Two Businessmen Indicted On ElectronicSpy Charge
description: Charles S. Christopher, 29yearsold, president and chairman of the board of the Surety Industries Company, a Dallasbased company, and Richard Geyei, 56, of North Palm Beach, Fla., the owner of Tracer Investigative Products, Inc. and the Geyer Detectiye agency, were indicted yesterday on charges of illegally using electronic equipment to spy on Mr. Christopher's business competitors.

title: City Area Job Loss Biggest in 25 Years
description: Employment in the New YorkNortheastern New Jersey area declined by 241,000 between June, 1974, and June, 1975, the largest annual job loss on record for the 25year period for which data are available, the United States Bureau of Labor Statistics reported yesterday.

title: News Summary and Index
description: THURSDAY, AUGUST 28, 1975

title: Haile Selassie of Ethiopia Dies at 83
description: Haile Selassie, the last emperor in the 3,000yearold Ethiopian monarchy, who ruled for half a century before he was deposed by military coup last September, died yesterday in a small apartment in his former palace. He was 83 years old.

title: U.S. Dollar Seesaws In Europe Markets; Trade Surplus Cited
description: BRUSSELS, Aug. 27 (UPI)The dollar seesawed today on European money markets following mixed reaction at a cut in the United States trade surplus for July.

title: BLOYS BRITT, EDITOR OF A.P. AUTO RACING
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C., Aug. 27 (AP)  Bloys Britt, auto racing editor for The Associated Press and a leading motorsports writer, died here today. He was 62 years old.

title: State Cites 31 Nursing Homes and Fines Three
description: ALBANY, Aug. 27The State Health Department levied $23,350 in fines against three nursing homes and cited 31 homes for operational deficiencies in August, Dr. Robert P. Whalen, the State Health Commissioner, said today.

title: Two Auxiliary Officers Beaten by Nude Man
description: Two auxiliary police officers, a man and a woman, were injuredthe man criticallyin Central Park last night when an apparently deranged nude man beat them with a nightstick he had taken from them, according to the police.

title: AGNES LEACH DIES; A CIVIC LEADER, 90
description: Agnes Goddard Leach, a leader for many years in civic, pacifist, educational and political organizations, died Monday in Keene Valley Hospital, Keene Valley, N. Y. She was 90 years old and lived at 1021 Park Avenue.

title: RUSSIANS ACCUSE WEST ON PORTUGAL
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 27 (AP)The Soviet newspaper Pravda accused the West today of open interference in the affairs of Portugal and said such acts were in conflict with principles set down by the recent European security conference in Helsinki.

title: Listing of Prices of Commodity Futures
description: Wednesday, August 27, 1975

title: State Optimistic on Unemployment Rate
description: TRENTON, Aug. 27A reduction in the number of layoffs in private employment and a better summer job market for young people as a result of Federal programs, is prompting some cautious optimism about New Jersey's economy among state labor officials.

title: People and Business
description: The Chase Manhattan Mortgage and Realty Trust, an affiliate of the giant banking organization, announced yesterday that Ross D. Hill had resigned as chairman and chief executive.

title: The Groaning Board Groans On
description: While ecologists discuss the politics of allocating the world's food supply and housewives protect food budgets by shopping with pocket calculators, the restaurant industry does business as usual. Diners who prefer smaller portions, for health or ecological or financial reasons, are totally ignored.

title: People in Sports
description: Although one year remains on his contract with the. New York Rangers, Bobby Rousseau announced his retirement today after 15 seasons in the National Hockey League. The popular forward underwent spinal fusion surgery early last season after appearing in only eight games.

title: Cahn ls Indicted on U.S. Charges Of Tax Evasion and Mail Fraud
description: William Cahn, who was District Attorney of Nassau County for 12 years, was indicted by a Federal grand jury in Brooklyn yesterday on 20 counts involving incometax evasion, mail fraud, perjury and making a false statement.

title: Seaver Records His 19th
description: SAN DIEGO, Aug. 27With Tom Seaver pitching a sixhit shutout for his 19th victory, the New York Mets gained ground on the leaders in their division tonight by beating the San Diego Padres, 70, for a sweep of the threegame series here. Losses by the Pittsburgh Pirates and St. Louis Cardinals earlier in the evening left the Mets five games out of first place, only two behind the secondplace Cardinals, and one behind the thirdplace Philadelphia Phillies who also lost.

title: Big Board Seat Prices Up
description: The New York Stock Exchange reported two seat sales yesterday at $125,000, up $25,000 from the last sale on Aug. 21. Despite the low trading volume and a sluggish market, the seat market was the strongest since July 31 when a membership changed hands at $130,000. The record price for the year was $138,000 in midJuly.

title: Life Without Catfish
description: In, case you're wondering how the Oakland A's are faring this summer without Catfish Hunter the report is; so far, so good. In case you're wondering who took his place on the pitching staff after he auctioned himself off to the Yankees for $3.75million, the answer is: three guys in the bull pen.

title: Oboe Proves Instrumental in the Naming of Kennel
description: Music, the theater and dogs have all played leading roles for Mrs. Helga Tustin. My husband, Whitney, was first oboe for the New York City Opera orchestra, she said, so when I was groping for a kennel name, I hit on Kenobo. Like so many others, Mrs. Tustin started with obedience. I bought an English cocker spaniel, she said, and was having trouble controlling him, so I enrolled him in a training course. He earned a C.D. [companion dog] degree. Then I bought a bitch, On Time Michelle, from Maurie Prager, a really great breeder, and the pup went through to a C.D.X. [companion dog excellent]. Since I had been going to shows, I decided to get a show dog and Maurie sold me On Time Pamela, who became a champion.

title: Democrats Pick New York For Convention Next Year
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27The Democratic party chose New York City over Los Angeles today as the site of its 1976 convention.

title: Bahrain's Premier Pledges New Assembly Elections
description: MANAMA, Bahrain, Aug. 27 (AP)The Premier of Bahrain, Sheik Khalifa bin Sulman alKhalifa, has pledged to hold new elections in the wake of the dissolution of the National Assembly, less than two years after its creation as an experiment in democracy here.

title: Revlon Raises Its Dividend
description: Revlon, Inc. announced yesterday that it was raising its quarterly dividend on common stock to 35 cents a share from 30 cents, payable Oct. 15 to shareholders of record Sept. 15.

title: Entertainment Events Today
description: Music

title: Germans Help Builders
description: BONN, Aug. 27In the face of a stubbornly continuing, recession, the West German Government decided today on a $2.2billion recovery program for the building industry and raised the expected federal deficit to nearly $15billion.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A member of the Rev. Sun Myung Moon's Unification Church was wounded and a second member beaten when they interrupted an attempted burglary by two men armed with shotguns at the church's estate in Tarrytown, N. The wounded member, Takeshi Ito, 30, who was grazed pellets when one of the shotguns was discharged, was treated at Phelps Memorial Hospital and released. The member who was beaten was identified only as John Hessell. He reported in fair condition at the hospital.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
BANKERS EXPLAIN FISCAL PLAN VIEW
description: The primary reason for yesterday's rejection by the New York banks of the role proposed for them in Governor Carey's fiscal plan for New York City appeared to be a requirement that the banks buy $1billion worth of Municipal Assistance Corporation bonds a year from now if the public market for such bonds was in disarray.

title: '75 Christmas Stamps Lack Cost Designation
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 (UPI)The two Christmas stamps issued for use during the 1975 holiday season will portray a madonna and child, and a cherub swinging from a Christmas bell. But, for the first time, they won't have a monetary denomination

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Ford Salutes Selassie As Leader of All Africa
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 (Reuters)  President Ford paid tribute today to the late Emperor Haile Selassie of Ethiopia as a towering leader for 50 years, not only of his own country but of the entire African continent.

title: Horatius at the Bridges
description: Like, the people who enjoy biting down on toothaches, many New Yorkers have been secretly thrilled at the prospect of the city's bankruptcy. What an outlet for guilt feelings and a justification for weltschmerz! (Would a bankruptcy be as much fun as a blackout?)

title: Gallup Poll Sees Reagan Ahead of Rockefeller
description: Republicans favor former California Gov. Ronald Reagan over Vice President Rockefeller by a small margin as President Ford's runningmate next year, if Mr. Ford is the party nominee. according to the latest Gallup Poll.

title: Democrats to Delay Energy Veto Vote
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27Senate Democratic strategists disclosed today that they would not try immediately to override a veto of the bill to extend oil price controls for six months beyond midnight next Sunday.

title: Naval and Oil Shipping Plague Strait of Malacca
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia The Strait of Malacca, the gateway between the Indian Ocean and the South China Sea and the legendary waterway of pirates and spice traders, has become a diplomatic and ecological battleground. Among the principal reasons are the recurrent presence of United States and Soviet warships and increasingly heavy tanker traffic, with accompanying oil spills.

title: French Aid Public Works
description: PARIS, Aug. 27The French Government today announced a plan to improve the lagging economy with heavy spending, especially in public works.

title: A Whaling Ship Sets Sail To Try to Save Her Prey
description: The Norwegian whaling ship Barba Negra set sail in New York harbor yesterday with two mechanical harpoons and a hearty crew of 10 to do what she was not designed to dosave whales.

title: A Hepatitis Alert For 5,000 Diners In Oregon Issued
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Aug. 27 (AP)An epidemic alert was issued and mass inoculations continued today to try to stem an outbreak of hepatitis that could affect up to 5,000 patrons of two Portland restaurants. Multnomah County health officials estimate that about 5,000 persons patronized the restaurants from July 10, when the spread of the illness apparently started, until the restaurants closed voluntarily Aug. 22.

title: Lower Survival Found For Blacks With Cancer
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27Blacks who develop cancer have less hope of longterm survival than whites of the same sex, according to data collected during the last 20 years in a major study by the National Cancer Institute.

title: Officials of Fed Believe Dollar Is Undervalued
description: Tile dollar, which rose strongly in value in the foreign exchange market this summer, is still somewhat undervalued and should strengthen further this year, Federal Reserve officials said yesterday.

title: Democrats to Delay Energy Veto Vote
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27Senate Democratic strategists disclosed today that they would not try immediately to override a veto of the bill to extend oil price controls for six months beyond midnight next Sunday.

title: Alabama Miners Out
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Aug. 27 Most of Alabama's 6,000 coal miners ignored today a Federal court order to return to work and continued to picket two of the area's largest mines, apparently in sympathy with a wildcat strike that started in West Virginia.

title: MOVE TO AID TIMOR NOW TAKING SHAPE
description: DARWIN, Australia, Aug. 27 (Reuters)An effort to stop the widespread carnage in Portuguese Timor gradually took shape today.

title: John R. Dunning, 67, Dies; Isolated Uranium Isotope
description: Dr. John Ray Dunning, a leader in American development during World War II of the method of isolating uranium 235 used in nuclear weapons and enriching uranium fuel for nuclear power plants, died Monday at his home in Key Biscayne, Fla. He was 67 years old.

title: Violations Spotted In 15 Food Places By City Inspectors
description: The City Health Department has announced the names of 15 more food establishments that failed their second HealthCode inspection, and said they faced closing if they failed a third and final inspection. The names of the establishments, and the conclusions, follow:

title: A Jainist Monk Brings Ascetic Ways Here
description: Muni Sushil Kumar wouldn't hurt a fly. It is against his religion.

title: Chess:
description: MONTILLA, Spain, Aug. 26 Luck supposedly plays no part in a chess game, and yet the results of Ivan Radulov, a Bulgarian grandmaster competing in the International Torneo del Vino here, would seem to belie that belief.

title: Only the State to Prosecute in Bronfman Kidnapping.
description: Carl A. Vergari, the District Attorney of Westchester County, announced yesterday that the alleged kidnappers of Samuel  Bronfman 2d would be prosecuted in State Supreme Court in Harrison and that Federal charges against them would be dismissed.

title: Reaction Here to Choice, In One Word, Is Jubilant
description: From top executive to jostling subway rider, New Yorkers reacted jubilantly yesterday to the news that their city would be host next year to its first Presidential political convention since 1924.

title: Books of The Times
description: The wonderful thing about naturalists that they alone seem to remember what it means to be natural. Like the defenders of some once standard but now decaying faith, they preach from the venerable pulpit of universal design. They remind us that underneath all the layers of technology and ecological catastrophe there is an ??cheology of essences, of what is given, ??f things that cannot be changed if we are to keep up any longer the pretense that we ourselves are part of the evolution of the earth.

title: TV: Vereen Brings Stage Energy to Cowin at Ya'
description: Ben Vereen Comin' at Ya gets a fourth and final summershowcase presentation tonight at 8 on NBC. Mr. Vereen came into his own TV series through reviewcatching performances in the stage musicals Hair, Jesus Christ, Superstar, and Pippin. He sings, he dances, he acts, and he literally simmers with energy, providing the human equivalent of what scientists call a monopole, a center of magnetic force.

title: Gazelle Won: By Land Girl At Belmont
description: Staving off challenges of four rivals In a stirring drive down the homestretch, during which all five horses were tightly bunched, Tartan Stable's Land Girl held on at Belmont Park yesterday to gain her first stakes victory of of the year. The occaslob, was the 80th running of theGazelle Handicap, in which eight 3yearold fillies' competed for a gross purse of $56,150 over the 1mile route. And since there was no young filly of the late Ruffian's caliber to dominate the issue, a tense contest developed.

title: ELIAS KABIL
description: Ellas Kabil, a textile maufacturer and importer, died of cancer yesterday in St. Francis Hospital, Roslyn, L.I. He was 74 years old and lived at 150 Elderfield Road. Manhasset, L.I.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Norwegian whaling ship Barba Negra set sail in New York Harbor with two mechanical harpoons and a hearty, crew of 10 to dramatize the plight of the mammal that the ship was designed to killthe whale.

title: Trial of 12 Accused in HomeStake Case Is Transferred to Tulsa
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 27 (UPI)The trial of 12 men accused of swindling $100million from celebrities through an alleged oil drilling fraud has been moved to Tulsa, Okla.

title: Judge Rules Grain Boycott Is Not Protected by the Constitution
description: CORPUS CHRISTI, Tex., Aug. 27 (UPI)A Federal judge ruled today that longshoremen as a group were not protected by the Constitution in expressing their political views by blocking shipment of American wheat to the Soviet Union.

title: Swayduck Resigns Post As Head of Lithographers
description: Edward Swayduck, president of New York Amalgamated Lithographers of American Local 1 for the last 27 years, has resigned for health reasons and will be succeeded by Edward Hanson, the local's executive vice president, union sources reported yesterday.

title: Giants' Montefusco Fans 14
description: It is John Montefusco's belief that he should generate some publicity for himself and the San Francisco Giants. One of his recent quotes was to that effect Hey, I want people to remember me. What's the sense of being here if nobody's going to remember me?

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Lindenwold Line Told to Cut Fares

title: Police Recall the Best Old Days
description: They remembered Mayor Fiorello H. La Guardia wanting to take away their nightsticks, gangsters battling for territory in Prohibition days, and trying to keep peace in the breadlines during the Depression.

title: City Officials Term Choice Expression of Confidence
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27Deputy Mayor Stanley M. Friedman of New York hurried to a telephone after the Democratic National Committee's site selection committee voted here today to hold the party's national convention in New York. He wanted to tell the good news to Mayor Beame.

title: Bradshaw to Punt; Jets Have Target
description: When the Giants face the Pittsburgh Steelers at Princeton University Saturday they not only will have to contend with an experienced quarterback named Terry Bradshaw, they also will have to deal with an eager neophyte punter whose name also happens to be Terry Bradshaw.

title: NJB Investors Will Pay Holders of Debentures
description: NJB Prime Investors of Clifton, N. J., a real estate investment trust said yesterday that it wold pay holders of its 7 per cent subordinated debentures due March 31, 1980, and its 6 per cent convertible subordinated debentures due Nov. 1, 1991, a cash price of $20 net for each $100 principal amount, without payment for accrued interest.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Death of a King
description: History will remember one thing above all about Haile Selassie, Conquering Lion of Judah, King of Kings, Elect of God, Emperor of Ethiopia for fortythree years and actual ruler of the Queen of Sheba's land for six decades. It was that poignant moment on June 28, 1936, when this wisp of a monarch stood at the General Assembly rostrum of a dying League of Nations in Geneva and jabbed at the conscience of an indifferent, uncaring world.

title: REPORT BY BURNS SPURS STOCK RISE
description: A late upsurge in buying enabled the stock market yesterday to post a small gain in continued sluggish trading after showing no decisive trend throughout most of the session.

title: Elderly Protest an Income Limit On Use of SeniorCitizen Centers
description: Three hundred elderly me?? and women carrying such signs as Down With the Means Test Up With Dignity rallied yesterday at Federal Plaza on Foley Square to protest a new Government regulation imposing income limitations after Oct. 1 on those who use seniorcitizen centers.

title: Robin of Anticrime Team Investigated on Marijuana
description: Detective Robert Hantz, who was Robin in the celebrated Batman and Robin anticrime team in Brooklyn's BedfordStuyvesant section a few years ago, has been placed on modified assignment pending an investigation of a $700 fine levied against him in the Bahamas recently for allegedly possessing four marijuana cigarettes while he was there on vacation.

title: SWISS MAY BUY 72 NORTHROP JETS
description: BERN, Switzerland, Aug. 27 (UPI)The Swiss Government said today it might buy as many as 72 F5II Tiger jetfighters built by the American Northrop Company.

title: Hudson Mayors Prevail In Bid for Bond Backing
description: JERSEY CITY, Aug. 27 (AP)After an angry reception by Hudson County mayors when he sought their support for bond issue referendums today, State Transportation Commissioner Alan Sagner scheduled a meeting to reconsider the county's roadconstruction nronosals.

title: Reels of New Fellini Film Stolenin Rome
description: ROME, Aug. 27Portions of the originals of three films, including Federico Fellini's Casanova, have been stolen froth the studio where they were being shot, production sources announced today.

title: Giancana Murder Gan Identified by the Police
description: CHICAGO. Aug. 27 (UPI) A 22caliber pistol equipped with a homemade silencer was the weapon used to kill Sam Giancana, reputed crime syndicate figure, in his suburban Oak Park home, the police said today.

title: Morton to Withhold List in Dispute Over Israel Boycott
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27Secretary of Commerce Rogers C. B. Morton, citing a possible wave of adverse reaction from United States consumers, says that he is going to refuse to release even to Congress a list of domestic concerns that have been asked to support an Arab economic boycott of Israel.

title: INSURERS ASSAIL PROPOSED RULES
description: TRENTON, Aug. 27 (AP)Insurance companies and owners of autobody repair shops complained today that proposed state regulations to protect consumers were too rigid.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Wage Talks Weigh on Englewood
description: ENGLEWOOD, Aug. 27This affluent commuter town, facing budget stringen cies and. what promises to a hardfought mayoral election this fall, is at loggerheads over new pays contracts with all eight of its municipal unions.

title: ALEXIS R. WIREN, 78, OF DOWLING COLLEGE
description: Alexis R. Wiren, special assistant to the president of Dowling College in Oakdale, L.I., died Tuesday at his home there. He was 78 years old.

title: Bilingual Elections Due in 464 Counties Under Voting Act
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 (UPI) The Justice Department said today that preliminary census figures showed that 464 counties in 27 states must conduct bilingual elections this fall, because of recent amendments to the Voting Rights Act of 1965.

title: Market Place
description: A year ago, when interest rates were at their peak, the yield op securities of certain Government agencies ran a full percentage pointor 100 basis pointshigher than the return on Treasury issues of comparable maturities.

title: ARNHOLT SMITH HELD DEFENDANT IN SUIT
description: SAN DIEGO, Aug. 27 (AP)The financier, C. Arnholt Smith, is a defendant in another suit, this time an at??mpt by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation to collect $13.9million allegedly owed by an intrastate air carrier.

title: VIKING I IS PLACED ON PRECISION PATH
description: A coursecorrection maneuver at 2:30 P.M. yesterday placed the Viking 1 spacecraft on a precision course to orbit the planet Mars next June 19, Dr. Edgar M. Cortright, director of the Langley Research Center in Hampton, Va., announced at a news conference in Pasadena, Calif.

title: Navy Is Said to Have Identified 22 Substantially Defective Ships
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27, (AP)  Representative Les Aspin said today that Navy inspection reports showed 22 older ships in atrocious condition with defects including a bad hull that kept one submarine from diving.

title: An Investigation Is Ordered Into Gifts by Monsanto
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 27An investigation into reports of an illegal political contributions program at the Monsanto Company was ordered today by St. Louis County Prosecuting Attorney Courtney Goodman.

title: MRS. PERON NAMES NEW ARMY CHIEF TO APPEASE FOES
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 27President Isabel Martinez de Pern yielded to dissident army officers today and appointed a herdline opponent of the Peronist Government as commander in chief.

title: Learning Art of Museum Work
description: Kim Rosenthal repaired a 16thcentury gold embroidered silk shawl for the Costume Institute. Stacy Schrier helped design a new logo and calendar of events for the Junior Museum. Julie Iselin arranged an exhibition of metal jewelry and ceramics done by senior citizens and children.

title: 2.6% Rise Reported In Canadian G.N.P.
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 27 (UPI)Statistics Canada today reported a 2.66 per cent rise in the second quarter Gross National Product and called mid1975 the turning point of the current recession.

title: The Long View
description: The necessity for roundtheclock attention to the allimportant immediate problem of keeping New York solvent cannot be allowed to obscure the parallel need. for developing a longrange fiscal plan for dealing with all the problems that have contributed to the present disaster. Unless these economic and social forces are analyzed and understood, it will be impossible to plan wisely for a healthy and lasting recovery.

title: Wife of a Suspect Admits She Tossed Out $585,000
description: NEWARK, Aug. 27 (UPI)The wife of a narcotics suspect pleaded guilty today to a charge of having thrown three suitcases filled with $585,000 out her bathroom window as Federal agents searched their Teaneck home.

title: Judge Refuses To Drop Baer Charges
description: CLARKSBORO, N. J., Aug. 27 (AP)A Municipal Court judge declined to dismiss trespassing charges today against Assemblyman Byron Baer and four others in an incident at a farm near here during a migrant labor camp tour.

title: Tuesday's Fights
description: NEW BEDFORD, Mass.John Dennis, Attleboro, Mass., knocked out Walker Smith, WinstonSalem, N.C., heavyweights, 4 rounds. Weights not available.

title: Heat Kills Young Tiger
description: SAN DIEGO, Aug. 27 (AP)A young Siberian tiger from the Moscow Zoo apparently died of heat prostration while being flown to San Diego, an autopsy indicates. The young 220pound male tiger was found dead on arrival on Monday at Los Angeles International Airport after a nonstop flight aboard a cargo plane from Amsterdam.

title: Met Lifts Price Of Single Ticket At Six Operas
description: The Metropolitan Opera will raise the price of single tickets for several of the subscription performances that it expects to be in demand this coming season an effort to raise as much money as possible through the box office.

title: Toll Lane Gates Set
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 27 (AP)  Starting Sept. 3, automatic toll lane gates will be used on the Commodore John Barry and Benjamin Franklin bridges between Pennsylvania and New Jersey, the Delaware River Port Authority has announced.

title: Reaction Here to Choice, In One Word, Is Jubilant
description: From top executive to jostling subway rider, New Yorkers reacted jubilantly yesterday to the news that their city would be host next year to its first Presidential political convention since 1924.

title: Stocks in Best Rise In the Last 7 Months
description: The stock market posted its biggest gain in seven months yesterday, buoyed mostly by expectations that interest rates would decline soon.

title: Rail Freight Traffic Off 2%
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28The Association of American Railroads reported today that freight traffic on United States railroads during the latest week totaled an estimated 15.1 billion tonmiles, 2.4 per cent below the corresponding week a year ago. Carloadings in the same period totaled 454,149 cars, 4.9 per cent below last year. The American Trucking Associations, Inc., reported intercity truck tonnage was 11.4 per cent below last year.

title: Parking Aide Found Not to Have Sought Political Donations
description: A Manhattan grand jury has cleared the suspended director of the city's Parking Violations Bureau of allegations that his office had solicited and received $700 in contributions for a political dinner in his honor.

title: Sounds Move to Baltimore
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 28 (AP) The American Basketball Association ended months of uncertainty over its bankrupt Memphis Sounds franchise today when it announced that the club would move to Baltimore.

title: Sadat Set to Initial Accord; Israel Is Unsure on Terms
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 28President Anwar elSadat said in Alexandria tonight that he had no hesitation about giving his approval for Egypt to initial an agreement with Israel on Sinai. Initialing of the accord could occur as early as Sunday or Monday.

title: Screen: Exciting White Line Fever
description: The plot is inflated, the violence is inflatedthough wellshotthere is a lot of blacktop highway and a great many roaring vehicles that swerve, crash and burn.

title: Vanishing Jobs
description: The latest employment figures for the New YorkNortheastern New Jersey region provide gloomy confirmation that the jobloss malady is fast becoming regionwide, not an affliction of this city alone. It has clearly hit hard in Northern New Jersey and may be spreading for the first time to suburban New York counties as well.

title: How Carey Got Enmeshed In NoWin Fiscal Crisis
description: In a crucial and tumultuous week, Governor Carey has become deeply enmeshed in the lefty's fiscal crisisa political and governmental morass he had tried desperately to avoid on the theory that it was a no win situation.

title: Lidiya Fotiyeva, 93, Secretary To Lenin After Revolution, Dies
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 28 (UPI)Lidiya Fotiyeva, personal secretary to Vladimir I. Lenin, the Bolshevik Revolutionary, died Monday, Tass, the Soviet press ??gency, reported yesterday. She was 93 years old.

title: The Women Activists Found Little Peace At Bucolic School
description: When Sagaris, an experimental feminist summer school perched high on a mountain in rural Lyndonville, Vt., split into two camps, survival was on everyone's mind.

title: Events Today
description: Music

title: Bomb in Argentina Kills 4. A board a Military Plane
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 28An Argentine military plane carrying an antiguerrilla force of 114 men was ripped apart by a bomb today as it prepared to take off from the airport in uun, 750 miles northwest of Buenos Aires. At least four people died and more than a score were injured.

title: Pearson Wins Pole
description: DARLINGTON, S.C., Aug. 28 (UPI)David Pearson won the pole position for the Labor Day running of the Southern 500 stock car race. His qualifying speed was 153.901 miles an hour in a 1973 Mercury.

title: OFFICIALS OFFER NEW PLAN TO BAR A DEFAULT BY CITY
description: City, state and Municipal Assistance Corporation officials were trying to put together still another patchwork plan of financing arrangements yesterday that would raise the cash to avert a city default in the weeks ahead.

title: U. S. Out of Soccer
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Aug. 28 (UPI)  The United States soccer team was eliminated from 1976 Olmpic competition tonight when it dropped a 42 decision to Mexico in the qualifying competition. Tied, 22, midway through the second half, the Mexicans captured the lead at 24:11.

title: New Hampshire Race a Legal Tangle
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28An emergency request for guidelines for the special Senate election in New Hampshire has brought the Federal Election Commission fact to face with a host of vexing political questions that could radically alter the 1976 Presidential campaign.

title: Large Catches of Bluefish Reported By Anglers in Metropolitan Waters
description: AREA AThere is no dearth of bluefish in all the New Jersey shoreline waters. In Barnegat Bay and The Ridge, at The Klondike and at Island Beach State Park, fishermen have been reporting heavy catches on chum and bait. At The Klondike, tuna in the 5to7pound range have been mixing with the blues during the daytime. At Barnegat, N.J., trolling fishermen have taken tuna as heavy as 90 pounds. Fluke are also plentiful (7 to 8 pounds) south of Point Pleasant, at Beach Haven Inlet, and around Barnegat. Sea bass have been responding to sandworms and plugs in the morning, and in the evening to plugs at Seaside Park. Crabbing is good in Barnegat Bay.

title: The New Red Sox: Denny Doyle
description: BOSTON, Aug. 28With one out in the first inning, Denny Doyle pulled a line double into right field and scored on a double by Fred Lynn. Jim Rice's huge home run reached the bleachers in dead center, and the Red Sox had a lead of 30. In the second inning they got another run on a passed ball, and two more scored in the third when Carl Yastrzemski doubled, Lynn singled and both Rice and Rick Burleson hit sacrifice flies. Rice's shot was another monstrous drive to center, but this time California's Mickey Rivers outran the ball and made a splendid catch onehanded. With six runs to give him peace of mind, Darrell Johnson, Boston's resident djinn, managed to sit still while Roger Moret walked seven batters, four of them in one inning. The Red Sox won; 62, preserving their sevengame lead in the American League East. They had today off to replay their 78th victory and tell. themselves yes, this was the way they were supposed to do it, with the new guys furnishing the muscle.

title: SCHAEFER FESTIVAL DRAWS JAZZ FANS
description: A group of jazz musicians who record for CTI Records, headed by Grover Washington Jr., George Benson, Hubert Laws and Chet Baker, drew a capacity crow of 8,000 to the Schaefer Festival in Central Park on Wednesday evening. In ensemble and solo, most of them played a harddriving, intense kind of music.

title: Connors and Nastase Triumph, Miss Casals Upset in U.S. Tennis
description: The Rosebud never blossomed yesterday, but Jimmy Connors and Bjorn Borg were in full bloom during the United States Open Tennis championships.

title: Ulster's Fears Mounting as Talks Lag
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Aug. 28Efforts to reach a political settlement in Northern Ireland are deadlocked, and British officials are warning of is slide toward major sectarian violence in the province.

title: About Real Estate
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.L  The entrance to a building under construction in the Heartlands Industrial Park here looks like two giant C's facing each other.

title: Today's Entries at Belmont
description: Horses listed In order of post positions Letter designates OTB listing

title: Only in France: The Leg in Art History
description: DIEPPE, France, Aug. 24One of the zanier art shows this summer is surely the one at the local museum here on The Leg in the history of art. All the way from Assyrian sculpture to last year's kinetic montage.

title: Dissension Among Feminists: The Rift Widens
description: For the last several months, much of the feminist movement has been shaken by dissension. There have been debates over ideological questions, with some women declaring that the movement has taken too liberal and reformist a direction, losing sight of its radical origins.

title: Lisbon Formally Asks U.S. Aid in Angola Airlift
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28 (UPI)The United States has now received a formal Portuguese request for aid in airlifting 300,000 white settlers from Angola and will deal urgently and expeditiously with it, the State Department announced today.

title: Phils Beat Giants On 3Run 6th, 85
description: Garry Maddox's triple and doubles by Mike Schmidt and Johnny Oates sparked a threerun sixth inning yesterday that gave the Philadelphia Phillies an 85 victory over the San Francisco Giants at Candlestick Park.

title: Fans Enjoy Women's Tennis at Open
description: The interminable, boring matches that the Women's Tennis Association had feared would hurt its image have failed to materialize so far at Forest Hills. Spectators who flocked to the United States Open in recordbreaking numbers yesterday expressed delight with the women's matches as well as the men's on the slower courts.

title: Alexander, 17, Wins in Sailing
description: BAY HEAD, N. J., Aug. 28Mike Alexander of Miami won the Sears Cup today as he scored another first on the final day of the United States Yacht Racing Union's national junior sailing championship.

title: Rites Today for Mrs. Leach
description: A funeral service for Alice Brown Leach, civic leader, will be held today at 1 P.M. in Grace Episcopal Church, Broadway and 10th Street. Mrs. Leach died Monday in Keene Valley, N.Y., at the age of 90.

title: Aid for South Pacific Islands Is Urged
description: VANCOUVER, B. C., Aug. 28The head of the United Nations Environment Program today told nations participating in the Pacific Science Congress here that unless they took concerted action to preserve the islands of the South Pacific, those territories could soon become an oceanic wilderness.

title: M.A.C. PRICES OFF; 2 ISSUES AT LOWS
description: Prices of all Municipal Assistance Corporation bonds dropped a full point$10 for, each $1,000 of face amountin the taxexempt market yesterday. The older two of the

title: Restaurant Reviews
description: L'Estrel, at the corner of First Avenue and 58th Street, opened Aug. 5 in the rejuvenated quarters of the recently defunct La Croisette. The coowners, who give their names simply as Rita (up front) and Marguerite (back in the kitchen), have taken the place in hand like a couple of determined matrons in charge of a truant schoolboy, washing its face, putting it in clean clothes, giving it a good spanking, and setting it back on course.

title: ISRAELI JETS ATTACK TARGETS IN LEBANON
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 28 (AP)Israeli planes attacked suspected Arab guerrilla bases in Lebanon today as Secretary of State Kissinger was holding talks in Jerusalem about an EgyptianIsraeli accord on Sinai.

title: Box Scores and Standings
description: American League

title: The Rocky Road
description: For a man who disavows all intention of campaigning for himself, Vice President Rockefeller is giving an unsavory imitation of that activity. At a conference of lieutenant governors in Mobile, he contrived to sound enough like Gov. George C. Wallace to be facetiously accused of having stolen one of the Governor's speeches. In South Carolina he proudly bracketed himself with those two great champions of Reagan Republicanism, Gov. James B. Edwards and Senator Strom Thurmond, as a triumvirate with a very deep belief in states' rights.

title: Joseph Biben, 75, Is Dead; Publisher of Jewish Papers
description: Joseph Henry Biben, former publisher of The American Hebrew and other AngloJewish newspapers, died Sunday in Miami Beach. He was 75 years old.

title: Hove Carey Got Enmeshed In NoWin Fiscal Crisis
description: In a crucial and tumultuous week, Governor Carey has become deeply enmeshed in the city's fiscal crisisa political and governmental morass he had tried desperately to avoid on the theory that it was a no win situation.

title: POSTAL RATE PANEL BACKS 13CENT MAIL
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28 (AP) The Postal Rate Commission opened the way today for an increase in the cost of mailing a letter from 10 cents to 13 cents.

title: ECONOMY GAINING IN NORTH VIETNAM
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Aug. 28 (Agence FrancePresse)North Vietnam is rising quickly from the ashes of 30 years of war and eight years of American bombing.

title: Hashish Worth $2.6Million Found on a U.S. Tanker
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28 (Reuters)  United States custom agents have found Pakistani hashish estimated to be worth $2.6million on an American tanker in their fourth big drug smuggling seizure in 12 days.

title: Wily Tarzan Lives On,Dollarwise
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 28Four men, all large and a little paunchy, met here today and let out a jungle scream. Each of them could have said to the other, Me Tarzan. You Tarzan.

title: State Concedes Troopers Accepted Payoffs and Gifts
description: TRENTON, Aug. 28  The state police acknowledged today that troopers had acceptedpayoffs or gifts from truckingcompany executives and highway contractors and said that punishment of the guilty was handled within the department, without the filing of criminal charges.

title: More Help for Poor Nations Gets West Europe's Backing
description: LONDON, Aug. 28  West European delegates to economic meetings in Washington and the special session of the United Nations next week are convinced that important changes must be made in the world's economic system to provide developing nations with a greater share of the world's wealth.

title: Parolee Killed After Shooting Two Persons in a Hospital
description: BINGHAMTON, N. Y., Aug. 28 (AP)James A. Gilbert, 38 years old, an unemployed parolee, was shot and killed after he wounded a nurse and a patient at the Binghamton General Hospital here, the police said.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Belmont Race Charts
description: 1975, by Triangle Publications, Inc. (The Dally Racing Form)

title: Governor Reports Cut Of 5.820 State Jobs
description: ALBANY, Aug. 28 (AP) Governor Carey's office says that 5,820 permanent state jobs weer vacated between Jan. 8 and Aug. 20, reducing the state's permanent work force to 178,017.

title: OFFICIALS FASHION NEW PLAN TO BAR A DEFAULT BY CITY
description: City, state and Municipal Assistance Corporation officials were trying to put together still another patchwork plan of financing arrangements yesterday that would raise the cash to avert a city default in the weeks ahead.

title: BAER IS ACQUITTED IN TRESPASS CASE
description: CLARKSBORO, Aug. 28 (AP) Assemblyman Byron M. Baer and four coldefendants were acquitted today of trespassing charges filed by a local farmer after they attempted to visit a migrant labor camp on his property.

title: Pop Concert on Labor Day
description: An allday music festival, called the first Annual New York Pop Concert, will be held Monday at Freeport, L.I. Raceway. It is scheduled to begin at 11 A.M. and last until midnight. Sponsored by the new Jefron Productions, the Labor Day event will include Melanie, the Nitty Gritty Dirt Band, Orleans, Tom Paxton, Batdorf & Rodney, Barnaby Bye, Aztec TwoStep, Outlaws, Skyking and Jayne Olderman.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Judge Kevin Thomas Duffy dismissed yesterday a lawsuit that the Jockeys' Guild had filed in Federal District Court here against the New York State Racing and Wagering Board and stewards of the New York Racing Association. The Guild, a national association representing jockeys, filed the suit as a result of an incident at Belmont Park on Sept. 21, 1974, in which eight jockeys refused to ride in the seventh race because they believed that rain had made the turf course dangerous. The jockeys who refused to ride were fined $250 each by the stewards and they paid the fines under protest.

title: F.T.C. Asks Rules to Curb Funeral Home Practices
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28The Federal Trade Commission proposed today regulations that would prohibit a variety of funeralindustry practicesfrom unnecessary embalming to baitandswitch sales techniquesthat the commission said inflict economic and emotional injuries on the consumer.

title: Books of The Times
description: At the age of 16, living in a small Norwegian town and precociously fed up with Progress and Civilization, Thor Heyerdahl vowed he was going to return to nature. It is said that Joseph Conrad as a boy pointed to a spot on the map of Africa and announced, Some day I'm going there, which he didsee Heart of Darkness. After eliminating one by one the places on his map that seemed, from the paltry description in the encyclopedia, either too civilized or uninhabitable, Thor Heyerdahl's finger lit upon the island of FatuHiva in the Marquesas.

title: West Germany Reacts To U.S. Query on Nazis
description: BONN, Aug. 28 (Reuters)The West German Foreign Ministry said today it had passed on to justice authorities of the country's 10 states a United States request for information about 50 alleged Nazi war criminals living in the United States.

title: F. D. A. PROPOSES LIMIT ON PLASTIC IN FOOD PACKAGES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28The Food and Drug Administration proposed today to halt the packaging of many food items in polyvinyl chloride because the plastic has the potential for causing cancer.

title: Closing of Alabama Prison Units Is Ordered, Pending 4 Reforms
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Aug. 28 (AP)A Federal judge today ordered Alabama prison officials immediately to shut down isolation units in all state prisons unless those units meet cer??ain standards.

title: AMEX STOCKS UP IN ACTIVE SESSION
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market advanced sharply yesterday in slightly steppedup trading.

title: Books of The Times
description: At the age of 16, living in a small Norwegian town and precociously fed up with Progress and Civilization, Thor Heyerdahl vowed he was going to return to nature. It is said that Joseph Conrad as a boy pointed to a spot on the map of Africa and announced, Some day I'm going there, which he didsee Heart of Darkness. After eliminating one by one the places on his map that seemed, from the paltry description in the encyclopedia, either too civilized or uninhabitable, Thor Heyerdahl's finger lit upon the island of FatuHiva in the Marquesas.

title: Unveilings
description: LINZERCella. A stone will he unveiled in loving memory of our beloved Celia Linter on Sunday afternoon Aug. 31, at 2 o'clock, At the Linzer Mausoleum, Beth David Cemetery, EImont, L.I., NY.

title: ETHIOPIANS REPORT BURIAL OF SELASSIE
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Aug. 28 (AP)  Haile Selassie, the deposed Emperor of Ethiopia who died early yesterday, is already in his grave, Radio Ethiopia said today.

title: BERME REFUSED TO OUST 2 AIDES
description: Mayor Beame turned down an attempt by the Carey administration, which was under pressure from some New York bankers, to dismiss his closest aide, First Deputy Mayor James A. Cavanagh, and his Budget Director, Melvin N. Lechner, before they would consider a plan to assist the city, it was learned yesterday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Alida Van Laer Good, W. H. Hanley Wed
description: Alida Van Laer Good of Greenwich, Conn., was married there yesterday in the Round Hill Community Church to William Hazelton Hanley of Chicago, vice president in charge of investor and community relations for Gould Inc., manufacturer of electrical and electronics equipment. The Rev. Arthur Miller performed the ceremony.

title: New Logo Is Adopted by A. & P.
description: The Great Atlantic & Pacific Tea Company, Inc., one of the oldest and most recognized names in American business is chasing a new image. It has adopted a new corporate logo, to replace the old one, which the company has used since 1888 or possibly longer.

title: August Car Output Topping '74 Period
description: DETROIT, Aug. 28American auto production for August is expected to wind up at nearly 500,000 units, for the first time this year that output topped the comparable month a year ago.

title: Steeler Star to Play
description: Although they are in elite company with the Miami Dophins and Oakland Raiders as the only winners of all three exhibition games this summer, the Giants still do not know what kind of a team they will have. The Pittsburgh Steelers will help them find out tomorrow in the preseason contest at Princeton's Palmer Stadium.

title: Lincoln Tunnel Link Being Repaved
description: Repaving work began yesterday on the New Jersey approach ramp to the Lincoln Tunnel, causing delays during the morning rush hour.

title: Market Place
description: In recent years, the combination of inflation fears and a falling stock market at times has sent the price of goldmining shares sharply higher. Gold stocks, for example, performed spectacularly in 1973 and part of 1974. But for the last eight months the average stock has done better than gold shares.

title: REVLON PURCHASES COBURN OPTICAL
description: Revlon, Inc., the cosmetics manufacturer, announced yesterday that it had completed the purchase of Coburn Optical Industries Inc. of Muskogee, Okla., for 833,333 common shares of Revlor worth more than $57million. Coburn, which makes ophthalmic optica processing equipment, ophthalmic supplies and glass and plastic eyeglass lenses will be operated as subsidiary of Revlon. O. W. Coburn, founder of Coburn Optical, will continue as its president. shares of Revlor worth more than $57million. Coburn, which makes ophthalmic optica processing equipment, ophthalmic supplies and glass and plastic eyeglass lenses will be operated as subsidiary of Revlon. O. W. Coburn, founder of Coburn Optical, will continue as its president.

title: Black Couple in Home Bombing Shot in Accident
description: A couple whose home in Rosedale, Queens, was bombed last New Year's Eve because they are black were shot accidentally Wednesday night when the husband's pistol went off as a police officer tried to disarm him during a confrontation with neighbors, the police said yesterday.

title: Bellino II Facing Final U.S. Challenge
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Aug. 28Bellino II, the 8yearold French trotter who finished second to Savoir in last Saturday's $200,000 International gets a second chance for his first Western Re Hemisphere victory tomorrow night.

title: IMPORTERS GROUP ACCUSES A PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28An official of an organization of more than 1,000 American businesses and banks involved in importing goods contended today that he had been prevented from testifying before a Senate subcommittee against a bill that experts say would lead to higher costs for all Americans.

title: Canada and Soviet End Rift Over Fishing and Use of Ports
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 28Canada and the Soviet Union have settled their quarrel over Atlantic fisheries, and Soviet fishing vessels are again to be allowed to use Canadian east coast ports.

title: Liquor Board a Censor Of. Drinkers' Literature
description: HAWORTH, Aug. 28  The treasury of the White Beeches Golf and Country Club here is $1,000 lighter because of an Alcoholic Beverage Commission fine on charges of possessing obscene printed material, but its president would just as soon leave the issue a closed book.

title: Parkway in Jersey Lifts Its Ban on Motorcyclists
description: The Garden State Parkway shifted gears on motorcycles yesterday, bowing to cyclists' demands that they be allowed to use the 172mile road.

title: Bank Business Loans Here Dip $190Million for Week
description: Business loans at weekly reporting New York banks declined $190million In the week ended Wednesday, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York reported yesterday.

title: FRITZ WOTRUBA, 68, AUSTRIAN SCULPTOR
description: VIENNA, Aug. 28 (AP) Fritz Wotruba, Austria's leading sculptor in the postwar years, died today. He was 68 years old.

title: Plane on Mountaintop Perplexes Sheriff
description: CEDARTOWN, Ga., Aug. 28In normal times, Seals W. Swafford, the sheriff of Rolk County up in the North Georgia hills just across the Alabama state line, spends most of his time worrying about how to oversee 313 square miles of territory with just two deputies to serve papers and keep cars moving on the two highways into and out of town.

title: Lisbon Leaders Seen Acting on Premier
description: LISBON, Friday, Aug. 29Portugal's military leaders, working almost without sleep, were reported early today to be close to ousting Premier Vasco Goncalves, but peace within the armed forces and in the country remained in doubt

title: ROCKEFELLER KNEW OF NURSING ABUSE
description: Vice President Rockefeller said yesterday that he knew of poor conditions in some New York nursing homes as early as 1965, but that he had been powerless to prevent Medicaid abuses by nursinghome operators because of state budgetary restrictions affecting audits and inspections.

title: Mobil Oil Is Incorporating A New Worldwide Division
description: The Mobil Oil Corporation announced yesterday that it would combine its corporate North American and international exploration and producing activities into a worldwide corporate division by the end of the year.

title: ARABS EASE STAND ON ISRAELIS IN U.N.
description: LIMA, Peru, Aug. 28The. Arab delegates participating in a conference of nonaligned countries here agreed today not to press demands for the expulsion of Israel from the United Nations.

title: How the Governor Became Enmeshed in City's No Win Fiscal Crisis
STATE CHARGES 2 IN BRONFMAN CASE
description: The two men charged with abducting Samuel Bronfman 2d, the 21yearold heir to the Seagram fortune, were arraigned in a Westchester County court yesterday on state kidnapping charges.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International

title: A NEW DU PONT UNIT TO SELL ITEMS IN IRAN
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Aug. 28The first E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co. subsidiary to carry out the import and resale of du Pont products in the Middle East is to start sales operations here in the next few months, a du Pont executive said here today.

title: Band Camp Scoring Big Success
description: HACKETTSTOWN, Aug. 28 The 153 teenagers who are attending the Waldwick Band Camp here are trying, with stunning success, to march to the same drummer.

title: Dow Cuts Discounts On Latex Items Sold To Carpet Makers
description: Dow Chemical, U.S.A., a unit of the Dow Chemical Corporation, announced yesterday that its discount on styrenebutadiene latexes sold to the carpet industry would be reduced from 6 cents pound to 3 cents a a pound, effective Oct. 1. New net prices will be 37 cents a pound east of the Rocky Mountains and 38.5 cents a pound west of the Rocky Mountains.

title: Goncalves Bars Any WesternStyle Democracy
description: PARIS, Aug. 28 (Reuters)Premier Vasco Gonalves of Portugal said in an interview published here today that there was no room for a bourgeois democracy in his country.

title: Corporation Counsel Says City Services Would Supersede Creditors in Default
description: The city's first priorities if it defaults would be to pay municipal workers and keep city services functioning, Corparation Counsel W. Bernard Richland said yesterday. Holders of city securities would have to wait for their money.

title: Beanie Due to Sign Order On Graduated Pay Freeze
description: Mayor Beame is expected to sign an executive order today to implement the graduated wage freeze on Monday. The action would affect members of the unions that declined to agree voluntarily to the plan.

title: Pressure Is Enough
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Aug. 28 When sociologists became football fans, they saw the defensive line as a mirror image of American societyviolent, aggressive, and ready to attack the leader, who was known as the quarterback.

title: People in Sports
description: I think Phil Chenier and I will be the best backcourt in basketball. Every individual goal is behind me. I want to win the championship.

title: Mayor Orders 24 Aides To Give Up City Autos
description: Mayor Beanie yesterday ordered 24 assistant administrators, deputy commissioners and assistant commissionersto give up their city cars to save the city money. He directed that the vehicles be sold at public auction.

title: Jacobs Group Buys Bruins
description: A reorganized Buff alobased conglomerate still under investigation in a number of states received approval from the National Hockey LeagUe yesterday to buy Boston Garden and the Boston Bruins.

title: Wily Tarzan Lives On, Dollarwise
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 28Four men, all large and a little paunchy, met herd today and let out a jungle scream. Each of them could have said to the other, Me Tarzan. You Tarzan.

title: Open Interest
description: Thursday, Aug. 28, 1975

title: The Proceedings In the U. N. Today
CRAIG T. SENFT, 60, PUBLISHER, DEAD
description: Craig T. Senft, who rose from book salesman to president of Litton Educational Publishing, Inc., a vast American publishing conglomerate, died Wednesday in Valley Hospital, Ridgewood, N. J. He was 60 years old and lived at 200 North Murray Avenue, Ridgewood.

title: ARABS ESSE STAND ON ISRAELIS IN U.N.
description: LIMA, Peru, Aug. 28The Arab delegates participating in a conference of nonaligned countries here agreed today not to press demands for the expulsion of Israel from the United Nations.

title: 3 Rob Bus Near Baltimore
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 28 (AP)Two bus drivers and seven passengers riding on a southbound Trailways bus were robbed of $600 and jewelry by three armed robbers early today on the Washington Baltimore Parkway, the police said.

title: Business Briefs
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 28 (UPI)The United States Steel Corporation approved today a dividendreinvestment plan. Edgar 33. Speer, chairman, said the plan would permit stockholders to purchase newly issued common stock through reinvestment of dividends and optional cash payments up to $3,000 per quarter.

title: State Puts Off Plan to Charge Fees for Medicaid
description: TRENTON, Aug. 28  The state said today that it had decided to postpone indefinitely a plan to require Medicaid recipients to pay part of the cost of their medical services.

title: Eagles Conquer Bengals, 3020
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 28 (AP)Mike Boryla, a secondyear quarterback, threw two touchdown passes in his first start of the National Football League preseason and led the Philadelphia Eagles to a 3020 victory over the Cincinnati Bengals tonight.

title: Amtrak Plans for Labor Day
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28Amtrak has scheduled extra rail cars and other equipment to help the thousands of passengers expected on the line in the East and Northeast during the Labor Day period, a railway spokesman said today.

title: History vs. Social Stew
description: WASHINGTONThe Organization of American Historians recently released a survey showing that across the nation the study of history is being downgraded in favor of a broad social studies approach, issueoriented rather than chronological. Teachertraining institutions stress methods rather than a rigorous knowledge of historical fact. Any vaguely related subjectgeography, political science, economics, sociology, cultural anthropologyis deemed interchangeable with history for purposes of teacher certification. Such teachers may not know why the North won the Civil War or who was the fifth President or why Jefferson insisted on a Bill of Rights but they can ramble on about social change.

title: August Auguries: Bizarre and Out of Phase
description: Funny things are happening on the way to the recovery. Like fireworks in fall or turkey in summer, the economic news of August seemed bizarre and out of phase. The United States had barely lifted its nose out of the worst recession in a generation when inflation and interest rates began to rise too. The onset of such ominous events so early in the recovery, snuffed out some of the hopes for 1975 among the nation's economists.

title: Letter From Prague: A Writer's Appeal for Help
description: I am addressing myself to youas my personal friends who know who I am and what I think and who as important authors have done their share to prevent today's world from being in worse shape than it isin order to address myself through your mediation to all my colleagues in the socalled West and the socalled East.

title: Governor Reports Cut Of 5,820 State Jobs
description: ALBANY, Aug. 28 (AP) Governor Carey's office says that 5,820 permanent state jobs were vacated between Jan. 8 and Aug. 20, reducing the state's permanent work force to 178,017.

title: About New York
description: In this era of ethnicity, New York retains honors for diversity. There are few, if any, of the peoples of the world who do not make a showing here. Some groups are larger, electing officials and representatives and generally commanding recognition. Others are lessthanblocsize lots who surface only occasionally, more as a conversation, piece than as a sociological factor.

title: $250,000 Lottery Prize Won by Retired Banker
description: SEASIDE HEIGHTS, Aug. 28 (UPI)A 65yearold retired banker from Ocean County won $250,000 today in the state lottery's Jersey Jackpot drawing.

title: New Jersey Youth Drowns
description: HAWLEY, Pa., Aug. 28 (UPI) Brian Uhlman, 18 years old, of Cherry Hill, N.J., drowned in Lake Wallenpaupak yesterday despite the efforts of two men who tried to save him the, police said.

title: Social Democrats of Germany Aiding Portuguese Socialists
description: BONN, Aug. 28The Social Democratic party of West Germany has supplied several million dollars in aid to the Socialist party of Portugal during the last year and a half, according to German and American informants.

title: VISCOUNT WEIR, 69, OF SCOTLAND DIES
description: Viscount Weir, the Scottish industrialist, died Aug. 15 at his home in Kilwinning, Ayrshire, Scotland. He was 69 years old and lived also in London.

title: MORE GOAL MINES IDLED BY STRIKES
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Aug. 28 (AP)Much of the nation's soft coal industry was shut down today as unauthorized strikes spread in a miners' rebellion against the companies, Federal courts and their own union.

title: Contract Awards
description: Two Army contracts totaling $89.4million for Dragon antitank missiles and launchers and infrared trackers have been awarded to the astronautics division of the McDonnell Douglas Corporation.

title: Mets Win 4th in Row, 41, As Koosman Stops Dodgers
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 28Jerry Koosmau pitched the kind of professional game That wins pennants tonight as the New York Mets beat the Los Angeles Dodgers, 41, for their fourth straight victory. It moved them to within 4 games of the Pittsburgh Pirates, who did not play, and within one of the St. Louis Cardinals and Philadelphia Phillies, who are tied for second.

Some groups are larger, electing officials and representatives and generally commanding recognition. Others are lessthanblocsize lots who surface only occasionally, more as a conversation piece than as a sociological factor.

title: Sadat Set to Initial Acoord
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 28President Anwar elSadat said in Alexandria tonight that he had no hesitation about giving his approval for Egypt to initial an agreement with Israel on Sinai. Initialing of the accord could occur as early as Sunday or Monday.

title: President Plans Visit To Newport Tomorrow
description: PROVIDENCE, Aug. 28 (AP)  President Ford will arrive at 4 P.M. Saturday for a sixhour visit to Rhode Island and a speech at a Republican fund raising dinner, a White House spokesman said today.

title: A Vast Potential Seen in Mining Of Minerals From the Oceans
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28Mining in the oceans offers enormous potential for the United States to cope with threatened shortages of essential metals and other resources during the next 25 years, a panel of experts said in a report made public today by the National Research Council.

title: Catskill Void
description: Few among the thousands of New Yorkers who are this summer enjoying the charms of the Catskills are aware that this mountain region was the one glaring environmental failure of the last legislative sessiona session otherwise remarkable for environmental advances. The lawmakers allowed the Catskill Study Commission to expire before it had halfcompleted the work cut out for it.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: Peace Mission to Timor
description: DARWIN, Australia, Friday, Aug. 29 (Reuters)A Portuguese Government peace mission left here by air yesterday for Timor to try to stop the civil war there.

title: Mayor Refused to Oust Cavanagh and Lechner
description: Mayor Beame turned down an attempt by the Carey administration, which was under pressure from some New York. bankers, to dismiss his closest aide, First Deputy Mayor James A. Cavanagh, and his Budget Director, Melvin N. Lechner, before the bankers would consider a plan to assist the city, it was learned yesterday.

title: Lebanese Factions Clash; 4 Killed and 20 Wounded
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 28 (AP)Feuding factions fought with machine guns and grenades today In two neighboring Lebanese resort towns, killing four persons and wounding 20.

title: French Replace Chief in Corsica After Latest Strife
description: PARIS, Aug. 28The French Government tonight dismissed the regional administrator of Corsica after separatists there had battled policemen for the second time in a week.

title: Republicans to Vote Sept. 7 On Convention Site, Date
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28 (UPI)The Republicans announced today that they would decide Sept. 7 where and when they will hold their 1976 national convention. Kansas City, Mo., Miami Beach and Cleveland remain the leading contenders.

title: Cambodian Says Nation Is One Vast Workshop
description: LIMA, Peru, Aug. 28 (Reuters)  Deputy Premier Ieng Sary of Cambodia told the nonaligned nations conference here today that his country was one great workshop, with people struggling to restore industry, agriculture and communications destroyed in the Indochina war.

title: Corporation Counsel Says City Services Would Supersede Creditors in Default
description: The city's first priorities if it defaults would be to pay municipal workers and keep city services functioning, Corporation Counsel W. Bernard Richland said yesterday. Holders of city securities would have to wait for their money.

title: GRAIN PLAN KILLED BY WHITE HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28The White House has blocked one proposal by the Agriculture Department for reform of the scandalridden United States grain inspection system and trimmed down an alternative plan.

title: Yankees Set Back A's, 32
description: Bobby Bonds quit guessing and hit a twoout, tworun homer in the eighth inning that gave the Yankees a 32 lead over the Oakland A's. Tippy Martinez kept everyone guessing by striking out Angel Mangual with two on and two out in the ninth inning, saving the 32 lead and the Yanks' victory.

title: Argentina at the Brink
description: President Isabel Martinez de Pern has backed away from a confrontation with Argentina's Army; but her act of appeasement may only have postponed a showdown with an aroused and hostile officer corps. It is no exaggeration to say that the biggest single factor in the survival of Mrs. Pern's Government to date is the army's bitter memory of the seven years (196673) which it tried to govern that deeply divided country.

title: Herman L. Falk, 81, Lawyer And Federal Referee, Is Dead
description: Herman L. Falk, an assistant United States attorney here from 1921 to 1925 and a pretrial referee in Federal District Court from 1961 to 1965, died yesterday at White Plains Hospital. He was 81 years old and lived in New Rochelle, N.Y.

title: Laos Replaces U.S. Unit With 1,600 Russians
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Aug. 28 (UPI)Laos has replaced an 185member American advisory team with about 1,500 Soviet technicians and specialists, the Acting Laotian Foreign Minister, Phoune Sipraseuth, said in a newspaper interview today.

title: Buckley Would Give Tax. Break To Those. Who Housed Elderly
description: MINEOLA, Aug. 28Senator James L. Buckley said today he would introduce a bill next week that would give people a $1,000 tax deduction for letting an elderly person live with them.

title: 2 ACCUSED BASQUES FACE DEATH PENALTY
description: BURGOS, Spain, Aug. 28 (AP) The Spanish Government, striving to end terrorism, demanded death today for two Basques accused of having killed a policeman.

title: Esmark's Vigoro Helps to Raise Net
description: Esmark, Inc., the big holding company, reported yesterday that while its foodprocessing operations conducted by its Swift & Co. subsidiaries continue to account for the bulk of its total revenues, its fertilizer subsidiaries, through which it sells Vigaro, were the largest contributor to consolidated earnings in the third quarter and nine months to July 26.

title: Rockefeller in the South: Problem Said to Remain
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 28Mention the name Rockefeller to most Americans and probably the first thing that comes to mind is money.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: DOLLAR AND GOLD INCREASE IN EUROPE
description: BRUSSELS, Aug. 28 (UPI)The dollar and gold both showed slight increases in light trading today on European money markets.

title: HARDEREDGED MUSIC BY BATDORF,RODNEY
description: John Batdorf and Mark Rodney, appearing at the other End club on Bleecker Street on Wednesday, are considered ore or less soft rockers in that they sing to acoustic guitars and lean toward folky material. But soft is not so soft any more because the Batdorf and Rodney team has a conventional rhythm section backing it with a reasonable amount of wattage between the musicians. It gave the duo, a harder edge to their music, harder than, say, Seals and Crofts, another folkrock pair, whom Batdorf and Rodney resemble.

title: William Bevan, Star Guard On '34 Minnesota Grid Team
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Aug. 28 (AP)  William A. Bevan, an allAmerica guard on the University of Minnesota football team in 1934, died here Tuesday after heart surgery. He was 62 years old and lived at Chicago City, Minn.

title: Roosevelt Raceway Results
description: (OTB payoffs subject to 5% State tax)

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: TROPIC TRIBUTE In a patriotic and picturesque splash of indigenous island color this weekend, the eighth annual West IndianAmerican Carnival is saluting the Bicentennial at the Brooklyn Museum and in an Eastern Parkway parade. Tonight through Labor Day, the celebration will feature events and competitions in music and dance. The program is supported by various business concerns and coordinated with national city and borough support in the arts.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International

title: Hockey Post to Trottier
description: BUFFALO, Aug. 28 (AP)Guy Trottier, who played for teams in both the National Hockey League and World Hockey Association, was named today playercoach of the Buffalo Norsemen, a newteam in the North American Hockey League.

title: F .T .C. Asks Rules to Curb Funeral Home Practices
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28The Federal Trade Commission proposed today regulations that would prohibit a variety of funeralindustry practices from unnecessary embalming to baitandswitch sales techniquesthat the commission said inflict economic and emotional injuries on the consumer.

title: Westminster Abbey Is Running in the Red
description: LONDON, Aug. 28Westminster Abbey needs about $17million for cleaning and restoration work, but inflation is eating into its funds and drying up private donations.

title: BROOKLYN WOMAN IS SLAIN AT HOME
description: A 69yearold Brooklyn woman whose throat had been slashed was found dead in her threeroom apartment by her 9yearold granddaughter who had come to borrow a quarter, the police reported yesterday.

title: 3 Rob Bus Near Baltimore
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 28 (AP)Two bus drivers and seven passengers riding on a southbound Trailways bus were robbed of $600 and jewelry by three armed robbers early today on the Washington  Baltimore Parkway, the police said.

title: Failed Rhodesia Talks a Success to Some in Africa
description: JOHANNESBURG, Aug. 28A summit meeting that fails is usually regarded as worse than none at all. But there is undeniably a euphoric sense of triumph among the leaders of southern Africa's white minority governments following the breakdown of the Victoria Falls conference on the future of Rhodesia.

title: For Star Athletes, New York Is at the End of the Rainbow
description: They were toting brief cases instead of carpetbags, but they had the same thing in mind when they arrived from Hertford, N. C.; Beaver Falls, Pa.; San Mateo, Calif., Atlanta and Santos, Brazil. It's the thing that is causing a crisis in City Hall but a gold rush in other parts of town for New York's expanding new colony of highpriced athletes.

title: Police Plan Drive in Convention Area To Rout Derelicts and Panhandlers
description: A police crackdown is being planned around Madison Square Garden as part of a general cleanup of the area, which has been selected for next year's Democratic Presidential convention, the first one here since 1924.

title: The Worst Catastrophe
