description: BOSTON, Aug. 30 (AP)The Red Cross appealed today for blood donors. Marge Gandolfi, a spokesman, said the blood center here had had requests for 386 pints of blood from Massachusetts hospitals and began the weekend with less than 400 pints.

title: Five Construction Workers Drown in Niagara Falls Tunnel
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N.Y., Aug. 30Five construction workers drowned last night when a tunnel in which they were working suddenly filled with water during a rainstorm.

title: Article 10  No Title
description: TO ORDER announcements of weddings, engagements, births, etc. call The N.Y. Times Classified; Advertising Dept. (212) OX 53311. Closing time for Sunday issue is 6 P.M. Thursday.

title: East German Oarsmen Capture 5 of 8 World Titles at Regatta
description: NOTTINGHAM, England, Aug. 30East German oarsmen went after the one title that got away from them in 1974 today and succeeded at the world rowing championships. They won the eightoared race, the glamour event of the regatta defeating the defending United States crew and five others.

title: Canadian Grand Prix: The Roadblock Was Politics
description: The Canadian Grand Prix canceled Tuesday by the organizers after almost a month of uncertaintywas a victim of politics, according to Harvey Hudes, president of Mosport Park, where the Formula One race was scheduled.

title: Women's Proxy Pressure
description: The stockholder resolution favorite tool of social activists in publicizing such corporate behavior as the making of political contributions or doing business in racially controversial South Africais being turned this fall to upgrading the image of women.

title: AN ALBANY SESSION ON CRISIS IN CITY SET FOR THURSDAY
description: Governor Carey said yesterday that he now planned definitely to summon the Legislalature into session on Thursday to approve either a financing plan that would furnish cash for the city next month or emergency legislation to handle a city default.

title: Of Raw Materials, Raw Statistics and Raw Deals
description: ASPEN, Colo.At school they told the story of the king with seventeen horses who wanted to distribute them among his three sons. He wanted to give half his stable to his eldest son, a third to his second son, a ninth to his youngest. But powerful though he was he could not divide seventeen that easily. Half of seventeen is eight and onehalf, a third is five and twothirds, and a ninth is one and eightninths.

title: Default: A Fearsome but Imprecise Dirty Word
description: Default, one of the least pleasant words in the investors lexicon, was whispered sotto voce for months in New York City by those concerned with municipal finances. Now it is being said out loud, and often. But either way, the concept's capacity to frighten is magnified by how little is known about what will happen if New York City defaults.

title: Body of Unidentified Woman Is Found in Riverside Park
description: The body of an unidentified woman, shot three times, was found lying face down in the grass in Riverside Park off West 116th Street Friday night, the police reported.

title: Letters: Free Lessons For SmallBoat Pilots
description: To the Editor:

title: Angola's White Flight Reflects Fears, But Not of Black Anger
description: LONDONThe Portuguese are calling It the biggest exodus in the history of Africa. They are probably right. Its portions are frightening and Its implications tragic both for a country and A people. Not even the notorious Congo migrations can equal the scale of the whites fleeing Angola at this moment; whereas a mere 90,000 left the Congo in the first six months of 1960, already 200,000 have fled Angola and the total will probably number 350,000 of Angola's estimated 500,000 white population. And all this despite the almost complete absence of racial overtones to Angola's bitter civil war.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: Shares on the New York Stock Exchange advanced sharply last week, although the gain came amid slow trading. The Dow Jones industrial average achieved its biggest rise since the week ended May 2 (when it was up 36.68 points). The average closed last Friday with a gain of 30.58 points for the week at 835.34.

title: Beaches Grow Cleaner As Sewage Plants Rise
description: Swimming at some of the nation's beaches, those vast sandy vistas sure to draw millions of Americans on a final summertime fling this Labor Day weekend, is improving, along with the water quality.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: On Ford
description: Late last winter in New York City I went to bed with the galley proofs of The Best of Corey Ford (Holt, Rinehart & Winston, 266 pages, illustrated, $10), and before I read a dozen pages I was no longer alone and the drab reaches of Times Square beyond my four walls receded.

title: Long Beach Overcoming Its Fiscal Deficit
description: LONG BEACHThe City of Long Beach, which has implemented a series of measures, often controversial, to solve its serious fiscal plight, has been able to make substantial reductions in a $1.[09]million deficit accumulated over the last three years, according to the City Auditor's office.

title: What's Doing in SALVADOR, BRAZIL
description: OVERVIEW  Salvador, the luminous capital of the Brazilian state of Bahia, was founded in 1549 and was the first capital of the country when it was a Portuguese colony. Today it is a strong rival of Rio de Janeiro as Brazil's leading pleasure city. Salvador, with a population of 1.2 million, is about 760 air miles north of Rio, which has 4.6 million people. Both cities are along the Atlantic Coast, and swimming and beachgoing are very much a part of the lifestyle of each.

title: Three Area Shows Attract 5,681 Entries
description: There will be plenty of action for the metropolitan fancier next weekend. Tuxedo Park and Westchester again are being held at Lyndhurst, on Route 9 in ?? and Somerset Hills has shifted from its old Far Hills, N. J., site to the county fairgrounds on Milltown Road in North Branch, N. J.

title: Emergency in India Spurs Crusading, Zealous Mood
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 30 Khakiclad youths from a paramilitary group known as the National Cadet Corps began patrolling New Delhi's bus stops this week, helping to organize people into orderly lines and discouraging what Indians call queuebusting.

title: The World
description: The crisis in Portugal has apparently been heightened, not ameliorated by President Francisco da Costa Gomes's decision to remove his unpopular proCommunist Premier, Vasco Gonalves, and place him instead in charge of the country's armed forces. The President's decision was a political one, an attempt to end Civil disorder and avoid a civil war, but the responses so far have included clear threats of military action.

title: Southmen Defeat Winds For Third Victory, 317
description: MEMPHIS, Aug. 30 (AP)Ed Marshall scored three touchdowns and an action point to lead the Memphis Southmen to a 317 World Football League victory over Chicago tonight.

title: Elderly Harvesting The Seeds of Spring
description: Trudging through the muddy and barren grounds in the northwest section of the Queens Botanical Garden in Flushing, a visitor could hardly expect to come upon a gourmet's garden of delight. But in former dumpwhere a sign points to the Senior Gardensthat is exactly what visitors will see.

title: Bennett Says He Donated $160,000 to the Government
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30 (UPI) Representative Charles E. Bennett, Democrat of Florida, said today that he had given $160,000  including all his veterans disability payments to the Government since entering Congress in 1949.

title: Speer Asserts Hitler Spoke Of Setting New York Afire
description: BONN, Aug. 30Hitler was obsessed with the idea of destroying New York City in a firestorm of bombs as World War II was drawing to a close, according to a new book by his intimate, Albert Speer.

title: Woman, 70, Is Acquitted of Violating Gun Law
description: LOWELL, Mass., Aug. 30 (UPI)A 70yearold woman who has handed out Bible quotations for nearly 40 years has been found not guilty of charges that she violated Massachusetts new gun law.

title: The Professor was better than the Justice
description: Felix Frankfurter came to this country as an immigrant from Vienna at the age of 12, and became one of Harvard Law School's most brilliant scholars, a Presidential confidant and, for over two decades, a major figure on the Supreme Court of the United States.

title: State Will Again Offer Free Telephone Advice to Students Seeking Financial Aid
description: TRENTON  Present and prospective college students encountering difficulties in financing their education will be able to obtain information on available state and Federal grants and loans by calling a tollfree number.

title: WILIER BARROW OF SPERRY DEAD
description: Dr. Wilmer Lanier Barrow, who retired in 1970 as vice president for research and development of the Sperry Gyroscope Company, died Friday in Tuftonboro, N. H., at the age of 71. He lived in Sarasota, Fla., and was a summer resident of Wolfeboro, N. H.

title: Burglar Dives Out Window To Flee Korvette's Guards
description: A burglar who apparently hid in Korvette's store in downtown Brooklyn after it had closed stole 38 wrist watches valued at $3,600 Friday night and then dived through a plate glass window unharmed to escape the store's security guards who had spotted him.

title: JOSE I. ROSILLO
description: Jose I. Rosillo, who retired two years ago as area manager for the American Steel Export Company, died Friday at Bellevue Hospital. He was 67 years old and lived at 3 Peter Cooper Road.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: OSAKA, Japan, Aug. 30 (UPI)American swimmers, led by John Naber and Shirley Babashoff, won all 10 events today on the final day of the Japanese national swimming championships. The team, composed of 12 men and 12 women selected after the Amateur Athletic Union's longcourse championships last week at Kansas City, Kan., captured all but one of 24 events held over three days. No world records were set.

title: At Southampton, Even Together They're Apart
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I. The cream of Southampton gathered under a green and white etriped tent last week in the name ?? But even a worthy cause could not really bring together the summer community, some times known as the swells, and the men and women who are variously described, depending on who is doing the talking, as the natives or locals.

title: Hornets by Astros Down Pirates, 74
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 30 (AP)  Tworun homers by Cesar Cedenohis second of the gameand Bob Watson in a fiverun fifth inning powered the Houston Astros to a 74 victory over the Pittsburgh Pirates today in the first game of a twiightnight doubleheader.

title: Fashion
description: As anyone who has strolled around New York this summer can clearly see, the braless look is very much in evidence under sheer tops and tightfitting Tshirts

title: Sculpture Is Donated To Bergen College
description: PARAMUSBergen Community College has received from the North Jersey Cultural Council a $15,000 weldedsteel sculpture entitled Dominoes.

title: Sideways in Portugal
description: President Francisco da Costa Gomes has only leaped from the fire back into the frying pan by dismissing General Vasco Gonalves as Premier but appointing him Chief of Staff of Portugal's armed forces. The nine officers who have led the campaign for the ouster of the proCommunist Premier have made it clear they will not accept him as their military leader and regard his appointment as illegal.

title: 50Cent Fare? It's 15 Cents in Salt Lake City and Atlanta
description: SALT LAKE CITYEat your heart out, New York City, home of the 50cent transit fare.

title: In China, a New Life For Mongol Minority
description: SILINHOT, China  In northeastern China descendants of Genghis Khan's Golden Horde live in yurts and ride their horses across the rolling grasslands, polelassos in hand, as they have for centuries.

title: Nuptials for Julie V. Graham And Stephen Denny Sargent
description: Julie Verkamp Graham, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Cabal Graham Jr. of Washington, Ind., and Conway, Mich., was married yesterday afternoon to Stephen Denny Sargent, son of Mr. and Mrs. James Cunningham Sargent of New York and Avondale, R.I.

title: How to Report a Doctor
description: To report a New York State doctor who may be a drug addict, an alcoholic or mentally ill to the state medical society's physicians' committee, call (516) 4886100 and ask to speak to a secretary about a sick physician. The secretary will take only the caller's name and number. A committee member will call back for details.

title: Fiscal Troubles Alter Style of City Hall Bureaucracy
description: A young Bronx politician with a trim goatee and a deliberately Machiavellian air, Deputy Mayor Stanley M. Friedman, has gained new importance in a New York City administration that has altered its style considerably as fiscal tribulations come to dominate its activities.

title: MEROLA PRAISES OFFENSE BUREAU
description: The Bronx District Attorney. Mario Merola, said yesterday that his office's special two yearold bureau that expedites prosecution of felony cases involving recidivists and dangerous suspects had won a conviction rate of 95 per cent in cases it has fully adjudicated.

title: Malaysian Reds Kill 2
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, Aug. 30 (AP)  Communist guerrillas ambushed a police supply boat on the Perak River and killed two policemen, security spokesman said today. Two other policemen in the boat were missing.

title: Oil Change From the Lab
description: The 530 million gallons of lubricant that go into automobile crankcases every year may be going synthetic.

title: Labor: Public Aggression, Private Cooperation
description: The Labor Day statements cascading out of union headquarters this weekend conjure up images of an economy gutted by greedy corporations and their servitors in the White House. Unemployment and reduced living standards are the lot of American workers while billions of dollars in tax breaks and subsidies flow into corporate coffers, so goes the union jeremiad.

title: State Mediator Enters U.F.T. Talks
description: A stateappointed mediator yesterday joined the Board of Education and the United Federation of Teachers in their contract negotiations aimed at averting a teachers; strike threatened for Sept. 9, the day after the scheduled reopening of school.

title: Start Now For Winter Blooms
description: The summer sun is on the wane and soon the shorter, cooler days of autumn will be upon us. Smart gardeners are busy taking cuttings of plants that have summered outofdoors to provide compact plants for the winter.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. MOVE HAILED BY CUBAN EXILES
description: MIAMI, Aug. 30Last Saturday, two days after the United States announced a partial lifting of its trade embargo against Cuba, about 200 Cuban exiles carrying signs marched through the street of Little Havana, the Cuban district here.

title: DR.HOOK ROCK GROUP OVERDOES ITS THING
description: Dr. Hook, a group that has had some commercial success in the past, specializes in bad taste and the inside joke. Though this is Bicentennial time, the group's blues about the defecatory habits of the eagle flew along much too long and with little effect. There is also the allegedly improvisational notion that the musicians are meeting one another and their music for the first time, which is as much overdone as their desire to shock.

title: Coast Law Called Hurdle To Offshore Oil Drilling
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif, Aug. 30 (AP)Gov. Edmund. G. Brown. Jr. today signed into law a.bill that is likely to prevent new oil drilling off the Southern California coast until 1978.

title: STAMPS
description: The United Nations has again espoused the cause of Namibia, also known as SouthWest Africa, with a philatelic behest for the termination of South Africa's rule over the little known region at the tip of the continent and for freedom for its people.

title: Jeri Bankoff Plans Bridal in Summer
description: The engagement of Jeri Lynn Bankoff, daughter of Mrs. Sherwin Glink and Victor Bankoff, both of Beverly Hills, Calif., to Gary Steven Firestein, son of Mr. and Mrs. Chester Lee Firestein of Beverly Hills and Newport Beach, Calif., has been announced by the future bride's parents. A wedding next summer is planned.

title: Federico Fellini's FarOut Casanova
description: ROME Casanova makes love to a libidinous nun in a mirrorlined salon which is decorated with Chinesestyle erotic drawings portraying a curvaceous woman and an extravagantly endowed man.

title: FILM VIEW
description: Anyone who goes to the Museum of Modern Arts new film series devoted to the early work of John Ford expecting to be served pearls on a platter will be disappointed. The pearls are there all right, but there is a great deal of oyster and shell to get through. For nearly five decades Ford worked as a commercial Hollywood director. During that time, according to the museum's program notes, he directed more than 130 featurelength films. Some of themStagecoach, Grapes of Wrath, My Darling Clementineare classics. Many mediocre, and some were plain bad.

title: Abrams Spurring P.S.A.L. Fund Drive
description: Standing amid the construction debris at Yankee Stadiums Bronx Borough President Robert Abrams lent his support yesterday to a committee set up to raise funds for the Public Schools Athletic League.

title: Meany Stands Firm on Soviet Grain Deal
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30George Meany, strongly supporting the longshoremen's apposition to loading grain for shipment to the Soviet Union, says that the Russians should not be allowed to manipulate the United Statek grain market to the detriment of the American consumer.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: No arrivals or departures today, Aug. 31 and tomorrow, Sept 1.

title: News Summary and Index
description: SUNDAY, AUGUST 31, 1975

title: National Conference: Cards, Vikings and Oh Those Rams Seem Strongest
description: Eastern Division

title: Strega Nona
description: In this variation on The Sorcerer's Apprentice, Strega Nona, an Italian witch, possesses a magical cooking pot that produces pasta, rather than frogs, princes, water or stone soup. She is both feared and respected by the townspeople. Her supernatural powers include such marvels as curing a headache with oil, water and a hairpin; making potions for husbandhunting girls; and, most important of all, getting rid of warts.

title: 5 TEXAS CONCERNS BATTLE A TRUCKER
description: AUSITN, Tex., Aug. 30Four large trucking concerns and a bus company are trying to run a 28yearold cerebral palsy victim and his small pickup truck off the road.

title: James Tisch Fiance of Merryl Hiat
description: Rabbi and Mrs. Philip Hiat of New York have announced the engagement of their daughter, Merryl Jill Hiat, to James Solomon Tisch, son of Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence A. Tisch of Rye, N. Y.

title: Article 7  No Title
description: Picture Credits

title: Man. 20, Is Shot in Effort To Thwart a Holdup Here
description: A young man who tried to stop an apparent holdup on the Lower East Side last evening was shot in the chest by the holdup man and was later listed in stable condition at Bellevue Hospital.

title: Claudia Elisabeth Praeger Fiancee
description: Claudia Elisabeth Praeger plans to be married in December on Martha's Vineyard, Mass., to F. Williams Sargent Jr., whose father, Francis W. Sargent, was Governor of Massachusetts from 1968 to 1974.

title: M'CARTHY UNIT BARS U.S. CAMPAIGN AUDIT
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30 (UPI)  Former Senator Eugene J. McCarthy's Presidential campaign committee formally advised the Federal Election Commission today that it would not open its files for an audit.

title: 2 More Patients Die at V. A. Hospital in Michigan
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Aug. 30 (UPI)  Two more patients at the Veterans Administration Hospital have died here, raising to 10 the number of deaths that may be involved in the recent outbreak of respiratory failures under investigation as possible murder cases.

title: Endpaper
description: Something there is in me that loves a wall. I like to build them alone or with my 6yearold son, who enjoys carrying stones and sometimes brings the one that fills a gap.

title: THOUSANDS WATCH DE VALERA CORTEGE
description: DUBLIN, Aug. 30 (UPI)Former President Eamon de Valera, dressed in the simple habit of the Carmelite order, lay in state in the great hall of Dublin Castle today.

title: Egypt Agrees With Israel On U.S. Presence in Sinai
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 30Egypt concurred today with Israel's view that the presence of American technicians in the Sinai passes was vital to the success of a new interim agreement between the two countries that is expected to be concluded in coming days.

title: Bells Are Ringing for Elderly
description: BOONTON  High school students here are bridging the generation gap by making daily telephone calls to elderly residents.

title: F.B.I. Says Oswald Threatened Agent
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30 (AP) The Federal Bureau of Investigation disclosed tonight that Lee Harvey Oswald had delivered a note threatening one of its Dallas agents days before the assassination of President Kennedy, that the visit had not been previously reported and that the note had been destroyed.

title: Late TV Listings
description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: McKinley Is Not in Our Future
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30  One of the central tasks for any President is to define the nation's emerging problems and to help structure the ongcing public debate about those problems. Under the best of circumstances, it is a task performed imperfectly. In the Ford Administration, it is scarcely performed at all.

title: The New Chris Evert
description: In the interview tent, a little girl watched wideeyed as 20yearold Chris Evert talked about backhands and money and the pressure that comes from being the world's best woman tennis player.

title: Late TV Listings
description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: SIGHTSEERS GAPE AT GLOMAR BARGE
description: CATALINA ISLAND, Calif., Aug. 30List Sunday a thousand or so vacationers on the beach at Isthmus Cove here were treated to a remarkable sight.

title: Book Ends
description: September. With intimations of fall filtering through the dogday haze, the pulse of publishing begins to quicken. Although the upcoming month cannot be said to be overladen with bounties: it does offer a marked upswing in quantity. October is always an impacted month, but this September is not far behind (see below).

title: Future Events
description: New York's Daughter To Sing Donizetti's Sept. 7After seeing her go mad for Donizetti in Lucia and majestically tragic in his Tudor Queens trilogy, you'll be able to bubble along with Beverly Sills in the New York City Opera's premiere of Donizetti's rollicking Daughter of the Regiment at the New York State Theater to aid the New York City Opera Guild. Written and produced in Paris in 1840, it took seven years to cross to London, where it was in English, as you'll hear it, at the Surrey Theater and, on another stage, sung by Jenny Lind in Italian. After the performance you'll fall in for a Regimental Mess on the Grand Promenade, where a buffet supper will feature boeuf bourguignon and Beaujolais L'Abbaye donated by Sichel et Fits Frres, and go through a dance drill led by Lester. Lanin, bandmaster. Tickets for the opera are $75, $50, $25 and $15. Add $25 for the supper dance. Your mess kit is black tie.

title: A Reminder of a Past Lost Amid Present Preoccupations
description: The great exhibition French. Painting 17741830: The Age of Revolution has one more meek to run before it closes its 10month career that began at the Grand Palais in Paris last November, shifted to the Detroit Institute of Arts for March and April, and began its final showing at the Metropolitan Museum in midJuneaccompanied, all the Way along by critical huzzahs.

title: Free Courses Set In Small Business
description: A free 12week course in basic and advanced training in the field of business management will be available to minority small businessmen at New York City Community College in Brooklyn, beginning Sept. 24.

title: Decline in Enrollment Is Seen in Nassau Schools
description: A gloomy picture of Nassau County with massive declines in its elementary and secondary school enrollments and soaring school taxes has been presented in a new report prepared by the Nassau County Planning Commission.

title: A Gifted Guitarist Is Sculptor, Too
description: WAYNEJulio LugoBurgos, a student of painting and sculpture at William Paterson College, is finding that his talents may help to pay his way through college.

title: Frances B. Hill, W. E. Phipps 3d Have Nuptials
description: The Madison Avenue Church was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Frances Breckinridge Hill to William Eldridge Phipps 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Phipps Jr. of Dallas. The bride is the daughter of George Roy Hill, the movie director who won an Academy Award for The Sting, and Mrs. Hill of New York, the actress Louisa Horton. The Rev. Norman D. Stanton performed the ceremony.

title: Mary Tilney, Barnard Alumna, Wed to Manuel Cords, Lawyer
description: Mary Anne Valentine Munn Tilney, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John S. Tilney of New York and Cold Spring Harbor, L. I., was married at noon yesterday in West Orange, N. J., to Manuel Cords, son of Mrs. Helmut Cords of Princeton, N. J., and the late Mr. Cords.

title: Sports Editor's Mailbox: Giants/Johnson/Olympics
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: Darlene Lynch Wed to Robert Heger
description: Darlene Elizabeth Lynch, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John J. Lynch of New York, and Robert C. Heger, son of Mr. and Mrs. Kenneth W. Heger of Weymouth, Mass. were married here yesterday afternoon in the Roman Catholic Church of St. Vincent Ferrer. The ceremony was performed by the pastor, the, Very Rev. Paul C. McKenna, and the nuptial mass was concelebrated by friends of the couple, the Very Rev. William Kopfman, the Very Rev. Kenneth Sullivan, and the Rev. Raymond Finn.

title: Pity the Poor Producers of TV Series
description: Susan St. James, who costars with Rock Hudson in the Universalproduced policeadventure series called McMillan & Wife, demanded and got a tripling of her salary this summer, to $75,000 per episodeplus other goodies: a leased Mercedes for her personal use, $200 a week for a nanny, and chauffeured limousine service to and from the studio.

title: OILINCOME DROP OF 25% IS LIKELY
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30The managing director of the International Monetary Fund estimated today that the surplus income of the oilproducing countries would be reduced by onefourth this year from last year's level.

title: JOHN ANDRES CARR
description: John Andres Carr, who retired in 1972 as a partner in Pearsall & Co., a member firm of the New York Stock Exchange, died yesterday at Community Hospital in Peekskill, N.Y. He was 68 years old and lived in Yorktown Heights, N.Y., and White Creek. N.Y.

title: Lisa Moseley Is Bride of Saul R. Chandler
description: Lisa Cole Moseley, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas C. Moseley of Darien, Conn., was married there yesterday afternoon to Saul Robert Chandler, son of Prof. and Mrs. Martin M. Lipshutz of Fairfield, Conn. The Rev. Robert N. Back, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony in the Darien Community Association House.

title: AEROSMITH RAUNCH AT SCHAEFER FETE
description: Raunch has always been a favorite descriptive word in rock n roll over the last two decades, signifying a tough, insolent, perhaps sleazy approach to the art form. Aerosmith, a group from Boston, is the latest in a seemingly endless line of groups to use raunch as a way of rock, working well, and well within the limits of early rock aided (and at times hampered) by modern technology in the amplification department.

title: ElectricMeter Restrictions used in City
description: The last major legal obstacle to the installation of individual electric meters for more than 300,000 apartments in the city has been removed.

title: Miss Rost's Hunter Wins Title
description: BEDFORD, N.Y., Aug. 30Robin Ann Rost, a tall, 1[09]yearold junior from Branchville, N.J., was the busiest and most successful rider in the ring today at the windup of the threeday March of Dimes Horse Show at Wayside Farm.

title: Jennifer Jewett Plans Marriage
description: Mr. and Mrs. Charles Wood Jewett of Lyme, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Jennifer Jewett, to Paul Kurt Smith, son of Mr. and Mrs. Leon Paul Smith of Martin, Ohio, where his father is a grain farmer.

title: Dining Out in New Jersey
description: Wine connoisseurs are attracted to this DutchColonial inn, which dates to the late 18th century, because the hobby of Michael Cervino, the ownerchef, is collecting rare vintages. Mr. Cervino estimates that he has 30,000 cases worth about $2million in his temperature, and humiditycontrolled wine attic and cellars.

title: SOME ARMY UNITS IN PORTUGAL SEEM NEAR OPEN REVOLT
description: LISBON, Aug. 30A large part of Portugal's armed forces were close to open rebellion today against the appointment of Gen. Vasco Gonalves as their Chief of Staff.

title: Potter's Field Has Found a Resting Place at Last
description: Gulls wheel against the gray sky, their cries a counterpoint to the muffled sounds of City Island yachtsmen a third of a mile across the water. The birds' shadows ripple over the barren expanse of Harts Island, guarding the mortal remains of the twothirds of a million souls who in the last century or so have become eternal wards of the city. This is potter's field.

title: Music: New City Opera Fledermaus Engaging Revival From Year Ago Performed
description: Johann Strauss's Die Fledermatis was revived in a new production by the New York City Opera a year ago in observance of its centenary. It graced the occasion then, and it was no less engaging in its first performance on Friday night in the company's current fall season.

title: Crisis, Lost Powers Don't Discourage Politicians
description: Who the hell would want to aspire to such a bundle of woe? asked Bronx Borough President Robert Abrams, but rhetorically. In fact, he remains one of many politicians who, it is generally believed, still aspire to the bundle of woethe mayoralty of New York City.

title: Stephen Bair to Marry Lynne Williams
description: Lynne Patterson Williams, an editor for the Chanticleer Press, plans to be married Sept. 20 to Stephen Lewis Bair, vice president and general counsel of the Dell Publishing Company.

title: Miss Batchelor Wins Adams Cup
description: NEWPORT BEACH, Calif., Aug. 29 (AP)Cindy Batchelor of Essex, Conn., captured sailing's Adams Cup for women after four days of racing at the Newport Harbor Yacht Club, finishing first in the final two races yesterday.
